story:
About ME:

I am Srinu Pandranki, 26 years young writer and aspirant Director in Telugu Film Industry. A Bachelor of commerce, I pursued my childhood passion for films, and have made more than ten short films and two music videos. My Short movies have been nominated for a number of international film festivals.

After enjoying an overwhelming response to my critically acclaimed screenplay “X²”, I decided to rewrite it into a novel, my first. I currently live in Hyderabad and am looking forward to my debut Telugu feature film.

You can know more about me at www.srinuthedirector.in.

About X²:

'X²' has been the most compelling story that I have been dying to tell. Hence, not waiting for it to be filmed, I wanted it to be published as a novel. It is 'one-of-its-kind' and I can assure you that it  is simply unputdownable. 

Short Synopsis of my novel:

"A young student. An India-born housewife. A french tourist. Three women, three violent murders. Are they related? The Rusty PAPD detective Kevin Holmes and India-born homicide investigator Shreya Dutt find themselves running a race against time to solve the mysterious X Square connection, set in the background of the university town of Palo Alto."

Thanks to the truly global nature of the world, I myself being in India wrote a novel set in Palo Alto, California, US. And I tell you, once you read my novel you would be shocked at the amount of detailing done that it would be hard to beleive that I have never been there. 

About the campaign:

My novel is ready. Got a publisher. The date, 25th June is set for its release. Here comes the hardest part: "Marketing and promoting it".

Whatever you do, once your book is out, no one would buy it, unless they have heard about it. There are many books out there. Why should they buy mine? Yes, because mine is good. But they wouldn't know them until I tell them. To get them hear about the book, there are some things I have planned. Like the trailer above. 

For a part of audience that would be enough. But there are more people out there. Waiting to hear about this. Who are going to love it once they read. Being a novel that has global appeal, I need to reach out to people across the globe and let them hear about my work. And to reach out to them I need your help. 

I have already spent $3000 for the trailer, for hiring editors to improve the quality of the book, the perk expenses and book launch event that's going to happen soon. You can say that I have spent all I have to shape up the book.

And to sell it I am planning to air the trailer in T.V. and screen in theaters. Also planning to run an internet campaign by placing ads about the novel across the globe. Planning to design posters and place ads in newspapers to get some more attention. For all these plans to materialize I will require $5000 more. 

About the Impact:

X² is not just a mystery novel. It has an inherent touch of humanity in it. It subconsciously tries to inject the idea of how cruel this world could be and how important it is to keep our emotions in check. We, the people of this world, are surrounded by all kinds of intelligence, human and artifcial. But we are lacking Emotional Intelligence. We are achieving many things in day to day life. But keep losing the basic ingredients of empathy towards one another, that differentiates beasts from humans. That's why this novel is so important. And I want more and more people to read it. 

About the Perks:

By Contibuting to this campaign, you will get some benefits and here is the list of those perks.

* With a $25 contribution:

You will get an Ebook, A personal note of thanks from the author and we will shout your name on Facebook page and official website.

* With a $50 contribution:

You will get a book autographed by the author, T-shirt with X² logo and we will shout your name on Facebook Page and official Website.

 

* With a $100 contribution:

You will get 2 Autographed books and 4 T-shirts with X sqaure logo on it with the sizes you choose. Also, we will shout your name in the Facebook page and official Website.

*With a $1000 contribution:

All the perks mentioned above and thanks credit in the author's next book.

*With $5000 contribution:

Author's next novel will be dedicated in your name and also you will get all the perks mentioned above 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't afford to fund money but they can always help us in the following ways:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Use Facebook, G+, Twitter and other social media to get the word about the campaign going.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you.

story:
“Isn’t Jill nice and fat?” my parents’ friends would say when I was a little girl.

I can still hear them saying it. I still remember how much those words stung.

Where I grew up, being skinny was not considered a good thing. Calling someone fat was something people didn’t think anything of. It was not said with malicious intent. It was said with endearment. Having meat on your bones was a good thing.

I did not see it that way.


I was always the tallest child in my class. I remember as a young girl having people pretend the ground was shaking when I would walk by. “Look out! The Earthquake is coming!” they’d say.

And I wasn’t fat! I really wasn’t! I can say that now. I just have a large frame. I was a healthy, tall kid.

But that did a great deal of damage to poor young Jill.

I eventually started putting on weight. I got to the point where my Tim Horton’s staff uniform was the largest size they came in.

I tried every yo-yo diet on the planet. I would lose weight, gain weight, lose weight … lather, rinse, repeat.


Finally, my eldest sister and I made a serious effort to get our weight under control, and we did. I was finally thin. Then, I left my home in Newfoundland for western Canada, where I got tangled up with a man, and I can’t go into details, but it involved me spinning out of control a little bit. It was then that I developed anorexia, even though I didn’t know it at the time.

The disease stole my twenties and took years off my life. I contemplated suicide more than once, and I didn’t think I would overcome the disease.


Luckily, thanks to the support of my parents, I was fortunate enough to get a spot in the Homewood Health Centre, in Guelph, Ontario. If I didn’t get treatment, I have no doubt in my mind that I would not be alive today.


Everything that happened from then until now, I’ve been writing about in my memoir. I don’t want to give too much away, so the main gist of it is that I survived (obviously) to tell my tale. And I’ve chosen to document my story because I promised myself that if I survived anorexia, I would do everything in my power to help others suffering from this horrible disease.

Powerlifting and strength training have helped save my life by solidifying my recovery.

As part of my healing, I started lifting weights. Heavy weights. Instead of obsessing over the weight on the scale, I focused on the weight on the bar. In order to lift weights, I had to eat more. This was an integral part of my healing.


I have worked hard and competed in several meets. I am now officially a gold-medal winning power lifter. I coach classes and individuals at Heavyweights Training Center to get them stronger, healthier and happier and was even an assistant coach on the Canadian Powerlifting Team in Salo, Finland in 2015. I’ve also won Elite Bikini and Fitness Model status with UFE from placing top three in three different categories in Montreal, May of 2015. Status Fitness Magazine also named me one of the 100 sexiest fitness models in the world and Oxygen Magazine gave me a full page in their August 2015 issue as a Success Story.



I have come a long way, though my road has not been without its rough patches and setbacks. I have a lot to share, and I hope that my book can find its way to those who need to read it most: young adults recovering from eating disorders and their friends and family members.

I need your help.

I’ve hired a ghostwriter to help me write my story (I don’t have the time or the ability to write the book myself), but the amount I can afford each month is slowing the process of completing the book. And the longer it takes to write, the longer it will be before I can start recovering my costs and getting the story to those who need it.

My goal is to raise $15,000, which will cover the costs of ghostwriting and editing the book and should help with some cost I will need to promote the book as well. My goal is to eventually be a motivational speaker to young adults suffering from this horrible disease, along with their families. I wish to inspire others to find the will to survive.



If you are unable to donate, I ask that you please consider sharing my campaign with others in your network.

My sincere thanks.

Please visit JillsRules.com for more information about me, to sign up for my newsletter, and to read an excerpt from the book.  

Professional photos courtesy of Judi Stone Douglas at Stone Photography

story:
What is "Redroo's Cotton Adventure"?

''Redroo's Cotton Adventure'' is an adventurous children book about cotton. A young Redroo receives magical seeds and a magic scroll from a Wiseroo. He plants the seeds in a wonderful place called Gundyland and through magic, some paintings appear on the magic scroll... that's where Redroo's adventure starts!

The paintings are teaching Redroo with fun how cotton grows and where he can use cotton for. Together with his typical Australian friends he experiences wonderful adventures in Gundyland, where he learns how to make cotton clothes, cotton candy, a cotton bed and much more.

The story is a beautiful combination of fun, education, magic and friendship which takes every child along in this cotton journey.

A book that we believe has to exist, to make children more aware about the origin of many products we use in daily life. That they aren't just coming from shops, but actually from this beautiful plant! That's all we would like to see, we are not calculating any profit with this book, the estimated costs showed below are only covering the costs. We would like to publish this book together with, for the sake of our children!

''Redroo's Cotton Adventure'' is a 32 pages book with full color illustrations. It is a benefit for your teaching programs, reading groups or as a beautiful bed time story to your children.

About us

Since 2 years we are living our nomad lifestyle, we are living in different places in the world, following our passions and curiosity.

Ali Bigdeli; studied Printing and was the last 10 years working as a book publisher and graphic designer. His passions are culture, books and children.

Madelon Schouten; studied Business Administration and was working as a Facility Coordinator. Besides that she worked for a holiday project for children with special needs for 8 years. Her passions are children, stories and nature.

Mahsa Hedayati; Illustrator. Mahsa is a professional children book illustrator since the last 10 years and she has worked with a diverse amount of children books.

What we need

To publish ''Redroo's Cotton Adventure'' we need your help. Below an overview of the estimated costs from printing till you'll have this book in your hands. With the raise of this money we are only covering expenses, we are not counting on any profit! We would like to share our experience with children and experience this adventure ourself.

If as many people as possible contribute only a small amount, together we are able to realize and get this wonderful book published.

What you get

First of all our gratitude! Thanks to you we got ''Redroo's Cotton Adventure'' into your child's hand or at their schools.
But we would like to give you more then that!
We made unique and excited perks for every amount contributed. So, you are not only helping with publishing this book, but you'll get something unique in return!
Look at the perk list on the right side of this page and pick the one you like.

Why is it so important?

''Redroo's Cotton Adventure'' is a children book that is not only fun and adventurous, it contributes to the awareness of children about the origin of products we use in daily life!

Now a days we often notice that children ( and sometimes even adults) forget or simply don't know where products or certain food is coming from.

How many children are aware where the production process of their favorite shirt starts?

We loose contact with nature, lack of appreciation and interest. Which affects farming and we'll continue the ''fast'' and modern lifestyle we are living. But... with this book we can contribute the opposite! It'll teach your child that their favorite shirt is coming from the cotton plant, even so their mattress and much more. And it makes children aware that hard work is necessary to make these products.

There isn't any adventurous children book like this out there and for this reason we think this book has to exist! For their fun and their future!

Estimated time frame

As soon as we reached the goal with Crowdfunding we will start to publish Redroo's Cotton Adventure. Below we will show you a rough time frame to give you a transparent insight in this project.

We are going to self publish this book, mainly because it is faster and to lower the costs. Since Ali is a professional book publisher he knows the ways and the high quality we are expecting for this book.

The illustrator is working hard to finish the illustrations before the end of December.

At this stage we have contacted the printing house already. Shortly after we'll receive the last illustrations, Ali will finish the complete lay-out of the book. Thereafter we'll place the order at the printing house. From that moment we'll expect to receive the copies at the end of January 2016.

As soon as we'll receive the books, we'll start with sending them to the ones who are rewarded for it. We are expecting to have the books delivered before the 2nd week of February 2016.

Challenges and Risks

The challenges we are facing within this project is mainly time management.

We are relying on transport. Transport from the printing house to us and transport from us to you. To lower the risk of delay, we will make good agreements about sending and posting.

Besides that we are relying on the promised printing time from the printing house. We aren't expecting the printing time would change much consider the contacts we have made so far. When we are placing the order we will make good agreements about expected printing and delivery times.

Any delays of post companies we have to keep in mind, but there isn't much we can prevent about that.

We are professionals and are fully committed to the project, what makes us eager to strive to get the book delivered within the above time frame. We will stay in full communication with each and every one of you about the production and delivery of Redroo's Cotton Adventure and the other perks.

Other ways you can help

Some people would like to help in an other way such as contributing any other amount, having a workshop and so on. We are happy and appreciate any kind of help, so please feel free to contact us on this email: madelon.schtn@gmail.com

And some other people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Spread the word as much as you can, to your friends, schools, libraries etc. The more people know about ''Redroo's Cotton Adventure'' the more chance we have to succeed in publishing this book. 
So please share the link of this project by email, Facebook or any other social media.
Thank you for your trust, together let's make this book your child's new favorite!

story:
What happens when your home is threatened?  When all life is at the mercy of an unknown?  Or worse, that you’re being hunted?

This is Sally’s reality.  Her forest, her friends and her life are in danger.  The river, which gives life to the forest, is disappearing.  But just when she is about to begin her quest, Sally, along with her friend Flutterby the Butterfly, is thrown into the vast ocean.

Intent on rescuing Flutterby and reaching the shore, Sally quickly comes face to face with the monster behind the mystery.  He has huge eyes, huge teeth and the biggest mouth you’ve ever seen.  Monty the Megalodon!

Convinced Monty isn’t working alone, Sally sets out to uncover the plot to destroy the forest.  Along with help from her friends, she eventually reaches the end, possibly of her life.

Will Sally save her home?  Will her friends and life as she knows it survive?  And more importantly, how can a little snake save an entire forest?

Why did you write the book?

I wish I had an interesting answer, but I wrote it because I love to write, and have since I was a child. And I kept remembering my mother saying "Write a children's book!" I had been in the teaching field for so many years, but I never had the interest in writing a book for children, until I returned to teaching after leaving for close to a decade.

Who are your favorite authors?

I don't know that I have a favourite author, but I am drawn to a few. Sidney Sheldon's earlier works. I love P.D. James's settings, and her inspector. Anne Rice and her interesting take on vampires. And Dean Koontz. You never know what you're going to get with him, but you can be sure it will take you to a world you can almost believe to be real.

What was your inspiration for the book?

I've thought about this for a while. I originally wrote Sally for my nieces. Living far from them, I told it to my children at work and was disappointed when only one of them remained for the entire story. I went to a writing seminar and learned a novel needs risk and conflict. I was certain my book was good and left that seminar quite upset. Then I changed Sally. And because of the seminar (Thanks Brian Henry!) I removed some characters, added several others and re-told it to my children. They were cheering for Sally, rooting for the bad guy (some of them), and kept asking me to read one more chapter. That told me I had something.

What books did you love as a child?

There were several. Charlotte's Web: it was very sad when Wilbur said goodbye to Charlotte's children. That scene always brought tears to my eyes. 101 Dalmatians: I read this book so many times I knew the first few pages word for word. Nancy Drew of course. I would have to say my absolute favourite was Anne of Green Gables. The imagery, hopefulness and beauty in 'the lake of shining waters' or 'lover's lane'; I can see those scenes as vividly as if I were standing there myself.

Why a snake? Most people are afraid of snakes since they're not exactly the cutest animals.

Cute is subjective. And to be honest, when I first started thinking about Sally, I did not like snakes! I would literally run away screaming if I saw one. I once found a den of them under the leaves on a hike with my husband. I jumped onto a bench and almost made him carry me back to the van.

Now, after forcing myself to hold one and marveling at its uniqueness, I look for any and every opportunity to appreciate this under-appreciated reptile. 

They really are quite amazing. And so much softer and smoother than human skin! Ask yourself, Why are you afraid of snakes? Did one slither up your leg? Hurt you? Hunt you down and corner you? Probably not. Unfortunately movies have demonized so many creatures unnecessarily, such as snakes, spiders and sharks. I won't be someone who contributes to this. And yes, I do know Monty is a shark but there is more to him as readers will learn!

What's next?

I hope to have the opportunity to travel to schools, day cares, and libraries and inspire children to dream, believe in magic, learn about wildlife, and appreciate Mother Nature. I can still hear my day care children yelling "Miss Michelle, look, a turkey vulture!" They were fascinated and that is what I want to do, expose children to our fascinating world. I have to say that recently one of my husband and my favourite hiking spots, Mountsberg Conservation area, had Turkey vulture awareness day and one of my former children was featured due to his love of the raptor, wearing a t-shirt he made! I was so proud to know something I taught made such an impact.
And of course, finish the second Sally the Snake!

What do you plan to do with the funds you raise?

The money raised will be used for editing, formatting the e-book and print books, proofreading, production co-ordination and marketing, as well as hiring the illustrator.

Thank you for your time and letting the public get to know you.

Thank you for the opportunity. I hope everyone enjoys Sally! She'll be back!
story_txt:
What happens when your home is threatened?  When all life is at the mercy of an unknown?  Or worse, that you’re being hunted?

This is Sally’s reality.  Her forest, her friends and her life are in danger.  The river, which gives life to the forest, is disappearing.  But just when she is about to begin her quest, Sally, along with her friend Flutterby the Butterfly, is thrown into the vast ocean.
Intent on rescuing Flutterby and reaching the shore, Sally quickly comes face to face with the monster behind the mystery.  He has huge eyes, huge teeth and the biggest mouth you’ve ever seen.  Monty the Megalodon!
Convinced Monty isn’t working alone, Sally sets out to uncover the plot to destroy the forest.  Along with help from her friends, she eventually reaches the end, possibly of her life.
Will Sally save her home?  Will her friends and life as she knows it survive?  And more importantly, how can a little snake save an entire forest?
 
Why did you write the book?
I wish I had an interesting answer, but I wrote it because I love to write, and have since I was a child. And I kept remembering my mother saying "Write a children's book!" I had been in the teaching field for so many years, but I never had the interest in writing a book for children, until I returned to teaching after leaving for close to a decade.

Who are your favorite authors?
I don't know that I have a favourite author, but I am drawn to a few. Sidney Sheldon's earlier works. I love P.D. James's settings, and her inspector. Anne Rice and her interesting take on vampires. And Dean Koontz. You never know what you're going to get with him, but you can be sure it will take you to a world you can almost believe to be real.
What was your inspiration for the book?
I've thought about this for a while. I originally wrote Sally for my nieces. Living far from them, I told it to my children at work and was disappointed when only one of them remained for the entire story. I went to a writing seminar and learned a novel needs risk and conflict. I was certain my book was good and left that seminar quite upset. Then I changed Sally. And because of the seminar (Thanks Brian Henry!) I removed some characters, added several others and re-told it to my children. They were cheering for Sally, rooting for the bad guy (some of them), and kept asking me to read one more chapter. That told me I had something.
What books did you love as a child?
There were several. Charlotte's Web: it was very sad when Wilbur said goodbye to Charlotte's children. That scene always brought tears to my eyes. 101 Dalmatians: I read this book so many times I knew the first few pages word for word. Nancy Drew of course. I would have to say my absolute favourite was Anne of Green Gables. story:
My Story... 

It has been many years since I first started dreaming about writing and publishing my own cookbook. I am a lover of good food, and even more so, true health. It was during my healing journey with Crohn's disease and SIBO that I got really motivated to put this book together. I found that in the spectrum of literature written about holistic healing, there are few pieces written by people who have actually experienced major illnesses, and those that were, made a much bigger impact on me. I am at a point in my healing journey where I feel ready and super excited to offer my accumulation of knowledge and experience to those who really need it. My cookbook will include not just delicious healthy recipes for every kind of body, but stories of inspiration and pain, triumph and failure, and lots of beautiful and mouth watering pictures. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

I am being offered an opportunity through my program -- at The Institute for Integrative Nutrition -- to be guided throughout the process of writing and self-publishing, but I'll need some help.

The tuition for the program is $995. It is a 6 month program, and by the end of it, I will have my book completely done! Wow, what a concept! To thank you for your support, I will send you a copy of my cookbook. Maybe even signed by yours truly ;) 

Many Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the ability to contribute to my campaign, it would mean so much to me if you can just share this post with your friends and family, spread via email, on social media, etc.

story:
What is Encantado?

An Encantado is a mythical Brazilian shapeshifter who takes on other forms and hides amongst society near bodies of water.  In Patrick Stevens' upcoming collection, he aims to take on the task of "becoming" an Encantado - shifting shapes and traveling amongst society, using poetry to speak from random, differing (and often dissident) perspectives.  Where will he find these perspectives?  By talking to YOU.

Who is Patrick, and Why Fund Him?

Why should you invest in Patrick's poetry?

  • Patrick Stevens is a published poet, author, and screenwriter, whose works have appeared in various formats and have been reviewed by local and national news sources, blog sites, and writing organizations.
  • Patrick's first collection of poetry, "Rebirth Under Dead Trees", will be published in summer/fall 2012 by unboundCONTENT Press.
  • Patrick's poetry has appeared in such notable journals as Assaracus, vox poetica, Breadcrumb Scabs, Ascent Aspirations, & Instigatorzine. 
  • Patrick is a 2011 Pushcart Prize-nominated poet for his piece, "Calamity Rani".

What's In It For YOU?

So what do you have to gain by helping a young, promising poet bring his second collection of poetry to the world?

  • You can be the subject of one of Patrick's poems!
  • Be listed in the Gratitude/Thanks section of a published collection!
  • Speak to Patrick directly about your life, your views, and what kind of poetry speaks to you.

Please Help!

Whether you can contribute or not, Patrick needs your help!  Get the word out - if you can't contribute monetarily, contribute by telling your friends and loved ones!  Help Patrick's second collection of poetry come to life!

story:
A poet, a priest, a teacher, and a receptionist walk into a bar........

A story about growing up, and finding true friends when you need it most and expect it least. 

Young and Lovely is the true story of four students who changed each others' lives. This book is the result of a chaotic two-year journey. It is about relationships and life; finding ourselves and each other. More importantly, Young and Lovely is a story that simply must be told, because it is so very extraordinary. 

Young and Lovely is about extraordinary people, who overcame seemingly insurmountable obstacles because they came together. It's about perseverance, acceptance and hope.

You'll laugh. You'll cry. You might spill your drink on it, but you'll want to read it again and again. 

And this is where my own journey begins. I need your help. My aim is to chronicle the ups, the downs, the peaks and valleys that brought four strangers together....because they were meant to find each other. My aim is to share this story with the world.

This book has been in the back of my mind since I met these amazing people and I have officially been writing this story since March of 2012. Until very recently, the majority of the book has been scribbled furiously by hand. Old school, I know. Most of the research for it was done unintentionally ~ naturally ~organically and comes as a result of living together as friends, sharing, growing, and supporting each other. 

This book has become one of my passions, and in order to finish it, I must travel to Nice, France where the story of these past two years really begins, and so should end.

And so, now I look to you for your support. I need your help to move this project forward - to write a story that must be told - my story- our stories. 

My plan, with your financial and moral support, is to relocate to Europe for approximately three months so that I can understand the people, places and things that have shaped a life. A worldview. And a best friend. (Awww!) The story simply won't make sense, and won't be finished, until I get to France. And that's where you can help! I am attempting to raise the funds necessary to realize my dreams. To do this, I need your help.

You may say to me......”Let me get this straight...you're going to take my money and go on a trip with your friends? “

And it's true, with your help I will be overseas with two of my favourite people in the world. (Also two of my main characters!) But in addition to having (another) truly incredible adventure, I will be writing, creating, learning, growing, and realizing my lifelong dream of having a story so powerful, and so intensely relatable, that it must be shared. 

This is a story about people who faced their demons, and found their strength.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

I am a soon-to-be-official graduate of King's University College in London, Canada My degree is in History, Philosophy and Religious Studies, which, in addition to making me extremely well-educated, makes me great fun at dinner parties and awkward situations.  I have been a writer my entire life, and with your help I will be able to finish and publish my first novel! 

Throughout university, I volunteered with international students, which helped to shape my conviction that billions of people in the world have fascinating stories that need to be shared by the people who appreciate them. I also believe that passionate, committed, and clever people must realize their natural gifts in order to help make positive changes in the world. (For me, this is not a beauty pageant answer, but a philosophy of living with intention.) 

The is a story for anyone who has ever been judged unfairly, and treated unjustly solely as a result of misperception, stigma, and fear. Simply because they are different. Simply because they are themselves. Because I have faced such challenges in my own life, I feel compelled, and even convicted, to share with the world this story of strong, powerful people coming together to change, heal and grow.   

My PROMISES


I promise I will update ~ Before Nice ~ In Nice ~ After Nice the the progress on my book. Every step of the publishing process. Pictures, Facebook and blog posts, Clever Tweets. Videos...if I can figure out how to make a video (Please be patient, I'm a Historian) 

I am extremely thankful for your support, and believe that creative projects rely on collaboration, sharing, and openness. Every dollar I raise will directly contribute to finishing my book and making it a success! 

Because I believe that the greatest art saves the world, I also commit to spending at least 100 hours volunteering in the communities I visit while abroad.I have put together a perks package that reflects my charming and unapologetic idealism. This is where things get interesting. 

Each one of my supporters will receive a chance (or chances) to vote to decide where I volunteer. Pick a cause that is meaningful and important to you. For instance, if you want my volunteer work to support cancer research, I will gladly serve at a fundraising walk.. If literacy is your passion, I will find a program that teaches children in English. Or even in French if you really want to challenge me. 

Similarly, if you prefer that I teach an inner-city kid how to hang-glide, I suppose I'll have to learn how to hang-glide. And pray. I would have to practice that, too. No matter what you decide, there will be journal entries, and possibly hilarious pictures, for you to see. I appreciate the opportunity to pursue my dreams and passions, and would like to use this trip to make an absolutely positive impact on the world! And because the volunteering will be such a special part of my trip, it will inevitably be featured in my book! So life determines art. In so many ways. 

For your $5.00 contribution, you will receive 1 chance to vote to determine where I do my volunteer service while in France. As well as thanks on Facebook and Twitter. 

For your $10.00 contribution you will receive 2 votes to determine where I do my volunteer service, thanks on Facebook and Twitter, and I will plant a flower in your honour. And next year there will be pictures! Of Your flowers. You can take the credit! I won't tell.  

For your 25.00 contribution, you will receive 5 votes to determine where I do my volunteer service, thanks on Facebook and Twitter, a flower planted in your honour, and donation to food banks in Ontario as a way of expressing my appreciation, and giving back to the local community!

For your 50.00 contribution, you will receive 10 votes to determine where I volunteer,  Thanks on Facebook and Twitter, a flower planted and a food bank donation made in your honour, plus a postcard from me sent when I am overseas.

For your 100 dollar contribution, you will receive 20 votes to determine where I volunteer, thanks on Facebook and Twitter, a flower planted and a food bank donation in your honour, a post-card, and a letter. A real letter. The kind that people used to write all the time. The kind that comes in the mail!

For your 250 dollar contribution, you will receive 50 votes to determine the type of volunteer service I complete, thanks on Facebook and Twitter, a flower planted and a food bank donation made in your honour, a post card, a letter, and official recognition as a sponsor of this campaign on the main page. You will be immortalized. 

For your 500 dollar contribution, you will receive 100 votes to determine how I volunteer, a flower planted and a food bank donation made in your honour, a post-card, a letter, recognition as an official sponsor on the campaign page, and acknowledgements, by name, in the book when it is published! And I'll even make you a character. With a speaking part, and everything!

HOW TO DONATE:

Via Paypal and Credit on the Indiegogo Site

Via cheque.....e-mail me for details

Via E-mail transfer: Youngandlovelythenovel@gmail.com

 

HOW TO VOTE:

-Leave a comment in the Indiegogo Comment Section. Example: Kara, Fight cancer! Love you!

-Leave a comment on the Young and Lovely Facebook Page at http://www.facebook.com/youngandlovelythenovel

-Message me on Facebook: Kara Wickens 

Send me an email: youngandlovelythenovel@gmail.com

 Tweet me @karawickens

So please make a contribution today. Donate whatever you can!  Share on Facebook. Text. Tweet. Tell your friends! Support a starving artist! And support a good cause! 

 Thank you, thank you!, thank you! Merci, merci, merci!

 

 Special Recognition for official sponsors of Young and Lovely, supporters of my book, my project, and of me!

Thank you so so much to my parents, for believing in me always, for helping with my campaign, and for their amazingly generous contribution. 

Thank you also to my grandparents, Joe and Gloria Summers, for their fantastic contribution, and their their support of my adventure!

Thank you to Michelle Summers Henderson (my Auntie) for having so much faith in my project, and for always believing that I could change the world!

 Thank you to Professor John Heng,  one of my professors at King's University College,  my teacher, of so many things, whose support of me is and has been truly extraordinary!   

Thank you to Aunt Gay and Uncle Gerry Lacoursiere, for their belief in, and support of my book and my dream and my project. I am very very lucky to have such a wonderful extended family!

story:
My Dream

My dream is write books and stories that will entertain the masses for generations to come. I want to dedicate my life to developing characters people can’t live without and doing all that I can to help other so the same, but first…

I’d like to do an overhaul on my first book and re-present it to the public and complete its sequel. I am currently working with my artist on new images and have enhanced the detail and quality of the text. If I can get people interested in the first book and create a buzz about its sequel, I should be able to start earning enough money on my own to fund another two installments of this series.

To learn everything you could possibly want to know about the series without actually reading the books, visit these following free sites: http://40daysandnightsofeternalcurse.blogspot.com/,

http://ecbattleground.blogspot.com,

http://www.facebook.com/EternalCurseSeries,

My Goal

My goal is to raise $3,000. I know this seems like a lot to ask for, but I have my reasons for choosing this amount and have faith that the right provision will arrive. This amount is only half of what I truly need, but I have to start somewhere. I also chose this amount because I’m considering the fact that this service isn’t completely free, though it is quite remarkable and ingenious. (200 people giving $15 could do this easily)

My Plan

Publication: First, I need to have my book professionally edited and published, so that it can shine next to all the other published works currently available to the public. Editing and publication includes: formatting, printing, binding, copyright registration, ISBN registration, online and retail sales registration and so on.

Marketing: Next, my book needs to be marketed in a way that helps create a buzz about it and establishes it as legitimate and worthy of purchase. For this, I’m seeking a professional critique from established news outlets and several blogs, and I’m seeking an ad campaign from AuthorBuzz.com. For the review and or marketing to take place, I will need to pay for and complete submission forms, and provide completed galleys of my work.

Distribution: Lastly, I hope to develop a new fan base and distribution arena for my series. If and when, the online, one-to-one, and indie sales of my books pick up, I hope to register them for a national book fair, allowing retail establishments to stock their shelves with my works.

If you or anyone you know is willing to participate in this endeavor, but is not web savvy or does not have a presence on the Internet, please contact me directly so that arrangements can be made.  Toinette Thomas, toijenthomas@gmail.com.

Perks

From this point forward, simply ask yourself if you would like tosupport this endeavor. Then answer yourself with one of the options below. (Spots are limited, so act fast if you see something you like.)

No…$0- I wish you the best in this endeavor, but am not able to lend support at this time.

**Even if you can’t lend monetary support at this time, moral and social support is just as important to me. If you have a Facebook account, please visit my book’s Facebook page and “Like” it, then “Share” it. This would greatly help to spread the word (Don’t be afraid to Tweet about this too (to follow me http://twitter.com/toithomas)).

Yes…Please see side panel for more details and perks ($1, $10, $15, $20, and so on).

***Please allow at least four weeks for processing once the campaign has ended. Perks will not be available for distribution before this time, but weekly updates will be posted.

story:
who we are...

We are WRITING OUR WORLD, a youth led Organization in Uganda working to empower youth voices and inspire young people towards active citizenship. We are currently working with a select group of young writers aged between 17 and 20 years who we have trained in Writing, Debating and Spoken word for the past 3 months preparing them to do a campaign in which they are meeting local peace builders, hear their stories and develop fictional narratives out of them.

These young writers have never been published before and are looking forward to this opportunity when the work of their hands finally gets published in an Anthology. By contributing to this project, you will be enabling not just us as an organization to empower them but also fulfilling the dreams of excited and passionate young authors.


Here is what we need and its cost...


  • Each paperback will cost 2.5 BP and we want to produce 1000 copies.
  • The total cost of the project is 2,500 BP including costs for editing, design and printing.
  • We are going to raise 1,000 BP from our other funding sources
  • We need you to help us raise the remaining 1,500 BP

And the change you create...

Your contribution will ensure that we can settle down and concentrate on perfecting our stories and narratives.

It will also help us to produce a high quality publication which should start a discussion about the role of everyday people who make a difference in people's lives in our communities; these people who often go unrecognized.

We have already set up slam poetry shows, story readings and online show of our work so far on this project in the last 3 months which has been made possible again by contribution from individuals like you!

You can help us finish what we started
.

You can further help by...

We shall be very excited if you can share or tell a friend about our project and tell them to come here and contribute! Indiegogo has been kind to incorporate social media sharing and by spreading the word, you will get us as many wonderful people like you here to support us.

You can also check out our website www.writingourworld.org or facebook page www.facebook.com/wowuganda to see what we have done so far.

story:
Who the what now?

Greetings, Heroes! I'm Harold Cheng, author of RESPAWN: A Gamer's Guide To Life, Love and Destroying Your Enemies.

I've been playing video games ever since I got my paws on a Sega Genesis back in the 90s. To me, those 16-bit graphics were unlike anything I had ever seen, whisking me away to lands of knights, hedgehogs and various movie spinoffs. What adventure! 

That said, it's not surprising to find myself now working as a Computer Graphics Artist, contributing to the very industry which I love so much.

Inspired by the awesome heroes we grew up with, RESPAWN is a quirky collection of lessons meticulously harvested from our favorite video games. Travel to distant locales, fiddle with ancient artifacts and learn the skills it takes to be the Hero you're meant to be!

If you've grown up fighting brutish orcs, navigating through perilous dungeons and prying open magnificent treasure chests, then come join the party! RESPAWN is a love letter to an industry which has given us all so many hours of humour, action and romance and I need your help to really make it shine.

What can you look forward to?

The gold collected will help fund the following:

  • Production of the manuscript
  • Professional proofreading, editing and formatting of the manuscript
  • Porting the book over to its e-book version
  • Printing a charming paperback version and an maginificently regal hardcover version
  • Marketing, distribution and delivery
  • Getting the book lovingly illustrated from first quest to last
  • IndieGoGo and Paypal fees

To thank you, I want you to be part of the first batch of folks to acquire a free digital copy of RESPAWN that you can share with anyone you want! Paperback and hardcopy versions will be personally printed and delivered to you should you decide to pledge a little more. As of now, only the e-book version is slated to be sold in online stores, so get these limited edition copies while stocks last!

Also available are a whole bunch of seriously awesome, one-of-a-kind perks if you really want to be heroic.

Get yourself or your avatar illustrated in the whimsical style of the book! Contribute to the book itself by having your say about how video-games have affected your life! You can even have a special chapter written into the Book about you, your avatar or that one videogame-related story you just need to tell the world!  (with relevant illustration, of course.)

If you need a little more convincing, please follow this link for 3 free chapters of RESPAWN!

The Impact!

In some small way, video games belong to all of us: the animators who make the heroes move, the sound artists who compose the epic scores, to the programmers who ensure a solid code.

They belong to the schoolkid who rushes back home to save the world from imminent destruction, the pro-gamer who exploits every aspect of the game design to win, and even the couples who just want to spend a quiet night in destroying an alien armada. 
With 10% of all proceeds from the eventual sale going to Child's Play, you will not only be showing your love for video games but also how they can change the lives of children in hospitals all around the world.

Bonus EXP!

You don't need to donate money to be part of this grand venture, you can also

FOLLOW us on Twitter!

LIKE us on Facebook!

SIGNUP for our heroic mailing list at www.therespawnbook.com!

story:
Hey You!

To start off the New Year of 2014, I will be traveling to Hong Kong, China! From Hong Kong I plan on visiting Macau, and then backpacking throughout Thailand (to see Chiang Mai, Phucket, and ending in Bangkok). I am ABSOLUTELY ecstatic about this trip!

Why am I doing this?
As you may, or may not know, I am graduating at the end of this year. Between graduating and starting a full time job, I figured January would be a perfect time to do some traveling! After busting my ass off for almost three years in New York City - this is the ultimate time for me to visit Southeast Asia, and possibly do some soul searching (NYC can do that to you, you know). 

Whats my itinerary?
It's still in the works! So far, I'm planning on spending New Years in Macau, then Hong Kong for a few weeks, then travel to destination points in Thailand, to finally end up in Bangkok, where I will fly home.

Why do I need you?
You went to NYU. You grew up in private schools your whole life. Why do you need my money? I don't NEED your money, per se. I am very fortunate and lucky to be able to go on this trip. However, I do want a bit of financial independence, and to be able to fully enjoy this trip - not completely on my parents dime - so as to not feel guilty about it. More importantly, having travelled all over the world I think foreign countries are better enjoyed when you can support the local economy. Eat, drink, shop - not like a tourist - but like a local. I want to enjoy all there is around me to the fullest extent, and I fully believe in putting money into the local economy. It's like saying, "Thank you for having me! This is for you!" This is the important part. This money will also go to my travel expenses - plane tickets, as well as train, bus and boat tickets.

Why should you contribute?
Here's the kicker guys. I never celebrate my birthday. My 21st birthday was a doozy (as were my 20th, 19th, 18th, and 17th, for that matter). Christmas is just "ho-hum" for me. All in all, I dislike the idea of receiving gifts (what can I say, I'm a giver!). However, since I will be celebrating my 22nd birthday in Hong Kong, I figured this could be either a pseudo...

  • Graduation present (my academic career is over as of 2013's end!)
  • Birthday present (1/14)
  • Christmas present
  • or (Chinese) New Year present? - is that a thing?
...either way instead of gifts, I would greatly appreciate your monetary (or moral/emotional) support for this trip!

What I Need & What You Get

To have a fantastic, soul searching, adventure -filled trip, my goal is to raise $570. As I said before, I want to enjoy - eat, drink, shop, and experience everything like a local. In hopes of being completely transparent - no, I am in no desperate financial need. The money will be going towards transportation, food, drink, and to be frank, overall general revelry. However, I DO want to be able to take full advantage of the culture around me. Moreover, I want to be able to share my experience with you! I've invested in a GoPro Hero3 camera, which I will be taking EVERYWHERE. Expect YouTube videos, pictures, Instagrams, etc. Other things to note:

  • In the case that I do not raise $570, I will cry. Just kidding. This amount will go towards the Miss Representation Project - a project I hold near and dear to my heart.
  • Check out the PERKS if you donate a certain amount! Every contributer will recieve not only my gratitude, but also a little something something. 

The Impact

As an Asian-American growing up in the Bay Area I have become extremely "white-washed", and out of touch with my cultural roots. Of course, my family sometimes celebrate Chinese New Year, and we have Dim-Sum and Chinese banquet dinners (and no, I don't mean P.F. Changs), but I do want to be more in tune with my ethnic origin. The Asians in Flushing, Queens loathe me because they can smell the white-washed-Asian on me. Sure, I'm not Thai, nor are my grandparents from Hong Kong, but this is the first step towards "bringing honor to my ancestors"! (as Mulan once said - just kidding, not really). But really guys, this would mean a lot to me if you could contribute. 

Other Ways You Can Help

So you can't contribute some cash money, I get it! Here's what else you can do:

  • Spread the word!! (You can share on Facebook, Twitter, by email, etc.)
  • Suggest a spot! Have a place on your travel list that seems cool? Let me know!
  • Follow my blog, WWW.YOUCANKISSMYSASS.COM where I will be updating
  • Follow my travels on Instagram / Vimeo, whatever you want!
  • Drop me a line! I don't care if you can contribute or not!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hi! My name is Cristian Mihai. I'm a Romanian self-publisher and blogger from Constanta, Romania. I write about art and stuff here.

Last year was a fantastic one. I wrote and published 4 novels, 4 short stories, and a compilation of essays about art and writing. And I wrote over 400 blog posts. I also founded irevuo, an online magazine dedicated to promoting indie artists.

I'm pretty much a one man operation, meaning that I do most of the stuff that needs to be done in order to publish a book, from cover art to interior formatting. Basically anything, except for editing.

I'm a very prolific writer. And I can write pretty much everywhere, as long as it's my living room.

I'm a self-publisher by choice. An independent artist who does all the work himself, and tries his best to make a living out of it.

And, believe it or not, I know how difficult and frustrating the world of self-publishing can be sometimes, especially when books aren't selling very well, despite the overall positive feedback from readers.

That's why the perks are aimed at helping indie artists reach a bigger audience in exchange for a small contribution.

Your contributions will help me make ends meet, keep on writing, and release my future projects. Donations allow me to dedicate all my time to writing, blogging, and doing all the other stuff related to self-publishing.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that people sometimes can't afford to be charitable.

But if you don't have any money to contribute you can help out with a tweet or like. It's really simple. You just have to click on a button. And, trust me, that's enough, and it will really help me towards meeting my goal.

Thank you,

Cristian Mihai

story:
Excerpt from chapter one, Racing to Red Rock River

Every morning, the Sun awoke and began his slow ascent over the great continent of Ka'lanna, banishing the night sky and the darkness that had unleashed themselves across the land in his absence. As the Sun's golden beams fanned from the eastern horizon, all forms of life began to stir and awaken from their slumbers. Sunlight began to warm the villages of humankind, and the people of the world faced the new day with the warmth of their star shining down upon them. Once the Sun made his way halfway through the sky above Ka'lanna, he would slow his daily journey, coming almost to a stop. This happened where, the rolling hills, grassy plains, and woodlands all danced in harmony; bathing in the warmth and the light.

The Goodwind tribe lived at the mystic intersection where all the terrains blended together and became one land. They were the only humans who still honored the blessed ways of Sehebre. When the sun reached the outskirts of their village most of them still slept, but the early risers awaited each morning silently in anticipation, for the ones who guarded the nighttime fires had recently surrendered to slumber. The early risers stood frozen in a meditative stance, almost as if they had removed themselves from time. In their minds they imagined themselves as beaming balls of light, sending their love to everyone they cared about, to everyone they hoped to protect from the plague of duality. 

The sunbeams kissed the animals inhabiting the wood, darting along, dancing in the forest, creating light and casting out shadows. The animals marveled as the flowers instantly bloomed when touched by the powerful light. Tribe members slowly awoke from their meditative states, taking in the wonderful and fresh smells of a new day. Bright green grass shimmered as the dew of the night before evaporated, and the new day had officially begun for humans and animals alike. 

This crisp fragrance drifted in the wind. The Sun finished passing over the rolling hills, moving up and down between all the spaces and caves, causing the last of the darkness to flee. By this time most of the other tribe members were awake and slowly beginning their day, all were waiting the magical moment when the light reached the highest point in the area, a place known as Sehebre's Finger. Once the new day's light found this point, it burst across the valley, reflecting like an immense galactic waterfall, spilling it’s warmth and brightness across the sky, igniting the entire village in a mirage of golden flames. With all his glory the Sun shined brightly over the village of the Goodwind tribe, blessing them for honoring the ways of Sehebre.

My Journey, The Monomyth Behind Alynia Sky

When I was seventeen and started creating this project, I didn't know what I was getting myself into. I was a young man who liked Dungeons and Dragons and Heavy Metal. Writing had become my primary coping mechanism for dealing with my mother's breast cancer. I remember hiding in the basement for hours, listening to my favorite bands and letting my imagination whisk me to a place I called The Land of Alynia. I had no idea that it would stay with me all these years. I had no idea that my dream would eventually be to empower girls.

After my mother died in January of 2001, I found my life in shambles, and I went to a dark place. I became a negative person. I cared only about myself. I was the only person in my circle. One woman, my godmother, held on to me. She became my lighthouse, and over the years, she helped steer my ship back to the light.

Alynia is the combination of my mother’s and godmother’s names, with the -nia at the end in tribute to C. S. Lewis and his works, The Chronicles of Narnia. Sky appears later. Don’t worry; I’ll tell you why. I can tell you that I adore the way of life and the spiritual practices of indigenous peoples.

Back to 2001—I was in a dark place, and I imagined several characters, many of whom you’ll meet throughout the Alynia Sky series. They needed a place to live, so I sent them to a land called Alynia. I developed cultures, tribes, and all sorts of species. They needed a plot. I created a girl named Molly, based off my little sister. Molly’s dad had just died, and she ran away from home and somehow ended up in Alynia. Unfortunately, for Molly, she showed up right after all three of Alynia’s queens went missing. Then, I started outlining and writing.

I spent years working on the book, Alynia: A Land of Lost Queens. I even joined the Society of Creative Anachronism to do research. I remember that one night, I dressed in full garb and jumped in a lake. In hindsight, it was a horrible idea. I wanted to write about a lake that was a portal to the Moon. I had to do it! The book was my coping mechanism, but I wasn’t ready to be healed, so the project was shelved.

At some point, I decided I wanted to understand why my mother was taken from me and what happens to us when we die. I started down my spiritual path. I read about God, Jesus, Nirvana, Buddha, and Allah. I read every book on religion I could get my hands on. Then, I started to meditate and participate in sweat lodges. Something else started to happen; I began to care about others—not as much as I do today, but it was a start. My circle grew to include friends and family.

By the time 2007 ended, I had traveled to many places. I had spent a summer volunteering at the Omega Institute in upstate New York. I had graduated from the Atlanta School of Massage. I had even become a father. That’s right—on July 28, 2007, my life changed. My daughter was born, and she was named Alynia Sky—Alynia, to honor my mothers, and Sky, to honor the Native American heritage from her mother’s side of the family.

During massage school, I had written a short story, A Gift from an Eagle, which was going to be an illustrated children’s book. As I do with many projects, I dove right in and took it far. The first year after Alynia was born, things between her mother and me didn’t work out. They moved to California (don’t worry; they moved back), and I shelved my project.

Again, my life fell to pieces. I was in a funk. I even quit my job. One fateful day, I went to a bookstore where I met a woman who inspired me to create a powerful character who could change the world. Just like that, the woman came into my life, changed it, and disappeared. Because I’m named after a book, Ben Hur (my name is spelled differently), I decided to create a character named Alynia Sky. It makes sense now, doesn’t it?

Now that I had Alynia Sky, I needed a home for her, so I sent her to the world Alynia. Because the character was named Alynia, I decided to change the land to, Ka’lanna. Now that Alynia had a home, she needed a storyline; in comes A Gift from an Eagle. I believed that it was a good start, but I wanted an epic story, one my daughter would be proud of. I am very proud to be Ben Herr; it is a very epic name.

Now, timeline wise, we’re in fall 2009, and I had spent an entire year outlining and writing and smashing everything together. Again, I ran into the woman from the bookstore. She was a volunteer activist from an organization called RESULTS. She invited me to a meeting, and because she had changed my life, I thought, why not.

I was hooked after my first meeting. I became aware of global problems and solutions. I learned about microcredit loans. I learned that at the time, 72 million kids weren’t going to school. These people were trying to fix it. Amazing!

RESULTS taught me many skills: public speaking, making cold calls, setting up major events, and writing letters to the editor. Several times, I even met with elected officials or their staff. The most important thing RESULTS taught me was empathy. Again, my circle grew. On the downside, I stopped writing.

In the fall of 2010, because of some close friends I met through RESULTS, I got into collecting art. One night, we went to Doo Gallery, and I saw a piece of art that reminded me of Alynia Sky. I bought it, and at that moment, I knew that one day, the artist would do the book cover.

I was working hard, spending time with my daughter, and collecting art. I was content living life. A few more years passed, and I had all but forgotten my book series. It was in me. With the motivation of people close to me, I tried to get it back, but nothing ever felt right.

This spring, something clicked, and I woke with the thought, now or never. Since then, I have been working nonstop. All year, all the right people have come along. Now, you are here, in the moment when I need the most support.

My story is my journey, and somewhere along the way, I created a beautiful character, Alynia Sky, who can be a positive role model for girls.

It isn’t about me or my book. It isn’t about a brand. It is about a movement. It is about instilling our youth with positive virtues. It is about helping our children make the right decisions down their paths of self-discovery.

Will you help me fulfill my dream?

"About half of seven-year-olds want to be president, but by the time children hit their teen years, that aspiration falls by the wayside for girls. Our appearance-focused environment may play a role in how a girl thinks about her future" -Miss Representation

I would like you to meet Alynia Sky!

"Alynia Sky: The Beginning and the End" is a whimsical coming-of-age story about Alynia, a thirteen-year-old girl and member of the Goodwind Tribe. Alynia shares a natural kinship with birds, from which she learns much. Her best friend and fishing companion is a rooster who provides comic relief. Unknown to anyone, this rooster is so much more than he seems. Inspired by an orphaned songbird, Alynia neglects her studies and responsibilities to daydream of flying. 

On the eve of her fourteenth birthday, she receives a vision to seek out Daybreak, the King of Birds, to ask him to teach her to fly. Unknown to Alynia, the vision has a much higher purpose. 

"Alynia Sky: The Beginning and the End" revolves around Alynia, her family, her tribespeople, and a variety of avian characters dealing with the events set in motion by an ancient race. It is the first installment in a young-adult fiction series that deals with the issues of gender equality and social justice.

Alynia Sky: Reflections

In the first book, The Beginning and the End, the theme is self-discovery. Alynia Sky: Reflections, is a FREE companion guide for the book. Once we're up and running, anyone will be able to download it from the official Alynia Sky website. The Reflections guide is a chapter by chapter, breakdown of the book containing exercises, discussion topics, and fun facts about the book. 

The function of Alynia Sky: Reflections is to encourage young girls to discover themselves, their dreams, and their passions. It will help them unlock their potential.

“Invest in a girl, and she will do the rest." -The Girl Effect

I have identified several Subject Matter Experts; teachers, social-workers, psychologists, young-mothers, old-mothers, and even a couple of young girls. Once the book is printed, I will distribute copies to these individuals, along with a outline form for each chapter. Once all the forms are collected, I will compile the information, and create the Reflection Guide. I hope to have this portion of the project completed and online by February 2014.

Alynia Sky 2010

Where your money will go

If we reach the $10,000 goal, I will have $9,300 after IndieGoGo's fees.

The prize packages were designed to cost approximately 30% of the donation. 

Packages with original art - 50% goes to the artist.

After prize packages and shipping, I will have $6500:

  • $3500 to print 1000 additional books
  • $1000 for promotional materials and misc.
  • $2000 to finish paying people to complete the project

Things you should know

What I've done so far this year:

  1. Critiqued the manuscript and hired editors
  2. Directed a photo shoot
  3. Produced a promotional video
  4. Compiled a list of independent bookstores on the East Coast 

The Plan:

I already have several local bookstores are are interested in carrying my book, or hosting events with me. I will spend the rest of 2013, and the beginning of 2014 exclusively focusing on promoting the book in Georgia and online.  Around February 2014, I will take a couple weeks off work and stop by all the bookstores on my list, giving them information about my series, and asking them to carry it.

Right now I'm also in the process of mailing out 1000 letters to 1000 high schools, asking if their student newspapers will review my book. You should have seen the look on the woman's face when I asked to buy 1000 stamps... priceless!

If the campaign is extremely successful, I will scale everything up. I will get book displays, and increase inventory. I will shift my focus to the entire country, and not just the East coast.  If the campaigns fails, I'll scale everything down. I will get this done! 


What you get

Since I have been working on Alynia Sky for a long time, I had plenty of time to meet the right people and come up with ideas for merchandise. Since the project is about unlocking potential, I'll unlock designs for you to choose from as funding goals are reached. 

  • $1000 in funding, I unlock new necklace designs
  • $2500 in funding, I unlock new photo designs
  • $5000 in funding, I unlock T-shirt designs
  • $10000 in funding, all books get autographed and dedicated

As the goals are met, I'll post the new designs for everyone to see. Once the campaign ends, I'll email everyone an order form. If the form is not returned by December 1st, 2013, you'll get the original designs. They are as follows:

  • Necklace: Image of Alynia on cliff
  • Photo: Image of Alynia on Cliff
  • T-shirt-:Alynia Sky logo
  • Poster: The book cover
  • Id case: A girl and her owl (pictured above)
  • Sticker: What can one girl do?


The cover, by Stephanie Anderson. It is still a work in progress, 18in x 24in

Sunlight began to warm the villages of humankind, and the people of the world faced the new day with the warmth of their star shining down upon them. Once the Sun made his way halfway through the sky above Ka'lanna, he would slow his daily journey, coming almost to a stop. This happened where, the rolling hills, grassy plains, and woodlands all danced in harmony; bathing in the warmth and the light.The Goodwind tribe lived at the mystic intersection where all the terrains blended together and became one land. They were the only humans who still honored the blessed ways of Sehebre. When the sun reached the outskirts of their village most of them still slept, but the early risers awaited each morning silently in anticipation, for the ones who guarded the nighttime fires had recently surrendered to slumber. The early risers stood frozen in a meditative stance, almost as if they had removed themselves from time. In their minds they imagined themselves as beaming balls of light, sending their love to everyone they cared about, to everyone they hoped to protect from the plague of duality. The sunbeams kissed the animals inhabiting the wood, darting along, dancing in the forest, creating light and casting out shadows. The animals marveled as the flowers instantly bloomed when touched by the powerful light. Tribe members slowly awoke from their meditative states, taking in the wonderful and fresh smells of a new day. story:
My Story


Hi. My name's Zachariah Wells; I'm a writer based in Halifax, Nova Scotia. I'm the author of two poetry collections, Unsettled (2004) and Track & Trace (2009), and I've been invited to read from my work at the Linares International Literary Festival this March in Mexico. The festival is covering my room and board while I'm in Linares, but I have to come up with airfare to and from. I have bought my ticket and I applied to the Canada Council for the Arts for a grant to cover the cost, but they have rejected my application on the grounds that the Linares festival is not a "large" one. And I suppose it isn't, compared with other festivals, but it represents a very rare opportunity for me to get exposure for my work outside of Canada, which is huge to me, personally.


In addition, the festival has requested that I come with ten of my poems translated into Spanish; to that end, I have hired a professional literary translator. I will also be losing income as a result of being out of the country for a week.


So: your help would be enormously appreciated.


The Impact

If I can't raise funds to pay for my travel and translation costs, then the money will have to come out of my family's general revenue. I work seasonally and on a freelance basis and my wife, who is also a writer, is a substitute teacher in a very crowded work market, so we are not wealthy at the best of times, but especially not at the moment. Technically, we are living below the poverty line, but we live simply and we are luckier than many people in that we don't have a lot of debt. So this isn't a charity or pity case; I'm just trying to come up with a creative way to fund my work that benefits myself, my family AND my supporters. Win, win, win.


What I Need & What You Get

I have set a goal of $1500 to pay for my transportation and translation expenses.


This won't cover 100% of my costs, but I don't want to ask for too much. Any funds raised in excess of my goal will go towards covering lost income and/or will be put towards my future literary endeavours--and will help pay for the AWESOME PERKS you can claim in exchange for your generous support of my campaign.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you support my campaign, or would like to but can't spare the cash (believe me, I understand!), please help me spread the word by means of email, blog and social media. Every bit helps.

IMPORTANT UPDATE: ON THE EVENING OF FEB. 11, I RECEIVED THE VERY BAD NEWS THAT LOCAL GOVERNMENT FUNDING FOR THE LINARES FESTIVAL WAS PULLED WITHOUT WARNING. 

PARTICIPATING WRITERS HAVE RALLIED IN SOLIDARITY, AND I WILL STILL BE GOING. BECAUSE OF THIS CHANGE, I WILL NOW BE DONATING ANY FUNDS IN EXCESS OF MY GOAL TO COLIN CARBERRY, THE FESTIVAL ORGANIZER, TO HELP COVER SHORTFALLS CAUSED BY THE LINARES GOVERNMENT'S ILL-TIMED AND ARBITRARY ACT. --ZW

story:
Short Summary

My name is Matthew Kowalski, or Luminosity what ever you prefer. I have been dreaming and working on visions and internal prophecies pushed forth from the active mind dreaming reality. I know hope and despair, love and hate and the very many dichotomies that I declare unities. For understanding of these things comes in a completion in a full circle a wholeistic experience that is taken in and possibly transmitted. I have been creating this work out of a need, an internal voice that keeps pushing me ever forward, and yet no matter how fast I run to the destination. It always asks more of me, to move faster to dream bigger. So dream a little dream for me and help me to make this mission a success.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am going to use this money to buy art supplies to complete work.
  • Every contributor will also get a copy of the work sent to their email address thank you one and all.
  • If you donate any amount I will put you down as a contributor with a the title of your choice and your name or a name of something else you care about in the final pages of the book. 
  • The top ten contributors will be able to send me a word and I will create a work that I will share with them based on this term.
  • The number one contributor will be sent a physical unique work.
  • If I do not achieve my goal I will still invest what has been donated to the work, and I will still finish the book, I thank you all for your consideration and I know that we can make it happen together.

The Impact

I live in Michigan, and it is a place of hopelessness and hope and I do my part the only way I know how which is to be the full embodyment of myself. That is the best that any of us can do, and by being this avatar of the internal I we sing the universes song, and nature finds a way. So I will as I have always done work for you, and work for me, a complete unity of action, a fitness to purpose in a grand emergence.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

In the mean time enjoy the images that I have colleted and shared on pinterest.

http://pinterest.com/lumiosity/

I am told  Indiegogo has share tools use them, please!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
A colorful, funny children's book for a great cause

Hi! I'm Maya Zankoul, a Lebanese illustrator. Over the last few years I've published several books about life in Lebanon.

As you know, 2020 was a difficult year for us all, but especially for children in Lebanon. Their life was turned upside down, and basic things like feeling safe, playing with other children, and discovering their surroundings, became forbidden to them.

This is why I decided to publish my first children's book: "The Story Of The Grilled Cheese Sandwich" (قصة عروس الجبنة المحمصة)

The book is based on a story I tell my 3-year old daughter at dinnertime, and she loves it and finds it very funny. I'm hoping the book will bring a smile to other children her age, too! It tells the story of a little girl who traveled the world through the grilled cheese in her sandwich that kept stretching, stretching, and stretching!

The book's purpose is to widen the imagination of children, to help them travel outside the confines of their homes during these tough times, and to support them in dreaming for a brighter future.

Goal

I will be printing 500 hardcover copies of the children's book with a local Lebanese printing press, using high quality paper and ink. The size will be child-friendly so they can read it alone, and with their parents, too! The book can be enjoyed by children aged 1 to 6 years old.

The total cost of this project, including the IndieGogo additional 5% and processing fees is $1,890. You can participate in the project by purchasing any of the rewards mentioned below.

The Rewards

One signed printed book + Ebook + Audiobook: $29

  • One printed hardcover book, signed
  • Downloadable colored PDF ebook + English translation
  • Audiobook in Lebanese
  • One book for you, one book given to an underprivileged child

Two Signed printed books + Ebook + Audiobook: $56

  • Two printed hardcover books, signed
  • Downloadable colored PDF ebook + English translation
  • Audiobook in Lebanese
  • Two books for you, two books given to underprivileged children

Signed printed book + Beirut New York + Amalgam vol. 2 + Ebook + Audiobook: $87

  • One printed hardcover book, signed
  • Downloadable colored PDF ebook + English translation
  • Audiobook in Lebanese
  • One book for you, one book given to an underprivileged child
  • One "Beirut - New York" book
  • One "Amalgam vol. 2" book

Three Signed printed books + 3 bookmarks + Ebook + Audiobook: $95

  • Three printed hardcover books, signed
  • Downloadable colored PDF ebook + English translation
  • Audiobook in Lebanese
  • Three books for you, three books given to underprivileged children
  • Three bookmarks
  • One activity + coloring book

Six Signed printed books + 6 bookmarks + Ebook + Audiobook: $177

  • Three printed hardcover books, signed
  • Downloadable colored PDF ebook + English translation
  • Audiobook in Lebanese
  • Six books for you, six books given to underprivileged children
  • Six bookmarks
  • Activity + coloring book

Ten Signed printed books + 10 Bookmarks + Ebook + Audiobook + Zoom call with the author: $357

  • Ten printed hardcover books, signed
  • Downloadable colored PDF ebook + English translation
  • Audiobook in Lebanese
  • Ten books for you, ten books given to underprivileged children
  • Ten bookmarks
  • Activity + coloring book

Note: In the event of the campaign not reaching its goal, all your money will be refunded to you.

The Impact

By participating in this campaign, in addition to supporting my work as an illustrator, you will be supporting the Lebanese community with the following:

  1. With every book you buy, I will donate a copy to an underprivileged child
  2. All proceeds of the book sales will go towards buying gifts from local Lebanese manufacturers, and donate them to underprivileged children this December. Gift distribution will be facilitated with the help of the NGO Right To Play, and gifts will be purchased from manufacturers Bildits and OTO.
  3. You will therefore be supporting a child to engage in play, which is essential for their development. Being warm this winter and having food on the table are, of course, essential, but for children, having the chance to play is just as important.

Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you're not able to contribute to this campaign today, that doesn't mean you can't help.

  • Spread the word to your friends and followers about this campaign by sharing it
  • Personally reach out to people who you think would love this project and support it

Thank you for your support. Let's brighten up children's days with this project together!
