story:
Meet the Author

Candi Fox is a hardworking writer from the Midwest. Growing up on a farm in rural Indiana, Candi became interested in the paranormal over a decade ago. As her interest grew, she studied the occult, Wicca, and many other paths. Finding friends who shared her interests,  Candi & company respectfully explored haunted areas, sights of mystery and even the occasional grave yard at midnight.  This past year she moved to Oklahoma, and is currently exploring the mysteries of her new home state. 

Candi has written for the Examiner, the national online magazine for over two years. Recently, she was asked to write the foreword for a famous paranormal author, and she is proud to have had her own online radio show for over three years.

The Book

Midnight Reigns is a paranormal thriller with a sexy edge. The young protagonist, Viviane, loses the things she found most important in her life: her boyfriend, her Great Grandmother and her life as a dancer. Broken, she moves far away from the rest of her family and shuts down her ancestral gifts.

A killer is stalking her killing young women in a horrific fashion.  Will Viviane be the next victim or will she unlock the gifts she closed off and save herself.

Enter the world of the supernatural where demons, vampires, werewolves and more lurk in the darkness as well as the daylight. Will the “sleepers” ever find out about the paranormal happenings that go on around them or will they be forever oblivious.

Do you really want to know what goes bump in the night? What lurks under your bed, or what hides in your closet? 

I dreamed this book for weeks before I began to explore where Viviane's journey would take her. In the darkest hours of the night, these characters came to me. They want to be known; they want to tell their tale.

The Impact

Funding this book will allow me to indie-publish. What does that mean? That means that as the creator I get full creative control of the book, the edits, and the artwork. I become my own mini-publishing machine. The creation that I dreamed will come to life, and hopefully entertain thousands of people around the world.

After much research and number crunching, I came up with a $20,000 budget to supply: printing, advertising, a professional editor, graphic artist, AND I have Audie Award winning actor Phil Gigante on board to do the audio of this book. An audio book, however, means studio time as well as funding a producer for the recording of the book.

I am humbled by the generosity of my friends in their support in shaping this project. What I intend to do is finish it. This is where each of you comes in. With your help this project will come to fruition. Together we can make it come to life. Take the journey with me.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in other ways by sharing this campaign on Social Media sites. Facebook, twitter, and the dozens of other sites available all help to make this a reality. Sharing is important in so many ways. Please take the time to use the tools provided to share on your Social Media sites.

story:
Story of my book: 

BBB: Brains, Beauty, Boss examines the careers of thirty Forbes 30 under 30 women, and analyzes their unique pathways to success.

My name is Barbara Euripides and I am the author of BBB: Brains, Beauty, Boss. I wrote this book because I wanted to share firsthand accounts from successful women about their journeys, and what it took for them to make it onto the Forbes 30 under 30 list. Through interviews from industries ranging from Finance, to Media, to Healthcare, my book provides success stories from fascinating different perspectives. Through expanding upon the different experiences of Forbes 30 under 30 women, I hope to inspire the next generation of women entering professional roles, and to provide meaningful advice for entrepreneurs across all fields.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will learn about unique pathways to success in modern day times, understanding that there is not one formulaic avenue for greatness. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn about how the workplace is evolving, and how you can set yourself apart in order to excel.

You will love this book if you enjoy hearing about different routes to success, and why unconventionality is so important. 

BBB: Brains, Beauty Boss speaks to young females in college and entrepreneurial individuals who want to grapple with overcoming obstacles in the workplace and learning more about the meaning of success in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that BBB: Brains, Beauty, Boss inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How do you define success?

What are the most common trends amongst successful females?

How is the workplace evolving for women?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing female empowerment, success stories, and shifting ideas in the workplace will change us all for the better.

The Book - BBB: Brains, Beauty, Boss

The book is written in three parts:

Part [1] contains the introduction + Chapter 1. In the introduction, I give an overview of the challenges that women in the workplace face, and I provide insight towards why I decided to write this book. I also give an overview of how Imposter Syndrome manifests in many forms that you may not even realize.

Part [2] contains Chapters [1-12]. In these chapters, I dive into the unique stories of different Forbes 30 under 30 women. Each chapter examines at least one Forbes 30 under 30 woman, and you will be able to hear her story, understand her pathway, and learn about how her story connects to greater themes about females in the workplace.

Some of the fascinating people I had the chance to interview included Amy Odell, the former editor of Cosmopolitan.com, Samantha Fishbein, one of the co-founders of the multi-media brand Betches, in addition to Sally Nuamah, award-winning director of the documentary, HerStory.

Part [3] contains Chapter [13]. In this chapter, I compile takeaways from the unique accounts of Forbes 30 under 30 women together. In addition to highlighting common trends shared amongst these successful women, I dive into how women in the workplace can overcome obstacles like Imposter Syndrome.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Fall 2020

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Barbara Euripides is a rising senior at Duke University who is majoring in Public Policy, and pursuing an Innovation and Entrepreneurship Certificate. She has held various internships across the financial services industry, and she is very passionate about the intersection between current events and the financial markets. Barbara holds various leadership roles at Duke University, ranging from Fiscal Policy Advisor of Duke Student Government, to Teaching Assistant of an Economics course, to committee member of Duke Association for Business Oriented Women. Barbara is a strong advocate for promoting women in business and diverse, inclusive workplaces.

"I decided to write this book because I have always been very interested in the power of unconventionality in careers, and what it can lead to. As an undergraduate student, I have seen individuals enter a multitude of pathways, following career paths from very different perspectives. I have always been very interested in the Forbes 30 under 30 list; this list provides a strong baseline for high achieving individuals in the modern day workplace. In order to learn which practices helped women excel to reach this list, I decided to interview them to not only share their stories, but to also inspire the next generation of young female entrepreneurs. Outside of my passion for story telling, I thoroughly enjoy traveling and learning about different parts of the world. I am a second generation Greek-American, and I can speak Greek, Italian, and Spanish."

For more information you can connect with Barbara at bme18@duke.edu, on Facebook, on Instagram @barbara_ee, or on LinkedIn. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BrainsBeautyBoss and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Barbara Euripides

story:
The Golden Pond

I am Chars Bonin, a filmmaker and storyteller from Minnesota.  About 10 years ago, while reading a book to my 1 year old son, I decided that I should make a series of children's books that teach kids good life lessons.  I chose to have animals living on a pond, with the characters Harry and Harrietta Rabbitson (Rabbits), Carl Croaks and Rhonda Ribbit (Frogs), Nora Nibbler and Tommy TwoSlaps (Beavers), Sarah Squawks (Bird), Mr. Galapagos (Turtle) and Growles (the Bear).

Now I am turning 50, and have 3 more boys.  Life has gotten in the way of my getting these books made.  My youngest child is now 3 years old, and I am hoping to have the first book published in time that he can enjoy the lessons of "The Golden Pond".

I am looking for your help.  I have the first three stories ready. "Growles the Bear", "Mrs. Rabbitson's Special Day" and "The Wrong Way Tree".

How to help get the first book made? "Growles the Bear".

I need to raise as much of the money as I can to get "Growles the Bear" made.

It will cost about $10,000 to get each book made. This will allow me to get an illustrator to bring my story to life, get the book published, and have a little marketing to get the word out about how to get copies.

Donations of any amount will be welcome and appreciated, but I have a few perks that I am offering at different levels of support.

$10- $40 will get you a 10%- 25% off coupon when the book is ready for order.

$50 will get you a copy of the book signed by the author.

$100+ will get you a copy of the book with a personalized message from the author.

$2,500 (4 available per book) will get a short dedication of your choosing, as part of the print in the book.

If I do not raise the full amount to get "Growles the Bear" completed.  I will use your generosity towards paying the illustrator and getting as far along as I can.  I will then personally contribute to complete the story of Growles.  I really want to get this first book made before I turn 51 years of age.

Your Generosity could have a Huge Impact

With life lessons coming to children from "The Golden Pond", your generosity could make a big difference! 

"Growles the Bear" will teach kids that looks can lead you to believe things that are not true.

"Mrs. Rabbitson's Big Day" tells the lesson that it might not be the best to get a gift you will want for someone you love, but to get them a gift that they will love.  While also looking at each characters differences in what they love.

"The Wrong Way Tree" teaches about the strength of working together.

This is my first venture as an author, but I have written, directed and produced a feature film (Finding Home - which can be found on Amazon streaming services including Prime Video).  I have won awards for writing screenplays in Hollywood, Australia and India.  I have also won awards for my acting, producing, and more both Nationally and locally in Minnesota.  I have researched the process of getting these stories published and marketed, and I have everything ready to make that happen.  All I need is that little push from you to allow me to take the steps to make it happen.

Risks & Challenges

As with everything, there are obstacles that can pop up.  In life, in projects, or health.  I feel that with the research I have done, and the preparations I have made with this first book, I am ready and able to handle nearly all potential roadblocks.  I shot an entire 90 minute film (using 1 camera) in just 10 days.  My sound designer, Tom Colvin, said this about me..."Chars can stay cool under tough conditions and get the ball of progress rolling."

I will get this book made if it takes me another 10 years.  But I feel confident that, with your help, we can get it printed before Black Friday 2021! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone has the means to donate monetarily.  There is still a way you can help!

Let others know about this project. You can use the Indiegogo share tools for this opportunity, or just let them know that this book series is in the works.

And when the books are ready, spread the word to all of those that may want to read them to their children or grandchildren!

I sincerely thank you, for all of the support you have given me over the years!

May God bless you!

Chars Bonin - future author

story:
What we need:

We are looking to raise $1,000 - $2,000 through this campaign to help fund the printing of Secret Joy. Thank you to everyone who has already pledged. In order to meet our complete expenses, we are hoping to raise additional funds totaling $2,000.

What you get!

Depending on your level of commitment, you will be receiving a hardcover edition of the book; you may also choose to receive a signed original watercolor bookmark, or a signed original watercolor painting, depending on your Perks spending level. We would appreciate donations of any kind. With a $10 donation you will receive a personalized thank you note. (Note: Perks include shipping within the U.S. only unless otherwise noted) 

Who we are:

Tom Tolman, the co-author, was a software engineer and game developer, who painted visual imagery with words. Tom passed away in June 2018 from esophageal cancer. Alison Tolman-Rogers, the co-author and illustrator, is a graphic designer, who loves to write poetry and paint. Alison studied watercolors with the late artist Kaji Aso, and more recently, with the painter Gary Tucker. Tom and Alison wrote together since Tom was in high school and Alison was in college. This is their second book together. Half of all profits from the sale of the book will go to Tom's family.

story:
Welcome!

If you've made it to this page, it's because you and I know each other in some way; maybe we've met, we have a mutual friend, or maybe you're my sweet Grandma who will support me in any of my crazy ideas. Wherever we're at, thank you for visiting this page and supporting me on this exciting journey of writing a book. My book was just recently accepted by New Degree Press and is on track to be published in December, 2020. 

 

The story behind my book


My Senior year English class was where I first discovered how much I love to read (thanks in due part to Jon Krakauer's Into the Wild and Suzanne Collin's The Hunger Games).  My love for reading resulted in my wishful thinking of someday writing a book. As I got over many of the obstacles that first-time authors face (Who am I to write a book? How do I even begin? I suck at writing, etc), I jumped in head first and have never looked back. 

The title of my book isThe Nonconformist Life. I wrote this book because I wanted to help young adults realize they don’t have to conform to the world’s pressures as they pursue a successful life. 

In reading this book, my hope is that you will discover the liberating power of nonconformity. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement in you that I have for the nonconformist life and taking the unbeaten path. And then, ultimately, I want you to use the principles taught in this book as tools to help find the life path that is right for you. 
 

What's my book about? 


My book is about a young adult named Jaime and the life lessons he learns as the travels around the world. I decided to use the power of storytelling to talk about nonconformity because I think it is a more compelling and tangible way to see how the principles I talk about can be put into practice.

The book flips back and forth between the past and present, and is written in 2 Parts....

  • Part 1 is written from the perspective of Jaime as an adult as he gives a lecture series to a large audience about the lessons he learned in his travels around the world. In this section, Jaime summarizes his lessons and engages in discussion with his audience.
  • Part 2 contains the actual adventures of young Jaime written from his younger self’s perspective, where he talks about his adventures to Mt. Everest, remote islands in the Pacific Ocean, and many other places.

In this book, you'll learn about several important principles including:

  • Fear - learning how to cope with an unknown future
  • Love - observing how different cultures treat one another and the extreme acts of kindness they are willing to show even a stranger
  • Identity - discovering the importance of embracing our origins and staying true to who we are

You will love this book if you want to get more out of your life and are trying to figure out how.

 

Fundraising: What I need & what you'll get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020 (Tentative)
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 120 hard copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 hard copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback (this will be a HUGE help to me)
  • The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and giving feedback
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

What can you do now?

Take a look at the different options (Bronze, Silver, Gold, etc) that show how you can support me in my goal. Each tier represents a different level of support that you can provide, and all contributions will go towards fundraising the cost of publishing. As you go up in tier, you will also receive more perks. Have a look at each one and pick the one that best works for you. Anything and everything is greatly appreciated! 

 

If you've read this far, thank you. I honestly couldn't have begun this journey without the love and support from people like you, and I can't tell you how much I appreciate it now.

Thanks for joining me on this rollercoaster of a ride! 

- Connor

 

Questions? See the FAQ below, and reach out to me if your question isn't answered. 

 

About the Author

Connor Bernal was born in the suburbs of Seattle, Washington and is a graduate of Brigham Young University in Provo, Utah. A self-proclaimed nonconformist, Connor's unique path consisted in obtaining a degree in business strategy while playing NCAA D1 lacrosse, completing a two-year mission trip to Mexico, and traveling to six of the seven continents. He has been involved with multiple nonprofit and humanitarian organizations and is passionate about giving back to the world. 


When Connor isn’t focused on his writing, he loves spending time with family and friends, playing sports, and connecting with his latin roots through food and Salsa music. He is the third of four kids and his family is originally from Bogotá, Colombia. 

This is Connor's first book. 

For more information you can connect with Connor at connor.bernal7@gmail.com and on instagram at @bachatabernal7 (may come as a surprise to those of you who thought I didn't have an instagram ?  )

 

Other ways you can help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #theNonconformistLife and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

story:
Story of My Book

The Sinner is a modern horror novel following Isaac Martinez who must come face to face with the sins of his past. Martinez has to encounter a creature that haunts his hometown, and specifically Isaac himself. He must find out what is causing this horrid creature’s appearance and how he plays into the overall terror that this town faces.

My name is Blake Johnson and I am the author of The Sinner. I wrote this book because the feeling of not being welcome at one’s own home is universal and a terrifying reality.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the horror of introspection and finding out darker desires that motivate you. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to look into a mirror revealing what it truly means to be oneself and why we do the things we do.

The Novel:
Isaac Martinez hasn’t returned to his hometown of Bearhaven in almost a decade. Now, drawn back by his job, Isaac is forced to face the people and places he abandoned so long ago. In an effort to reignite his life in a town he used to call home, Isaac makes it his personal mission to not feel like a stranger in his own hometown. His efforts to reignite relationships and his old life are sabotaged by a demon hellbent on taking over Isaac’s sanity.

This creature quickly takes root in Isaac’s mind, and his mission to start a brand new life in an old place become an ever waking nightmare that he soon finds out are caused by the sins of his past.


You will love this book if you are a general fan of horror, mysteries, and an introspective look at what it means to be flawed. The Sinner speaks to horror fans and fans of modern mysteries who want to grapple with the terrors of the digital age mixed with ancient human flaws in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Sinner inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How responsible are we for the consequences of our life choices?

What do we owe to the communities that have shaped us to who we are?

How can we know that we’re on the correct paths of our lives, and is it safe to reflect on where we went wrong?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing the weight we put on meeting other’s expectations will change us all for the better.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Blake Johnson is a broadcast engineering intern currently studying Creative Media at the University of Alabama.

Blake Johnson has always had a passion for writing and telling stories. His curiosity for how fear can drive a person to make major life decisions fueled the inspiration for writing The Sinner.

Blake Johnson grew up in Omaha, Nebraska where he spent his time walking his dogs around his hometown.

For more information, you can connect with Blake Johnson at brjohnson8@crimson.ua.edu and at @blake.johnson00.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheSinner and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

In an effort to reignite his life in a town he used to call home, Isaac makes it his personal mission to not feel like a stranger in his own hometown. His efforts to reignite relationships and his old life are sabotaged by a demon hellbent on taking over Isaac’s sanity.This creature quickly takes root in Isaac’s mind, and his mission to start a brand new life in an old place become an ever waking nightmare that he soon finds out are caused by the sins of his past.You will love this book if you are a general fan of horror, mysteries, and an introspective look at what it means to be flawed. story:
Why Can't It Ever Be Simple?

Seraphina Covington is a 25-year-old human woman born into a shapechanging family. After a 12-year absence, she returns to her family home in the small magical community of Merricott, New Hampshire to find out that all is not as it seems.

A Magic Wielder child, Thomas, is missing. While her aunt dodges dinner to find Thomas, Seraphina reacquaints herself with a house seeped in unhappy memories and a tragic past.

And that’s where things get complicated.

Missing people, reconnecting with her aunt and finding a job aren’t the only problems in Seraphina’s world.

She soon discovers her imaginary childhood friend isn’t imaginary. Angwyndith, the “friend,” is still in her head (and body), has a Universe-balancing purpose, and needs Seraphina to get onboard - now.

What ensues is a struggle for identity, understanding and compromise, as Seraphina and Angwyndith race against the clock to unravel the mystery and stop the Big Bad before more community members disappear.
 

Why This Book and This Plot?

I wrote this book because I had a daydream about a girl with a boogeywoman riding shotgun in her body. A girl who was an outsider. A girl who wasn’t sure who she really was. A girl who was a lot like me when I was younger.

Growing up, I felt invisible. Too many times people would not remember meeting me or thought I looked exactly like their cousin/friend/neighbor and the question changed as a kid from, “Aren’t you Erika’s little sister?” to “Aren’t you married to that English guy?”

My identity wasn’t clearly defined, at least not as perceived by other people, and in time, I came to realize that was because I still hadn’t defined it for myself. They were reflecting back to me what I wanted them to see, and it was time to make sure that reflection was actually my own.

This is part of the journey on which Seraphina travels - figuring out who she is and who she isn’t. And that is, at its core, what this book is about - our identities and our reflections. How much of who you are is because of something you like or how you feel innately, and how much is because of outside (or inside) influences? I know the answer to that question for myself, but for my protagonists, Seraphina and Angwyndith, their journey has just begun.

I hope in reading this book, two things occur:

  • you discover a little something about who you are and how you define yourself, and,
  • you find yourself lost in my characters’ story, if only for a short time. After all, we could all use a little escapism right now.

 

What's In It For You?

You’ll love this book if you like flawed characters, don’t mind (or like) a few literary quotes, and like watching those flawed characters grow, learn and evolve. You’ll also love this book if you’re a fan of low fantasy, urban or contemporary fantasy and light mysteries.

For those young adults from their late teens to their mid-twenties, and/or adults on a journey to find themselves or to feel their own impact, this book may help you find a new way forward. Or, it may just let you know you are not alone in your journey. People from all generations struggled with these same questions, just in different clothing and with different tech.

Ultimately, I’d love The Deep Space Between to inspire thoughts and conversation around such questions as:

  • What are your passions, what do you love, and do they define who you are?
  • Does an impact need to be big, like saving a life, or can it be as small as a smile?
  • Are we just defined by our gender, sexuality, or romantic choices, or are we so much more than that?

I look forward to exploring these tricky questions and more with my readers. I believe showcasing our differences while celebrating our common connections as humans is what can bring us all together.

 

What's In It for Both of Us?

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall 2021.
When I pre-sell 140 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 165 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 215 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

Who is the Director of This Journey?

Cassandra Stirling is an author, Developmental Editor and Writing Coach with The Creator Institute. She loves helping writers find their voices and share their thoughts with the world by completing the first drafts of their book. Her passion for her job is right up there with writing her own book.

Her entire career, from law to publishing to online marketing and back again to publishing, focused entirely on language and the best way to use it. You could say she circled around that question until she reached the heart of it.

It happened in 2020. After years of telling her (yes, he’s English) husband that if you asked her what she wanted to be when she grew up, she’d say a writer, she finally got an answer from him she didn’t expect.

“But you’re not a writer. You don’t write,” he said truthfully.

“You don’t get to decide that. Only I do,” she replied. His statement and her realization led her to where she is today, working to get a book she wrote published. Oh, and she’s also figured out she is most definitely a writer.

When she’s not writing or working, she is either cross-stitching, renovating her 92-year-old house with her husband, avoiding gardening by playing videogames on her self-built PC - WoW, Dragon Age, Final Fantasy, SWOTOR are her favs, reading one or more books, watching tech or book YouTubers, traveling (eventually) and generally figuring out how to fit all of her life into the 17 hours a day she’s not sleeping.

For more information, you can connect with Cassandra at cassandracstirling@gmail.com, and on Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, I recommend getting the e-book, unless you’re really keen on a physical copy, as the shipping costs are stupid high - more-than-a-few-pints-in-a-pub high.

If you’d really like one, we can always pack an extra suitcase of books the next time we visit the UK and dole them out in country.

If you can’t wait for that eventuality, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier for the US only.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #thedeepspacebetween and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for joining me on this crazy rollercoaster of writing and publishing a book!

Thanks again,
Cassandra Stirling

story:
Story of My Book

The Fast Mind aims to look at diet from a different perspective: not what we eat, but rather when we eat. This book explores intermittent fasting as a simple, cheap, and effective method to not only help lose and maintain a healthy weight, but also to help boost energy levels and even prevent chronic diseases like cancer and Alzheimer's.

My name is Arslon Humayun, and I am the author of The Fast Mind. I wrote this book because I feel that we have been getting dieting wrong for decades. Despite the efforts of the diet industry, diseases such as obesity and type 2 diabetes have become epidemic in nature. Even with all of the diet plans out there, the problem only seems to be growing worse. Whether these diet plans are too difficult to follow or simply don't hold up from a scientific perspective, the end result is the same: frustration and disappointment over a lack of results.

The Fast Mind speaks to people who want to grapple with weight loss in a new way. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that there is a simpler alternative out there: intermittent fasting. This method has been tried and tested for thousands of years and does not require stressing over counting calories or cutting out your favorite foods. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to completely reconsider your fundamental relationship with food. I will give you everything you need to know in order to unlock "The Fast Mind" so that you are prepared to safely incorporate the practice of intermittent fasting into your daily life.

If you have tried all the diet plans out there and are still not seeing the results you want to see, you will love this book. If you are a busy professional looking to maximize your mental efficiency, you will love this book. If you are perfectly healthy but want to find a way to take a more preventative approach to your long-term health, you will love this book.


Ultimately, I hope that The Fast Mind inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What are the origins of intermittent fasting?
  • How does intermittent fasting work?
  • What benefits can intermittent fasting bring to your life beyond weight loss?
  • How can someone who is completely new to intermittent fasting safely take up the practice?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe that rethinking our traditional approach to diet and health will change us all for the better.

 

My Book

The Fast Mind is divided into four parts.
Part 1 contains the Introduction and Chapters 1-2. Here, the reader will learn about the origins of intermittent fasting. From interviews with professors and religious scholars, we will explore why it is that we can find a shared tradition of fasting across religion and society.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-4. Here, the reader will learn about the ways in which the food industry has contributed to the rise of obesity and type 2 diabetes, as well as the science behind why intermittent fasting is the perfect solution to combating these diseases. For example, we will learn about how Dr. Jason Fung has helped thousands of people use intermittent fasting as a tool to help treat obesity and type 2 diabetes in order to prevent kidney disease.

Part 3 contains Chapters 5-6. Here, the reader will learn about how to unlock "The Fast Mind." From success stories of celebrities and entrepreneurs to everyday people, this part of the book aims to get you motivated and in the right mindset to safely take on the practice of intermittent fasting.

Part 4 contains Chapter 7. Here, the reader will learn about important practical and health considerations that are involved with taking up intermittent fasting. We will also explore tips and tricks to make your journey with intermittent fasting a rewarding and enjoyable experience.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in April 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Arslon Humayun is a senior at Georgetown University who is majoring in Sociology and on the pre-med track. He is the Co-Founder and Co-President of the Georgetown Sociology Association, a student organization that aims to foster a greater sense of community among students and professors in the Department of Sociology. He is also a co-author of the research publication 3,3'-Diindolylmethane Enhances Tumor Regression After Radiation Through Protecting Normal Cells to Modulate Antitumor Immunity in the journal Advances in Radiation Oncology.

Arslon’s unique academic interests allow him to provide insight into the reasons behind why fasting has become a topic of interest in contemporary society. His background also gives him the ability to explain the science behind intermittent fasting in a way that is simple to understand. Arslon wrote The Fast Mind because he feels that everyone deserves to know about the whole host of benefits that can be experienced with intermittent fasting. His hope is to show that almost any healthy individual is capable of taking up the simple, cheap, and effective practice to experience benefits in their daily lives.

In his free time, Arslon can often be found on the tennis court trying to emulate the groundstrokes of Roger Federer with little success. He can also be found trying to convince his friends that Sonic the Hedgehog music is better than mainstream music.

For more information, you can connect with Arslon Humayun by email at adh76@georgetown.edu.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #TheFastMind and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!
Arslon Humayun

story:
Sick and tired of feeling sick and tired? Has the Corona Virus made you anxious? Depressed?  Don't know what to do?  If you are like me you just want Covid-19 to go away.

But it won't.  While I can't personally make the virus just disappear I can tell you what  some pretty smart kids and grown ups, many of whom are kids at heart, have told me  what you can do to:

Save yourself

Save your family

Save your community

Save the world

 

Svetlana Mila Tolpin  eventually was selected as the 'writer" for this project.  Her book/letter addresses the leaders of the world all over the world living on "Humanitarian Grounds."

 

  On one level DEAR WORLD LEADER PLEASE MAKE THE GLOBAL PANDEMIC GO AWAY  is  a handy kid-friendly, romp promoting empowerment and protection. 

 

 

More than that however, it is a beacon of hope. As Svetlana writes:

 

Dad tells me you have asked scientists to develop technologies to fight this virus.   He says it will take time. Meanwhile everyone has to pull together like one big family to save ourselves. Just about everyone can help save communities all over the world by wearing masks, social distancing and washing our hands just like my family.  I am glad I am helping save my family and know we are helping save our community.

 

This book will make a difference. And if you want to make a difference please consider helping me with this book. 

 

 While no charity has officially endorsed this book I am  donating a portion of what I earn to relevant causes.  That is how I am paying them back.

 

 My journey as a kid's writer started years ago when I wrote hand tag stories for a stuffed animal company.  Maybe you remember "Mandy Panda Needs A Hug?" That was me.

Then again, probably not.  My journey also includes short stories, fables, script treatments and even junior high science books.  I am proud to say I have brought joy to more than a few audiences.

I have worked endless hours to tackle the serious and all-consuming subject of our Great Pandemic to add just a little more light, complimenting other thoughtful, high-minded efforts. 

 

This book resulted from countless hours and hours of research, reading journals, articles and presentations,  watching videos and television shows, talking to kids and adults concerned about Covid-19 as well as experts in the fields of virology and medicine.  Much of this source material is familiar to you too and some of it not so much.

Research also  has taken me to Wall Street. I have been the "fly on the wall" listening to bankers and cutting edge inventors/business developers discussing how to fight the pandemic.  So much of what goes on is in their hands.  

My journey becomes your journey with even the smallest of contributions.   I took the leap of faith to start this project without having any background in crowdfunding and without any organization behind me. It started out as just me having a burning desire to say something timely and important and work really hard to say it right. 

Your contributions are the best way of honoring my work and turning it into OUR work.  

If you care as much as I do about helping our readers -- kids and their families --  I want your support.  Now that the books is written and published I need promotion dollars to get the word out to share what we all have learned and promote a willingness to learn more.

 

 

 Maybe just maybe in a small, perhaps imperceptible way in the end  we will have indeed helped make the pandemic go away. 

 

 

  

Cheers!

story:
Story of My Book

Arduino for Artists is a guide for amateur and professional artists about how to use the Arduino microcontroller platform to create dynamic and interactive works of art. While most how-to books approach Arduino and electronics from a scientific and engineering perspective, Arduino for Artists is designed for creatives who want to use technology as a tool for artistic expression instead.

My name is Matthew McClain and I am the author of Arduino for Artists. I wrote this book to help artists, makers, and creatives alike unlock the Arduino microcontroller platform as a tool for art despite the dearth of Arduino resources designed with that goal in mind.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a new way to leave your creative mark on the world using technology. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for electronics, art, and design. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take your creative ambitions in exciting new directions and create dynamic, animated, interactive works of art using the easy-to-learn and popular Arduino platform.

In this book, you'll learn about programming and wiring Arduino microcontrollers to create art. You'll learn to do things like...

  • Create kinetic art displays using several different types of motors.
  • Program individually addressable LED light strips to create complex and mesmerizing light displays.
  • Add sensors to your art pieces, allowing them to respond dynamically to input from their viewers.
You will love this book if you enjoy making art, sculptures, or working on DIY projects.

Arduino for Artists is a nonfiction book that speaks to artists and makers who want to look at Arduino and art in a new way.
 

The Book - Arduino for Artists

The book is written in 5 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. This section covers the basics of programming an Arduino and connecting electronic components to allow it to interact with the outside world.

Part 2 contains chapters 6-10. This section delves deep into using LED strips and other types of electrical lights to create captivating and emotive light displays for your art projects.

Part 3 contains chapters 11-12. This section explores how to use motors to add the element of motion to art pieces and sculptures.

Part 4 contains chapter 13. This covers using sensors with the Arduino to allow your art to detect and respond dynamically to stimuli from the outside world.

Part 5 contains chapter 14. This final section explores integrating Arduino with other tools useful for creating art, such as the Processing programming language and separate machines and appliances.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also have the option to publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will have the opportunity to publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Matthew McClain is an electrical engineer and designer from Los Angeles, California. Matthew has taught multiple classes on robotics and Arduino, and in 2018 was named chair of the S.T.E.A.M. department at Oakwood School’s Academy of Creative Education. He currently resides in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania.

Matthew’s deep fascination with electronics inspired him to learn Arduino in high school from books just like this one. His passions for design and electronics led him to study integrated Electrical Engineering and Product Design in Lehigh University’s I.D.E.A.S. program. During his studies, Matthew saw firsthand the incredible potential engineering and art can unlock when working together, as well as the lack of resources to help people bridge the gap between the two.

In his free time, Matthew enjoys making silly videos, playing video games, and listening to music your grandmother would hate.

For more information, you can connect with Matthew at matthewpmm@gmail.com and at @matthewpmm on Twitter and Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Arduino4Artists and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Matthew McClain

story:
KHLOE stands for: 

Klothes & style

Health & fitness

Love & relationships

Opportunity

Empowering women

 These words are what KHLOE stands for and represents the young woman's lifestyle magazine with it's first issue being published on 11/11/11.  I have been so blessed in the past year with my career, I have felt it laid on my heart to give back. To start something bigger than myself and my writing company, I want to give back to the world. I have always been raised that whatever we do, we need to make the world a better place. I believe our time on earth is meant to do good in this world.

 

KHLOE is something I am very passionate about; please, help me achieve this dream so I can change women's ambitions, self-esteem, and futures one issue at a time. Please, help us launch our FIRST ISSUE of KHLOE magazine.

 

You are probably asking " HOW" is this not like any other young or adult women's magazine? 

 KHLOE Magazine, will be made available both in print (at select highschool and college campuses) and online worldwide ; it will be ENTIRELY created by women looking to launch their creative careers.

 The articles, editorials, photojournalistic expressions, design, and fashion spreads will be entirely created and contributed by young adult women looking to launch their careers. Anyone in the media and entertainment world knows that once you are published, featured, or produced; it makes your career dreams  a hell of a lot easier to become acheivable. I can attest to that. KHLOE will be that launch pad, it will be their means of jump starting their careers with KHLOE as their base and springboard. 

 The MEDIA has SUCH a HUGE impact on the world we live in.  It is where we source our information, trends, and opinions. The impact is so great on our younger generations, yet many times it impacts them in a NEGATIVE way. When I reflect on my growing up I can recognize that the media was a huge barrier in allowing me to love myself and accept me for me. Inwardly and outwardly. I want to change that. I want to be a voice in the community of women where they can remember that they are of value regardless of their talents, beliefs, size, or the society that they live in. 

With that being said, the magazine will not be restricted to size 0, 6 foot tall models for our style and fashion spreads. We will be featuring real girls of real sizes and shapes to model for our fashion spreads , promoting self-love and acceptance of one's body shape. Our editorials and articles will allow women to have a voice about their beliefs and points of views without being stomped on by professors, teachers, or peers who think that they know better. I want to reinvent the traditional young women's lifestyle magazine. I want to begin to revamp the way the media impacts and influences young women.  This is by no means meant to be a personal gain on my part, but a gain for women's empowerment and opportunity as young women strive to achieve their goals and dreams. 
. Launching this project is NOT possible without financially backing and support. We have raised over $4,000 over the summer to start this organization, publication, and revolution. We are now moving into production, distribution, and promotion of this fantastic magazine that is already touching lives worldwide. 


 I ask for your love and support in this endeavor. Your prayers, good wishes, and encouragement as I embark on this huge campaign!

LOVE AND KHLOE!

XO THE KHLOE LAUNCH TEAM

story:
Short Summary

My name is Melissa Luznicky Garrett and I am an author of four published novels.

I was one of those kids who knew from a very early age that she wanted to be an author when she grew up. It didn't matter if it was bad poetry or a rambling novel that lacked direction, I was always writing. Even before I knew how to (technically speaking) read and write, I was churning out “stories” on my mother’s typewriter. That was back in the day when there was no such thing as a delete key, and you had to type very slowly and carefully so as not to make (m)any mistakes.

But LIFE, in the form of a husband and three children, happened shortly after high school, and writing was relegated to the back burner. Suddenly I was up to my neck in dirty diapers and runny noses, with no time to even sneeze. It wasn’t until my youngest child started preschool, and I actually had time to read something other than the What to Expect series, that I rediscovered my love of writing.

After many years of writing nothing at all, I put a tentative pen to paper in the fall of 2007. I very quickly churned out my first novel Precipice. Needless to say, I’ve had many years to work on my craft, and Precipice has become the ugly baby everyone says is cute (I fear) just to be nice. In other words, it's time that poor book got a makeover! And although I can handle what happens between the pages, I know nothing about cover design. Fortunately, I have a brilliant cover designer who knows just how to capture the very essence of a book. He created the covers for both The Spirit Keeper and Blood Type, and he will continue to create all of my covers if I have anything to say about it!

Unfortunately, professionally designed covers don’t come cheap, and indie authors typically don’t have much pocket money to spare. Still, I know firsthand how important it is to have a cover that stands out from the rest and grabs the buyer’s attention. I’ve received numerous emails from new fans who’ve all said they wouldn’t have given The Spirit Keeper and Blood Type a chance if not for the cover . . . and they're all glad they did! So really, a stunning cover is a win-win for everyone.

What it all boils down to this: I don’t have $500 to spare, which is why I need YOUR help to fund this project.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I need $500 to cover the cost of a Print & Ebook Cover Package from Damonza’s Awesome Book Covers (more information here: http://damonza.com/packages/lite-package-briefing-form/. Of course, I hope to exceed that goal so I can also cover the cost of campaign fees and shipping, but every little bit helps. Should there be any extra, I will set it aside to help cover the cost of my next book, The Seventh Tribe.

In exchange, you get one of the perks listed over there ----->

If you simply can’t make a monetary contribution, that’s OK! I really do understand. You can always help me spread the word about my campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Melissa Luznicky Garrett and I am an author of four published novels.
I was one of those kids who knew from a very early age that she wanted to be an author when she grew up. It didn't matter if it was bad poetry or a rambling novel that lacked direction, I was always writing. Even before I knew how to (technically speaking) read and write, I was churning out “stories” on my mother’s typewriter. That was back in the day when there was no such thing as a delete key, and you had to type very slowly and carefully so as not to make (m)any mistakes.
But LIFE, in the form of a husband and three children, happened shortly after high school, and writing was relegated to the back burner. Suddenly I was up to my neck in dirty diapers and runny noses, with no time to even sneeze. It wasn’t until my youngest child started preschool, and I actually had time to read something other than the What to Expect series, that I rediscovered my love of writing.
After many years of writing nothing at all, I put a tentative pen to paper in the fall of 2007. I very quickly churned out my first novel Precipice. Needless to say, I’ve had many years to work on my craft, and Precipice has become the ugly baby everyone says is cute (I fear) just to be nice. In other words, it's time that poor book got a makeover! And although I can handle what happens between the pages, I know nothing about cover design. Fortunately, I have a brilliant cover designer who knows just how to capture the very essence of a book. He created the covers for both The Spirit Keeper and Blood Type, and he will continue to create all of my covers if I have anything to say about it!
Unfortunately, professionally designed covers don’t come cheap, and indie authors typically don’t have much pocket money to spare. Still, I know firsthand how important it is to have a cover that stands out from the rest and grabs the buyer’s attention. I’ve received numerous emails from new fans who’ve all said they wouldn’t have given The Spirit Keeper and Blood Type a chance if not for the cover . . . and they're all glad they did! So really, a stunning cover is a win-win for everyone.
What it all boils down to this: I don’t have $500 to spare, which is why I need YOUR help to fund this project.
 
What I Need & What You Get
I need $500 to cover the cost of a Print & Ebook Cover Package from Damonza’s Awesome Book Covers (more information here: http://damonza.com/packages/lite-package-briefing-form/. Of course, I hope to exceed that goal so I can also cover the cost of campaign fees and shipping, but every little bit helps. Should there be any extra, I will set it aside to help cover the cost of my next book, The Seventh Tribe.
In exchange, you get one of the perks listed over there ----->
 
Other Ways You Can Help

story:
We have been writing since we were kids. Having door after door slammed in our faces or sometimes, quite literally, not even opened, we decided to take matters into our own hands and self-publish our first novels.

 

Self-publishing is a very difficult and long road, but one that we feel very passionate about. It’s all about marketing and exposure. People can’t read your book if they don’t know it exists!

 

That’s why we’re trying to raise funds to reserve a booth at the Los Angeles Times Festival of Books, one of the largest festivals in the country. It’s a great way for us to get our books out there and meet the right people.

 

Any donation is greatly appreciated, and thank you so much for helping us make our dreams a reality!

story:
Unlimited Ebooks gives readers the ability to download as many books as you want from an extensive online library. It's an adventurous alternative to the 'vanilla' flavor of typical traditional publishers. Discover the next bestsellers, rising-star writers & indie authors. Find it all from real & raw to controversial - both fiction and non-fiction. Offering formats for tablets, ereaders, browsers and smartphones to enjoy anytime & anywhere!


Unlimited Ebooks is part of an initiative to promote reading and literacy worldwide, created in 2013 by Chris Benjamin. Like free source code in the computing industry, I hope that unlimited content combined with less editorial interference and censorship will increase reading to spark new insights and wisdom worldwide.  At the same time, we're promoting undiscovered & independent authors who otherwise would have little or no audience. Their stories, talent and knowledge would be wasted without a means to share, as nearly 99% of manuscripts are rejected by traditional publishers.  By giving them the support they need to continue writing and geting their work publicized, we all benefit!

Pick from over 10,000 titles and over 50 categories, including Fiction, Romance, and Mystery, and Religion, along with Self-Help, Cooking, Business, and many, many more. Read anytime, anywhere. Unlimited eBooks are compatible with all tablets, smartphones , computers and ereaders. New titles are added daily so there's always plenty of fresh reading entertainment!

Our goal is simple – provide readers with an extensive library of content for their ereading devices and support independent authors by giving them a platform to distribute their writing around the world.

Unlimited Ebooks provides subscribers with just that - unlimited ebooks!  Read them on your device of choice - Kindle, Nook, iPad or Phone, PC, and many others. Formats are available for all eeeaders, tablets and smartphones! 

There's new titles and authors every week added to the 10,000 eBooks you have to choose from today, including Fiction and Non-Fiction, textbooks and even Children's Stories. We specialize in promoting new and independent authors. We are seeking funding in order to publish even more great up-and-coming talent and grow our selection for a continuous stream of new content to download for reading enjoyment.  


Let's face it, there's a wave of addiction to technology.  How many times a day do we look at our smartphones just to see if there’s a new Facebook post, a new text, or find what’s in the news?  We want to give people something else, something more – literacy and a love of reading!  Rather than spend those spare 10 minutes meaninlessly flipping through Facebook, steal a moment with an ebook.  Read a few pages from that classic fiction novel you've rediscovered, browse some recipes in a tasty cooking ebook, or browse for new children's tales to enthrall your kids. 


We need your support to make this a blockbuster endeavor!

UnlimitedEbooks.com has been very fortunate to have loyal supporters.  We launched our Unlimited Ebooks website in June 2013 and have continued to grow and add content ever since.

The next phase, which you are directly impacting with your contribution, is to reach out to more authors, help them get their ebooks on our site, and, in turn, provide more amazing content to book lovers everywhere.  It’s a win for everyone!

While we have over 10,000 titles currently, your support will accelerate growth to over 100,000 titles by the end of 2014, available to men, women and children worldwide.




Chris Benjamin is an entrepreneur and avid reader who continually is seeking new ways to promote worldwide literacy.  Join Chris on his quest to make Unlimited Ebooks a household name worldwide!




Join in for a triple win! Your contributions help us attract and promote independent and underfunded authors. In growing our library, it helps these writers get the exposure, credibility and feedback they seek, while giving our readers (you) more great eBooks to choose from! 

For $5, support the Unlimited Ebook cause! Receive special mention on Twitter and Facebook.



For $20, you're entitled to UNlimited downloads to read as much as you want. We encourage you to take full advantage!



For $40, you really win!  Lifetime access to Unlimited Ebooks. Just think, for the price of 1 hardcover book, you get access for LIFE to our entire library.



For $70, both you and someone you chose will have a lifetime of Unlimited Ebooks.  You receive everything from the above Lifetime Access membership, PLUS a gift certificate that you can give to anyone else for a Lifetime membership as well!



For $100 we help those who want to read more but haven't pulled the trigger on an ereader.  Get a Kindle AND lifetime access to Unlimited Ebooks.  Now you will be ready to read like never before. 



When do I receive my Unlimited Ebooks membership?

On completion of our IndieGoGo campaign, all subscribers receive a welcome email with a link to register for your account.  That’s it! Once you register, you’re entitled to complete access to Unlimited Ebooks.  Unliked other campaigns where you have to wait months before you receive any type of perk, with Unlimited Ebooks you’ll be reading immediately on completion of the campaign.

When do I receive my Kindle if I chose the $100 Perk?

Your Kindle will be shipped via USPS Ground Shipping for US orders to keep costs feasible. You can expect your Kindle approximately within a week of our campaign closing.

For orders outside of the US, expect 2-3 weeks for delivery. 

Can I pay for expedited shipping of my Kindle if I chose the $100 Perk?

Certainly! When we contact you after the campaign ends, you can reply and let us know you’d prefer expedited shipping and we can provide you with the additional cost.

With a Lifetime Membership, do I really get unlimited ebooks for life?

Yes! Your perk is your ticket to reading for life.  No additional fees whatsoever.  You have unlimited access to our site for life.


If you are a reading enthusiast, check us out!  Spread the word that literacy is alive and well! Reading is important and there's amazing, fresh talent and new authors waiting for your to discover and enjoy their gifts. Please share this posting with friends and family for the love of reading!

story:
Our Story

Sacramento City College is proud of its thriving creative writing and literary program. Since 1994, students have produced annual edition of Susurrus, the SCC Literary Journal, which has twice been named the best community college literary journal in the nation by the Community College Humanities Association. And more recently, the 2010 edition of Susurrus won second place in the western division! Also, the college’s River City Writers Series has brought some of the country’s finest poets, fiction writers and essayists to campus to read and discuss writing techniques with students.

The Impact

We’re inviting you to become a part of the Sacramento City College literary world. We’re asking for your support to help us bring Susurrus and other creative writing endeavors, such as the River City Writers, to students and the larger Sacramento community! Please help support student creative writing! Many of our published authors have gone onto larger projects, including book publication, graduate school, editing, or full time writing jobs.

What We Need & What You Get

Though we do receive some financial support from the college to fund these programs, we must raise the balance of funds necessary to print the journal and support the writers’ series. We are looking to raise at least $3000 dollars each semester. Your donation to our programs will be gratefully acknowledged in the 2011 edition of Susurrus. Donors of $50 or more also receive a free copy of Susurrus. In addition, all contributions are tax deductible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute at this time, we appreciate your moral support, and invite you to keep in touch with us. The annual reading of the 2011 edition of Susurrus will be held in early May 2011.  We will send invitations in April.  We would love to see you there! Lastly, buy the book! You can support Susurrus by purchasing one of our books in the Sacramento City College bookstore for $15.00

If we can offer any further information, please contact creative writing professor Jan Haag at 558-2696.

story:
Jessica Yaffa is a survivor of extreme domestic violence. She has transformed a set of extremely traumatic circumstances into a triumphant story. Ms. Yaffa is the founder and leader of The Rock Church Domestic Violence Ministry, a church with than 15,000 members. Jessica’s ministry has served over 5,000 men, women, and children since it’s inception over five years ago. Her commitment to ensure that no one walks this journey alone, providing support groups, workshops, trainings, donations, legal clinics, and an abundance of resources is just the beginning. Ms. Yaffa has recently published a workbook for therapists' titled: Help Me, Help Her; A Therapists' Guide to Treating Survivors of Domestic Violence, with her memoir Mine, Until scheduled to be released this fall. Having received multiple awards and recognition, Ms. Yaffa travels the country sharing her powerful story, extraordinary circumstances, and message of resiliency, purpose, and hope.

 

The purpose of this specific project is to raise enough funds to publish my completed memoir, Mine, Until

Participating in this campaign will contribute to the printing and distribution costs of a book that has the capacity to bring hope, encouragement, education, and social change to millions of people worldwide.

Jessica commits to speaking internationally surrounding the topic of domestic violence and sexual assault in an effort to reduce stigma, eliminate stereotypes, and facilitate support and healing to everyone she has the opportunity to reach.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would be extremely grateful if you'd share this mission with friends, family, and co-workers.

Please also take a moment to like Jessica on Facebook at  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Jessica-Yaffa/451734021515149?ref=hl

Follow Jessica on Twitter @JessicaYaffa
