Una muestra de nuestro estilo:

 Un cuento corto escrito por Marly y otro por Jorge.


Del griego #Paronymos:

1. Se dice de cada uno de dos o más vocablos que tienen entre sí relación o semejanza, por su etimología o solamente por su forma o sonido.

2. Dícese del conjunto de cuentos escritos en términos que, aunque suenen similares, significan cosas tan distantes como la virtual frontera entre nuestros países.

3. Una antología realizada por dos jóvenes escritores, unidos por el fuego interno de un inventor con alma de artista.

¿Quiénes SOMOS?

¡Somos Marly y Jorge! 

De orígenes nicaragüense y chileno respectivamente; novios, estudiantes y escritores. Actualmente nos dedicamos a concebir nuestro primer libro, #Paronymos.

Hemos trabajado arduamente para lograr este proyecto, primero bajo la tutela de Carlos Calles, escritor mexicano quien nos guió en el camino a la creación de los primeros cuentos de este compilado y luego Isaac López, profesor de escritura quien, en su particular estilo, nos ayudó a afinar detalles.

Con tu ayuda queremos compartir nuestros textos con el mundo y brindarles un poco del gozo proveniente de la lectura, tal como nosotros fuimos felices escribiendo.

¿POR QUÉ LA CAMPAÑA?

1.  Porque amamos escribir y queremos repartir un poco de nuestra pasión en formato clásico (papel y tinta).

2.  Porque queremos empezar una carrera como escritores.

3.  Porque el editor, diseñador, traductor e imprentas no trabajan por amor al arte (desafortunadamente :P).

¿QUÉ OBTIENES A CAMBIO?

Nivel 1 de Recompensa: Un poco de amor (US $5).


¡Te gustaría donar un poco de amor! Nosotros te lo agradeceremos personalmente vía correo.

Nivel 2 de Recompensa: ¡PDF gratis! (US $10).


¡Un poco de lectura digital! Se te agradecerá el aporte  personalmente por correo electrónico y te serán enviadas 3 de nuestras historias en formato PDF de forma gratuita.

Nivel 3 de Recompensa: LIBRO COMPLETO en versión Ebook (US $20).

Usted es un alma hermosa y por esa razón tendrá la versión digital de nuestro libro completo, un correo personal de agradecimiento y una mención especial en nuestra Fan page por su colaboración.

Nivel 4 de Recompensa: Primera edición GRATIS + carta de agradecimiento escrita a mano (US  $35)


Esta es la oportunidad perfecta para conseguir el libro impreso gratis. Vas a obtener una copia de nuestro bebé en casa y el olor clásico de una primera edición te va deleitar. Y, por supuesto, recibirás también una preciosa carta de agradecimiento hecha a mano.

Nivel 5 de Recompensa: EDICIÓN DE LUJO (US  $99).

¡Estás a otro NIVEL de AMOR! Y vamos a agradecerte adecuadamente. Conseguirás totalmente gratis:

-Una copia de la primera edición impresa del libro.

-Una ilustración a todo color impresa de nuestra portada (que está hecha con acuarelas por un artista mexicano llamado Don Juan Tosco), montado en un atril de madera de 30x38cm.

-Un colgador de puerta pintada con pintura de pizarra para puedas dejar el mensaje que quieras. “No molestar, estoy leyendo”, por ejemplo.

-Un mini atril pintado con pintura de pizarra.

- Una preciosa carta de agradecimiento personalizada escrita a mano.

Nivel 6 de Recompensa: Un manuscrito de un cuento personalizado + EDICIÓN DE LUJO (US  $125).

 

¡Tienes una idea y necesitas a alguien para concretarla! Aquí estamos para hacerlo realidad. Obtendrás el manuscrito  de un cuento personalizado escrito por nosotros (puedes elegir el tema y el personaje principal), nosotros hacemos el resto (en español). La historia será publicada en nuestra Fan page (haciendo referencia a que eres el creador de la idea original). Además, la edición de lujo mencionada anteriormente será toda tuya.

Nivel 7 de Recompensa: Sé un invitado + EDICIÓN DE LUJO (US $300).


¡Te ofrecemos la oportunidad de aparecer en un libro publicado! Sólo hay 5 espacios disponibles. Escribe tu propia historia (en Inglés o Español), y nosotros vamos a editarlo para que cumpla con los estándares necesarios para su publicación, y tu escrito va a aparecer en nuestra sección de invitados. Además, la edición de lujo será tuya por defecto.

Nivel 8 de Recompensa: ¡SÉ UN ÁNGEL! (US $1000)


Usted se convierte automáticamente en un ángel y nuestro agradecimiento será infinito  de todo corazón. Además, obtendrás todos los regalos antes mencionados enviados a casa y tu aporte será reconocido en una sección de agradecimiento especial en nuestro libro.

OTRAS MANERAS DE AYUDAR

¡Con un par de clics! Comparte esta campaña en tu muro, tuitea, muéstrasela a un amigo y deséanos suerte.

Además, ingresa a nuestra Fan page y síguenos en Twitter

¡POR TU AYUDA, GRACIAS DE ANTEMANO!

Nos aseguraremos de que nuestra gratitud se manifieste en nuestros obsequios personalizados.

Besos.

story:
Min dröm slog nästan in. Det blev en bok! En bok som jag är otroligt stolt över.
Men jag behöver din hjälp för att ha råd att trycka den.

Det blir inte alltid som man har tänkt och Kim är ett typexempel på just det. När boken väl var klar fanns varken tillräckligt med pengar eller tid för att jag skulle kunna trycka boken den vanliga vägen. Då förvandlades min dröm om att vara på Bokmässan i Göteborg med stora lådor fulla av böcker till den här crowdfundingen.

Kim är en viktig pusselbit i mitt projekt Tillsammans där jag jobbar mot sexuella övergrepp på många olika sätt. En viktig fråga för mig är att jobba med positiva värderingar och självkänsla från tidig ålder och i den processen föddes det lilla charmtrollet Kim.

Min förhoppning med boken är att den ska locka fram samtal mellan läsaren och lyssnaren som är lite ovanliga. Är Kim en tjej eller kille? Och spelar det någon roll?
Kan man pussa sin favorit på förskolan bara för att man är liten och söt? Är det extra roligt att ha två mammor? Känner man sig mindre ensam när man har en myrsloksbästis?
Eller så läser man bara boken som vilken rar liten barnbok som helst. Den är ytterst opekpinnig och förhoppningsvis kommer du tycka att den är riktigt rolig.

Titta in i "gallery" här ovanför eller klicka här om du vill läsa dom första åtta sidorna och se Micke Sjömillas fina illustrationer.

Jag kommer ringa tryckeriet samma sekund som crowdfundingen har gått i lås och sen skicka ut alla beställningar så fort det bara går, förhoppningsvis inom två veckor.
Tycker du att det är för krångligt att sätta in pengar via denna sidan kan du använda något av dessa betalningssätten så för jag över pengarna hit så fort dom dyker upp:
Swish 0701 89 95 91
BG 539-9423

Pengarna jag kommer få in när jag fortsätter sälja Kim (jag utgår i sann positivt Linda-anda från att detta kommer lyckas) kommer att användas som bidrag till att finansiera föreläsningar för människor som inte har råd att betala mer än lite, lite. I slutet på oktober ska jag t.ex. föreläsa för en stor grupp med personal från olika Ungdomsmottagningar. Personer som är otroligt viktiga i mitt arbete och därför vill jag inte tacka nej trots lågt arvode.

Tack för att du tittade in hit och ett ännu större tack om du väljer att stötta mig så att jag kan genomföra min dröm! Det går att sätta in från 1 USD så det behövs inga stordåd, många bäckar små skapar stora mirakel.

P.S. Vill du få ett större intryck av vem jag är och varför jag brinner för att jobba mot sexuella övergrepp kan du titta på detta inslaget från TV4s morgonsoffa. 

P.S. 2 Här är en engelsk version om du föredrar det: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kim-a-book-in-swedish-for-young-kids#/story

story:
Short Summary

Alafia, peace. I am Khafre K. Abif, an AIDS activist thriving with HIV for 23 years.  I have compiled an anthology of inspirational prayers, poems, and affirmations to support the souls and uplift the spirits of people living with HIV/AIDS. For the last 20 months these submissions have touched my soul, made me cry, filled me with hope, and connected me to an international community of compassionate contributors sharing their work to empower my world.  Your sponsorship will bring healing words to those infected with and affected by HIV/AIDS.

I believe prayer heals.  I know words have power.  I provide this collection to combat the words so often spoken to those with HIV.  This is my effort to fight HIV-related stigma, the prejudice, negative attitudes, abuse, and maltreatment directed at people living with HIV and AIDS. The consequences of stigma and discrimination are wide-ranging: being shunned by family, peers, and the wider community, poor treatment in healthcare and educational settings, an erosion of rights, psychological damage, and a negative effect on HIV testing and treatment. The idea for the anthology grew out of my work as an HIV Test Counselor.  Each time I had to tell someone they tested positive for HIV, one of their first concerns was disclosure.  This anthology aims to help them through an entire book of encouragement. 

Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmation for People Living with HIV/AIDS has received submissions from Africa, Europe, South America, and the United States. Some contributors have even provided their work in their indigenous languages with English translations. I want to share this anthology with the international community who created it.  You, the reader may very well know someone living with HIV/AIDS. If you do, then they have shared their status with you.  Consider all who still haven’t disclosed to their mothers, fathers, sisters/brothers, or even their faith communities.  Where do they go for support and inspiration?  I use this anthology to encourage those in the shadows to come into the light. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your sponsorship will support the cost of self-publishing this anthology project, delivering a high-quality, eco-friendly printing of Cornbread, Fish and Collard Greens: Prayers, Poems & Affirmations for People Living with HIV/AIDS. In addition, sponsorship will also fund our cover art contract with award-winning illustrator, Javaka Steptoe.

For your Giving Backsponsorship of $50 you will receive a thank-you on the project website, and I will donate one copy of the book to an AIDS Service Organization in your city.  For your Name in Print sponsorship of $250, we will include your name in the acknowledgments of the anthology.   For $500, we will arrange a Skype reading and discussion for you and your friends and community.  And for your sponsorship of $1,000, I will travel to your city to share my story of living with HIV for 24 years—and you can host a private book signing.

The Impact

Your sponsorship will provide new voices to the long-silent AIDS story. It will provide hope, strength, and words that affirm, heal, and lift those who are infected and so often  marginalized —commercial sex workers, substance users, and gay people, especially those too afraid to share that they are gay with their families and churches, much less that they are living with HIV. 

Your sponsorship will ensure this anthology is presented in the spirit in which it has been compiled, a quilt of words that heal and affirm the soul. You will ensure the delivery of an aesthetically attractive book that is produced, designed and printed on quality paper.  Sponsorship will ensure each contributor in the United States and beyond receives one free copy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Post this campaign link of your Facebook page, send emails to your social network, and log on the campaign link to post comments.  Spread the word about this project and share it on Twitter so we can raise the GoGo Factor for this project.  Use the share tools to push this project out to your community.

Poets featured in the forthcoming anthology include: Nikki Grimes, Serena T. Wills, Reginald T. Jackson, Sharaledon D. Brave, r. witherspoon, Samiya Bashir, Storme Webber, Carl Hancock Rux, Tim’m T. West, Mose Xavier Hardin, Jr., Victor R. Pond, Catherine Zickgraf, Temujin Ekunfeo, Alfreda Lanoix. Maria Hiv Mejia, Tony Medina, Clifford C. Boyd, Rev. Nazim B. Fakir, lauren ryder Williams, W. Travis Wright, Vanessa German, Anthony “SleepyEyez” CarterRiver Huston, Mary Bowman, avery r. young, Lady Vee DaPoet and more. 

Please share this mission with us!

For your Giving Backsponsorship of $50 you will receive a thank-you on the project website, and I will donate one copy of the book to an AIDS Service Organization in your city.  For your Name in Print sponsorship of $250, we will include your name in the acknowledgments of the anthology.   For $500, we will arrange a Skype reading and discussion for you and your friends and community.  And for your sponsorship of $1,000, I will travel to your city to share my story of living with HIV for 24 years—and you can host a private book signing.


The Impact
Your sponsorship will provide new voices to the long-silent AIDS story. It will provide hope, strength, and words that affirm, heal, and lift those who are infected and so often  marginalized —commercial sex workers, substance users, and gay people, especially those too afraid to share that they are gay with their families and churches, much less that they are living with HIV. 
Your sponsorship will ensure this anthology is presented in the spirit in which it has been compiled, a quilt of words that heal and affirm the soul. You will ensure the delivery of an aesthetically attractive book that is produced, designed and printed on quality paper.  Sponsorship will ensure each contributor in the United States and beyond receives one free copy. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Post this campaign link of your Facebook page, send emails to your social network, and log on the campaign link to post comments.  Spread the word about this project and share it on Twitter so we can raise the GoGo Factor for this project.  Use the share tools to push this project out to your community.
Poets featured in the forthcoming anthology include: Nikki Grimes, Serena T. Wills, Reginald T. Jackson, Sharaledon D. Brave, r. witherspoon, Samiya Bashir, Storme Webber, Carl Hancock Rux, Tim’m T. West, Mose Xavier Hardin, Jr., Victor R. Pond, Catherine Zickgraf, Temujin Ekunfeo, Alfreda Lanoix. Maria Hiv Mejia, Tony Medina, Clifford C. Boyd, Rev. Nazim B. Fakir, lauren ryder Williams, W. Travis Wright, Vanessa German, Anthony “SleepyEyez” CarterRiver Huston, Mary Bowman, avery r. young, Lady Vee DaPoet and more. 
Please share this mission with us!

story:
THE OUTER DARK SYMPOSIUM ON THE GREATER WEIRD 2019

Saturday March 23, 10 a.m. – 10 p.m.

Silver Scream FX Lab, 4215 Thurman Rd, Conley, Georgia 30288

KICK-OFF EVENT: Friday Night Readings Presented by PseudoPod, Fri. March 22, 8:00-10:00 p.m, Welcome Reception (6-8 p.m.), Hotel Indigo-College Park, 1776 Harvard Ave, College Park, GA 30337

GUESTS/PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS: Mike Allen, Gregory Norman Bossert, David Bowles, Jesse Bullington, Nadia Bulkin, Selena Chambers, Gerald Coleman, Nancy A. Collins, Milton Davis, Kristi DeMeester, Kurt Fawver, John Foster, Chris Gavaler, Fiona Maeve Geist, Craig Laurance Gidney, Larissa Glasser, Orrin Grey, Edward Austin Hall, Lynne Hansen, Brian Kirk, Gwendolyn Kiste, Marc Laidlaw, Ian McDowell, Kyoko M, Gabriela Damian Miravete, Sunny Moraine, Shane Morton, Balogun Ojetade, Liv Rainey-Smith, Zin E. Rocklyn, Eric Schaller, Jeff Strand,  Damien Angelica Walters, Michael Wehunt, Lesley Wheeler, Gordon B. White, Lisa Yaszek.

ATTENDING PUBLISHERS: Mythic Delirium Press, Nightscape Press, PseudoPod

HOSTED BY:  Scott Nicolay & Anya Martin.

FOR MORE INFO: Facebook event page, follow us on Twitter, and purchase attending memberships at Brown Paper Tickets.

Welcome to The Outer Dark on This Is Horror. I’m your host Scott Nicolay bringing you news and interviews with the creative talents who operate far beyond the edge of the firelight. There Are Weird Things Out Here, My Friends…

When I conceived The Outer Dark podcast in 2015, I never expected it to take off like it has and to mean so much to listeners. As the tendrils of the Weird spread further into speculative and even mainstream fiction, film and TV, people kept asking me when we were going to do something more hands-on. Thus was born The Outer Dark Symposium on the Greater Weird.

The inaugural The Outer Dark Symposium 2017 in Atlanta confirmed that the Weird fiction community felt a burning desire for this kind of conversation and community-building. We were humbled to assemble a blockbuster line-up of contemporary Weird writers, as well as include key members of the African American spec-lit community. Everyone kept saying we had to do this again! So, in 2018, we took the symposium West and dreamed bigger with a truly Weird location, the Winchester Mystery House in San Jose, right on the heels of the Winchester movie!

ALL this only happened because you supported us, allowing us to share it with the whole Weird world on our host network This Is Horror. If you haven’t checked it, you can find all our 2017 and 2018 symposium episodes at www.theouterdark.com.

This year we’re beyond excited to welcome our largest line-up yet, 40 of the most dynamic authors, editors, artists, publishers, and scholars in Weird fiction today. As with The Outer Dark podcast, our goal is to foster conversation and community among a diverse slate of program participants--inclusive, safe and welcoming to women, LBGTQ+, and writers of color. Returning to Atlanta allows us again to involve SOBSF/BlacktastiCon organizers Milton Davis and Balogun Ojetade. And sponsor support from Silvia Moreno-Garcia's Innsmouth Free Press is helping us bring Mexican author Gabriela Damián Miravete.

As for our 2019 location, it’s ALL about the love of Weird monsters! Silver Scream FX Lab is a floor-to-ceiling funhouse featuring both a special effects make-up/props/costume studio and an extensive Retro movie monster museum. At Silver Scream, Shane Morton and his team designed and created the Cheddar Goblin for the crazed Nicholas Cage cult hit Mandy (2018), as well as work for AdultSwim's Your Pretty Face is Going to Hell, Too Many Cooks, & more. Shane will be leading an exclusive behind-the-scenes tour and treating attendees to a one-of-a-kind live magic performance emceed by Professor Morte, "The Ghost Host with the Most" of Atlanta’s popular Silver Scream Spook Show.

A key goal remains to keep the symposium immersive, intimate, and budget-responsible. Keeping to the same feasible model that worked well for the previous two symposiums, attendance is limited to 75 memberships and a few hardworking volunteers. Everyone attends all panels and readings and shares breakfast, lunch and dinner, as well as welcome and author signing receptions and social activities to continue the conversation into the night. However, we couldn’t assemble such an amazing line-up of program participants for you to hear on the podcast without providing air, hotel, and membership assistance to some guests, as well as covering lodging and meals for our hardworking volunteers. We could increase membership rates, but they are already $100, and we personally think that’s high even though it barely covers space rental, catering, audio equipment, badge printing/laminating and other basic event expenses. We could double our attendance, and we may consider the latter for next year, but that would risk compromising the intimacy that makes the symposium unique on the spec-lit convention circuit and mean paying more for a larger venue.

So instead we are humbly again reaching out to you, It takes a Weird village to make something Weird and extraordinary happen. The only way we have been able to do this for the past two years is through a combination of memberships, sponsorships, and crowdsourcing, i.e. Indiegogo campaigns. Our hope always is to simply break even and keep this happening as an annual event (we’ve already got some amazing guests lining up to attend in 2020!). If by any unlikely chance, we do make any more than we need, that money will go straight back into seeding next year's symposium.

Through this Indiegogo campaign, you can both help sustain the symposium and receive rewards. ALL supporters receive a The Outer Dark sticker and ALL $20 and up perks include a bonus ebook of For Mortal Things Unsung, Pseudopod's 10th anniversary anthology featuring stories by Orrin Grey, Damien Angelica Walters, Livia Llewellyn, Joe R. Lansdale & many more (a big thanks to Alex and Melissa Hofelich!). And every donation comes with the peace of mind that you helped make something Weird happen!

Here’s just a taste of what’s available:

  • Supporting Weird ($25). Can't attend but really want to make this happen? As a supporting member, you'll get our exclusive program chapbook, available otherwise only to attendees and featuring stunning original cover art by Liv Rainey-Smith, as well as articles and fiction by some of our program participants. Not only that supporting members’ copies will be signed by ALL our attending program participants. We'll also throw in some stickers and other surprise symposium giveaways, so buy one for yourself and one for a Weird friend!
  • Stylish Weird ($20). The Outer Dark podcast official T-shirt ($20) featuring our killer logo designed by “Nick the Hat” Gucker (men’s sizes S, M, L, XL, 2XL & 3XL). And yes, stickers and other fun surprises with every order!
  • Stylish Supporting Weird ($40) Up to 10 supporters will receive BOTH the program chapbook signed by ALL attending program participants AND The Outer Dark podcast official T-shirt.
  • Books, Books & More Books! (various prices). All generously donated by our guests and by our publisher sponsors with the bonus that most will be signed & personalized by our attending guests.
  • Horror Movie & Comics Memorabilia! Thanks to Linnea Quigley for signing “Chainsaw Kisses” to The Outer Dark, and Bill Moseley & Sid Haig for a signed mini-poster to the much-anticipated Rob Zombie’s Three in Hell. Plus a Swamp Thing Weird bundle, Swamp Thing #129, the first official Vertigo imprint issue signed by writer Nancy A. Collins & stunning Czech hardcover Swamp Thing: Bazinac, which collects the first issues of the seminal Alan Moore/Stephen Bissette/John Totleben collaboration.
  • NecronomiCon Weird ($75). Purchase one of the FOUR memberships to NecronomiCon Providence 2019, widely viewed as the biannual worldwide summit for H.P.Lovecraft and Weird fiction. Thanks again, Niels Hobbs!
  • Hellraiser Weird ($800) A first edition of The Hellraiser Chronicles (Titan Books, 1992) signed to The Outer Dark by Clive Barker and SEVEN Hellraiser actors including Pinhead himself (Doug Bradley), cenobites Barbie Wilde, Nicholas Vince, and Simon Bamford, as well as Ashley Lawrence and Andrew Robinson. These aren’t just title page signatures, but personalized to “The Outer Dark” on pages featuring photos of each person/character, making it a truly special one-of-a-kind collectible. And if that’s not enough!--Clive did an accompanying original sketch also dedicated to The Outer Dark! Signatures happened at Days of the Dead Atlanta 2019, and we’d like to express our heartfelt thanks to Clive and everyone else who participated in this generous donation to our Weird cause.   

Keep checking back because we expect to add more items!

Finally, if you're a publisher or have a Weird-related product or service, sponsorship opportunities are another way to help. The Outer Dark also thanks its 2019 sponsors: Argawarga Press, Broken Eye Books, ChiZine Publications, Dim Shores, Dunhams Manor Press, Eraserhead Press, Gehenna & Hinnom Books, Innsmouth Free Press, Horror in Clay, Kino Lorber, Mocha Memoirs Press, MVMedia, Mythic Delirium Press, NecronomiCon Providence, Nightscript, Nightscape Press, Perpetual Motion Machine Publications, Revelator, Signal Horizon, Trepidatio Publishing, Undertow Publications, Word Horde, and Grimscribe Press/Vastarien: A Literary Journal. Sponsorship opportunities are still available. Please drop a line to theouterdarkpodcast@gmail.com and we’ll be glad to provide you with cash and in-kind (we still welcome adds to this Indiegogo campaign!) options or to customize a plan that works for your promotional needs.

Whatever you can afford or even if you just share this campaign on social media, you have our deepest gratitude!

Weirdest regards,

 

Scott Nicolay, Executive Producer/Host

Anya Martin, Producer

Melanie Crew, Symposium Chair

The Outer Dark Podcast, www.theouterdark.com

story:
Do you know that just writing a little bit every day will give you a novel within a year? Have you ever thought you would like to write a novel but you don’t have time? 

As the organiser of Novel London, I have worked with over 70 novelists to promote fresh fiction. For three years, we had a monthly novelist reading in various central London bookshops and venues. We will be back next year with a weekend Literature festival but in the meantime, I have been working on a special journal for novelists. Each page is a different chapter and you can use it to write your thoughts from the day, plan and reach your goals or write your story your way, every single day! 

 

This beautifully crafted journal is not like any other on the market. It may the the size of an average novel, but there is nothing average about the stories you can write in it. It looks, feels and even smells like a novel. There are pages at the front for you to plan your story, write character profiles or your plot and at the back there are more pages for notes.

What story will you tell in 2019?  

This campaign is very important to me because I have met countless people who want to write a book who believe they do not have the time. But you know what they say – if you can see it, you can achieve. So get writing in the first Novel London Journal. Let me know how you get along!

Your contribution to this campaign will allow you to preorder this unique journal and write like a pro! 

What We Need & What You Get

There is a minimum target we need to reach in order to cover the costs of the printing of a batch of journals. The more journals we print, the cheaper the price. 

The interior has been designed, the cover has three options and all we need is the cost of the printing to be covered and we will give the printer the go-ahead to print the first 100 copies. 

The Impact

 

The Back Story 

As a novelist and event organiser, I understand the importance of having a structure for which you can write or fulfil your dream.  My own debut novel took way too long to write but I wrote it and published it and it was an experience that I have shared with many people. 

 

Risks & Challenges

It is my pleasure to have worked with over 70 novelists to promote their work on social media. Here is just a few of them...

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is not receiving the full amount to cover the cost of production. As soon as we reach the minimum target, the printers will take three days to print and the journals will be dispatched as soon as we receive them. The timeline is tight but all things are ready and set to produce. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please get the word out for this campaign and share on Facebook, Twitter and email. 

Someone’s story may depend on it!

And please don’t forget, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for reading this far and thank you for your support.

Keep calm, keep reading and keep writing!

story:
Help us finish the 2018 Hanging Lantern Review 6th Anniversary print issue, preorder a copy, and reserve a spot at our Spring Reading + Release Party!

READING + RELEASE PARTY: 
Tuesday, May 22, 2018 (6:30 pm - Doors at 6) 
Dallidet Adobe
San Luis Obispo, CA

ISSUE RELEASE DATE: MAY 22, 2018

We're Hanging Lantern Review, San Luis Obispo's first literary journal made for and by Central Coast teens! We publish high quality middle school and high school fiction, nonfiction, poetry, and art. We're ready to release our 6th Anniversary Issue! Every pledge gets us closer to our goal, and ensures that we will continue to be able to invest in our local literary culture for years to come! 

Who are we? Our staff is made up of real high school students from San Luis Obispo Classical Academy. We work all year long to solicit quality work from our peers, curate, design, and publish our beautiful journal, coordinate a blog and website, and host writing-inspired events. 

In 2013, we launched an IndieGoGo campaign, and with your help, we raised over $2500! That got us started. Since then, we have had an amazing SIX SEASONS in print, and we want to keep going! Since we began with that first IndieGoGo campaign, we have curated, printed, and sold hundreds of issues, purchased a new Mac computer for our designers, and funded a subscription for Adobe software. We have published work from high schoolers and middle schoolers from more than 10 local schools, trained and prepared dozens of teenage staff members for the business of publishing, and we've held TWO SUMMER WORKSHOPS for aspiring writers. 

Now, heading into another busy release season, we need just a little bit of money up front to get these journals out on time and allow us to throw an awesome Spring Reading & Release Party to celebrate what we've been able to accomplish together.

What We Need + What You Get

We'll need around $500 to cover the up front costs of printing and shipping the journal and renting the venue for our release party! We are an entirely self-funded school club. We raise all our own funds and manage all our own money. Therefore, every contribution makes a powerful impact!

Here are a few of our popular preorder + perk options: 

Preorder the 2018 Hanging Lantern Review Print Issue -- SHIP ($10)

Reserve a ticket to our Spring Reading and Release Party ($10) 

Print Issue + Release Party Ticket Bundle ($15) *Best Value

2 Release Party Tickets + 2 Print Issues ($30.00) *Best Value 

Note: if there is a perk you would like us to design for you, such as a specified number of release party tickets or journals, please email msshotwell@sloclassical.org and she will help design a reward for you and your family!  Or, if you just want to make a donation to the journal, we would be honored to have your help!

Risks + Challenges

This is a flexible funding campaign, which means we are opting to accept any and all donations, even if we don't meet our minimum goal. This is because the issue is on its way - even if we don't meet the goal this spring, we will still get the issue out, and every dollar will help us to do that! Having the funds come early through our preorder eliminates strain on our budget, and allows us to get a head start for next year! 

NOTE: We have had issues with our technology and software this year that may delay our official release date. In the event that the magazine is released after May 22, you will receive any copies of the journal by mail with no additional charge to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge or won't be able to attend the release party, we would love help spreading the word through Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter!

Every pledge gets us closer to our goal, and ensures that we will continue to be able to invest in our local literary culture for years to come! Who are we? Our staff is made up of real high school students from San Luis Obispo Classical Academy. We work all year long to solicit quality work from our peers, curate, design, and publish our beautiful journal, coordinate a blog and website, and host writing-inspired events. In 2013, we launched an IndieGoGo campaign, and with your help, we raised over $2500! That got us started. Since then, we have had an amazing SIX SEASONS in print, and we want to keep going! Since we began with that first IndieGoGo campaign, we have curated, printed, and sold hundreds of issues, purchased a new Mac computer for our designers, and funded a subscription for Adobe software. We have published work from high schoolers and middle schoolers from more than 10 local schools, trained and prepared dozens of teenage staff members for the business of publishing, and we've held TWO SUMMER WORKSHOPS for aspiring writers. Now, heading into another busy release season, we need just a little bit of money up front to get these journals out on time and allow us to throw an awesome Spring Reading & Release Party to celebrate what we've been able to accomplish together.What We Need + What You GetWe'll need around $500 to cover the up front costs of printing and shipping the journal and renting the venue for our release party! We are an entirely self-funded school club. We raise all our own funds and manage all our own money. Therefore, every contribution makes a powerful impact!Here are a few of our popular preorder + perk options: Preorder the 2018 Hanging Lantern Review Print Issue -- SHIP ($10)Reserve a ticket to our Spring Reading and Release Party ($10) Print Issue + Release Party Ticket Bundle ($15) *Best Value2 Release Party Tickets + 2 Print Issues ($30.00) *Best Value Note: if there is a perk you would like us to design for you, such as a specified number of release party tickets or journals, please email msshotwell@sloclassical.org and she will help design a reward for you and your family!  Or, if you just want to make a donation to the journal, we would be honored to have your help!Risks + ChallengesThis is a flexible funding campaign, which means we are opting to accept any and all donations, even if we don't meet our minimum goal. This is because the issue is on its way - even if we don't meet the goal this spring, we will still get the issue out, and every dollar will help us to do that! Having the funds come early through our preorder eliminates strain on our budget, and allows us to get a head start for next year! NOTE: We have had issues with our technology and software this year that may delay our official release date. In the event that the magazine is released after May 22, you will receive any copies of the journal by mail with no additional charge to you.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't pledge or won't be able to attend the release party, we would love help spreading the word through Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter!

story:
How Fighter Became a Peacemaker

I was born with a fiery temperament. As a child and youngster I constantly ended up in physical fights. As an adult I was not involved in physical fights but I always seemed to be surrounded by verbal fighting and people betraying me in various ways.

I moved many times and were involved in many kinds of social groups but the pattern was always the same. I would get in never-ending clashes within the group and especially with any "enemies" of the group. I also fought with my spouses and family members. I got even released from military service with a psychiatrists statement for being too risky personality. And I had served only for three days.

I always blamed others for my clashes. If they would change the world would be a better place. All this time I had also suffered from generalized anxiety disorder, recurring depression and several addictions: alcohol, drugs, games and sex to mention a few. When I finally went to see a psychiatrist psychotherapy and the drugs I was prescribed helped me next to nothing. And I was still blaming others for everything.

Few years ago when I had three total breakdowns within a year, I decided that I cannot live like that anymore. For the first time I was determined to heal myself for good. I had read self-help literature before but hadn't really done anything to change my behavior. Now I started to really follow the footsteps of people who had walked on Earth before me. I combined thousands of years of wisdom with modern human sciences and found my path towards the top of the mountains. Now I want to share this wisdom and ease your path, that you wouldn't have to trudge in deep snow as we say in Finland.

My intention is not only to help only You but the whole human kind. I honestly believe that a world without wars or everyday clashes between people is possible. That might not happen during my lifetime, but I do care too much for humanity to let that slow me down.

You Are Humanity is an ongoing project for peace within and in the world. The book is only the first part of it. The first seed that will someday become a wast tree. Please give me your hand. We can make this together!

About the Author

I am 38 year old passionate global activist. I have studied philosophy, sociology and cultural anthropology academically. I have worked both voluntarily and professionally in many non-profit organizations and in social and political campaigns. My other professions have included working as journalist, columnist, graphic designer and psychiatric nurse.

The Budget

The writing process of the book has been going on already for a year. I have already material for a hundred pages. I just need few more months to finish the book. I need the money to pay the rent and feed myself and my two children during the rest of the writing process. The book will be published one day anyways, but the more money is raised, the sooner it will be published. Some of the money will of course be spend on the printing and posting of the books but the exact amount depends on the perks chosen. Any excess of the goal will be spent in marketing the book and starting next phases of You Are Humanity project. Every dollar is one step towards world peace.

Your Contibution is Vital

Please contribute in any way you can. Every dollar counts. If you do not have any extra money right now, you can help by spreading out the word. Please do at least one of the following:

  • Contribute an amount of money that is reasonable for your current financial situation
  • Share the campaign in Facebook, Twitter etc with the buttons on top right of the page
  • Mention the campaign in a discussion - in the internet or in real life

What ever you do or don't do, I thank you just for being alive. Because You Are Humanity!

story:
Qui est Ugo ?

Auteur, conférencier et globetrotter, Ugo Monticone parcours le monde pour s'en inspirer. Auteur du "Livre numérique réinventé" (LaPresse+), "Le livre du futur" Journal 24h, "Coup de cœur" du Réseau des bibliothèques de Montréal,  d'une "œuvre audacieuse et réussie" (Journal Voir), finaliste au Grand prix littéraire Archambault, récipiendaire d'un Grand prix boomeranG et conférencier pour les Grands explorateurs, Ugo revient avec Volcán, un roman écrit suite à son périple au Guatemala.

 

Volcán

"Partir. Quitter. Tout laisser derrière... Reprendre mon sac pour affronter l'immense liberté qui vient de s'imposer à moi si brutalement. Pourquoi le Guatemala ? Je m'imagine sous les lianes, foulant les décombres d'une ancienne civilisation engloutie par la jungle, mojito à la main."

Dans ce roman décapant, teinté d'humour et de découverte, Ugo nous mène au cœur des Amériques, berceau de la civilisation Maya.

  • Vous achetez une édition limitée du livre papier (100 exemplaires), numérotée et dédicacée. Ou la version numérique immersive créée par l'artiste multidisciplinaire MissPixels (finaliste aux Prix Numix 2018).
  • Un roman de 224 pages, qui devient vivant grâce aux images, animations et illustrations de MissPixels (version numérique).

 

    L'impact de votre contribution

    En achetant Volcán en prévente exclusive, vous soutenez le prochain projet numérique d'Ugo Monticone, une application numérique où le lecteur pourra voyager de facon interractive à travers le monde par le biais de ses récits de voyage.

    • Son précédent projet numérique, "Le vendeur de goyaves", a été considéré comme le premier roman numérique immersif au monde est s'est hissé au premier rang des ventes de livres sur le AppStore Canada. Le projet que vous soutenez grâce à cette campagne ira encore plus loin :)

     

    MERCI DE M'AIDER EN PARTAGEANT CE PROJET DANS VOS RÉSEAUX : www.LivreNumerique.ca

    Je vous aime.

story:
¿Qué?

Malangost es una de esas novelas que profundizan en las miserias de la naturaleza humana, generando esa misma sensación hipnótica de presenciar un naufragio... sin duda, un libro que no deja indiferente.

Dos personajes ficticios, ubicados en la Barcelona de los años previos a la guerra española, se mezclan e interaccionan con una serie de personajes (algunos auténticos y otros inventados), en el desarrollo de una trama de acontecimientos reales que condicionaron poderosamente todos los hechos que sucederán en la España de 1936, y que abrieron el camino a la confrontación.

Con ese dúctil hilo conductor, el relato narra la confluencia temporal y casual de dos seres situados en el declive de sus respectivas trayectorias vitales, que se embarcan por separado en un mismo viaje en busca de una oportunidad para reorientar sus vidas. Ambos contribuirán, sin proponérselo, a la recuperación de la dignidad y la identidad de toda una etnia, poniendo al descubierto las vergüenzas de una política colonial ―la española― que con sus leyes y normas sociales protegía y fomentaba una forma de explotación racial, todavía vigente en el segundo tercio del siglo XX.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Ángel Luis de Sousa.

Ha tardado mucho tiempo ―quizás demasiado, según él― en descubrir cuánto puede llegar a disfrutar poniendo en palabras aquellas  historias que bullen en su cabeza, sin cuestionarse cómo, porqué o para quién.

Arquitecto de formación, restaurador de monumentos por vocación y gestor de proyectos culturales por el devenir del tiempo, toda su actividad y su experiencia en el campo literario se limitaba, hasta 2016, a un puñado de artículos y publicaciones de marcado contenido técnico en revistas especializadas, y varias coautorías de libros monográficos.

En ese año Tandaia publicó La oscuridad de la razón, su primera incursión en un terreno distinto al habitual. Un thriller político que plantea dilemas sociológicos y éticos aún hoy sin resolver. Ahora, con este nuevo relato, Malangost, el autor continúa en esa línea oscura, y vuelve a barnizar de ficción un hecho real que puso fin al bienio Radical-Cedista de la Segunda República.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Ese verano de 1935 era especialmente caluroso en Barcelona y la altísima humedad del ambiente hacía más difícil soportarlo. En la sofocante noche, la figura aún esbelta de María de Lucena —en realidad Encarnación Romero—, caminaba fumando con cierta elegancia y mucha dignidad por la acera Norte de la Avenida del Paral-lel, camino de su pensión en el Carrer de Tapioles.
          A sus treinta y cuatro años la carrera artística de María de Lucena agonizaba sin remedio ni esperanza. Apenas ocho años atrás estaba actuando en los mejores teatros de esa calle, como el Victoria, el Apolo o el Condal, pero el mundo del espectáculo en la avenida era tan dinámico y tan exigente que generaba una competencia feroz, y la renovación de las carteleras era constante. Además, Evaristo Mediavilla, su representante borrachín y putero, no supo administrar ese éxito inicial y después de tres o cuatro años en la cumbre, comenzó el descenso hacia los teatros de segunda como el Molino o el Arnau, para acabar finalmente en los cabarets de las callejuelas»

«Lucas Mumbrú, más conocido como Malangost, era un personaje respetado y temido a partes iguales, tanto en el Poble Sec como en el Raval, es decir, a ambos lados del Paral-lel. A pesar de su mediana edad era ya una leyenda urbana en cuyo currículo figuraban más hechos delictivos ficticios que reales pero que, en cualquier caso, dibujaban un perfil humano frío e implacable, aunque equilibrado y a su modo legal, que despertaba una extraña simpatía entre el vecindario como suele ocurrir con los capos de la mafia calabresa.
          Nadie maltrataba a sus putas y nadie mangoneaba con su mercancía de estraperlo. Incluso la policía local prefería dejarle en paz y no meter las narices en sus asuntos que, por otra parte, se desarrollaban con absoluta discreción en medio de la complicidad del vecindario. Vivía sin agobios económicos, pero con austeridad. No se le conocía pareja, ni amigos, aunque en una parte de su leyenda se mencionaba que en otros tiempos hubo una mujer, tan hermosa como infiel, por la que tuvo que acuchillar a un hombre y huir al destierro»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Malangost que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para haceros llegar el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ángel Luis de Sousa vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
Story of My Book

shades is a book of poetry about love, loss, learning, and life.

My name is Samantha Finley and I am the author of shades. I wrote this book because I want to share my experience of vast emotions with the world.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you are never alone in your experiences. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for life in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help get you through the tough times and be emotionally available for the good times.

In this book, you'll hear about:
  • love: the firsts, the awkward, and the defining moments
  • loss: the lasts, the painful, and the hardest moments
  • learning: the middle, the eye-opening, and the richest moments
  • life: the entirety, the encompassing, and all the moments
You will love this book if you are someone who understands the struggle and the balance between sex and love, family and friends, light and darkness, and learning and growing.
 

The Book: shades

The book is written in four parts:

Part one, love, contains poems about “catching feels”, experiencing intimacy for the first time, and defining the true meaning of love.

Part two, loss, contains poems about breakups, sexual assault, losing friends, and the trauma that comes with growing up.

Part three, learning, contains poems that showcase how to properly cope with loss, move forward with life after love, and learn to come into your identity.

Part four, life, contains poems that properly highlight the meaning of friendship and family, while also bringing light to small daily observations that often get overlooked.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020!
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish!

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Samantha Finley, or Sam for short, is a student at the College of Staten Island studying Adolescent English Education with a concentration in Literature. She is a Pisces who is passionate about helping others and always seems to find herself in unique situations.

Sam has been writing poetry since the sixth grade and hasn't stopped since. She uses writing as her outlet for the emotions she oftentimes has trouble feeling off paper. Sam will usually write her poetry through “poetic visions” where she will see the words floating in her head before they hit the page.

When Sam isn't writing, she is usually crafting Spotify playlists based on the season, or watching TV with her mom and dog, Sebastian. You will most often find her in her school's library or at the Taco Bell in the local mall. She has insomnia but will always drink cold brew just before bed.

For more information you can connect with Sam at samfinleypoet@yahoo.com, on Instagram @hamfinley, or on Twitter @hamxfinley.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #shades and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Samantha (Sam) Finley

story:
Short Summary

Blogging on Instagram is a book to help aspiring as well as experienced writers harness the reach and gratification of posting on Instagram. Whether a novice who has never used Instagram, or someone who has maintained a presence for years, there are tips and insights that will help users at any level.

Hi, my name is Terri Nakamura, and I am the author of Blogging on Instagram — a book that shows people how fun and easy it is to publish writing and build an engaged community of readers and connections using Instagram.

By reading this book, you will discover the joy of writing to an audience that looks forward to your posts and feels invested in your writing journey. Understanding how to use features and acquiring skills to help you succeed will inspire passion and excitement for blogging on Instagram. As you make connections around the world you'll find your tribe and develop a feeling of  belonging. Ultimately, this book is a tool to help you succeed as you embark on your journey to use Instagram as a blogging channel.

In my book you'll learn about others who are blogging on Instagram, using it to:

  • Draw readers into a digital diary
  • Cultivate an audience for businesses that promote creativity
  • Follow the journey of a digital nomad

 

You will love this book if:

  • You love blogging or social media
  • You'd like to see how it feels to have an audience for your writing
  • You’re a blogger who would like more readers and more engagement
  • You're an Instagram user who would simply enjoy having more interaction with your posts.

 

Blogging on Instagram is a nonfiction book that speaks to writers, would-be writers and existing Instagram users who are curious to start on a new path for blogging and a new way to use Instagram.

About the Author

Terri Nakamura is a writer, an award-winning designer, content creator, and early adopter of social media and blogging. In 2014 she was named by Business Insider as one of 100 most influential tech women on Twitter, and she’s been a social media influencer for the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas for 4 years. She’s worked with OMMedia, partnering with Verizon Wireless and other technology clients since 2014.

As a blogger, she realized blogging on Instagram was game changing. This campaign is important because the book will help writers experience increased post engagement with an audience that is always there. 

Your support will help make a dream come true. Terri has always wanted to write a book, but Blogging on Instagram gave her a purpose. Investing in this project will enable users to experience how it feels to cultivate a community of readers who become your friends and your best supporters. 

On a nice day, Terri can be found detailing her vintage 1976 BMW 2002, cooking and baking from scratch, teaching tricks to her cats who act like dogs, or spending time on social media. She is a Law and Order junkie and has seen every episode. It’s her fantasy to be an extra (even a dead body) on the show.

For more information, you can connect with Terri Nakamura at terri.nakamura@gmail.com and @terrinakamura on Twitter and Instagram.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer, 2021.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
    (For international preorders, please send me a private message.)
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

The Impact

Blogging on Instagram will provide the tools to help writers publish to a platform that reaches more than a billion people. By testing the waters on Instagram, it could act as a springboard for launching a blog in the future, but it will always be beneficial to maintain a presence in an ecosystem where writers have visibility and can enjoy interacting with their audiences.

This is my first crowdsourcing campaign. I’ve supported more than 75 campaigns here and on other platforms including 60 successful projects. I think many of us want to nurture the spirit of entrepreneurship and feel great about supporting a project that comes to fruition. I hope you’ll help my book make it to the finish line!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BloggingonInstagram and tag me @terrinakamura as well as my publisher, New Degree Press (@newdegreepress), so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again, Terri Nakamura

story:
Content / Obsah: 

The book in preparation contains 471 listed names. Four hundred seventy-one of persecuted, imprisoned or killed brave men of the Roman - Catholic clergy, victims who risked or lost their lives in the era of 1938 – 1945, during the Nazi occupation of Czechoslovakia. Many of these names or stories completely lost for ages, now raised again in this book, testify as important evidence. It is their personal courage, empathy, or simple human dignity in the clash with a monstrous and evil enemy, in the middle of struggle, fear and oppression in a tragedy of the global mankind. Our Shepherds did not leave their flock. Readers will also find much of the rare photo material presented in this planned, fully extended issue. In addition, the title "Our Shepherds 1938 - 1945" also presents personal memories of Allied forces chaplains, during their service throughout the various battlefields of the Second World War.

Tato pamětihodná kniha obsahuje 471 jmen. 471 pronásledovaných, uvězněných nebo zabitých odvážných mužů římsko-katolické církve; obětí, které riskovaly nebo ztratily svůj život v letech 1939 – 1945 v nacisty okupovaném Československu. Mnoho jmen zůstalo zapomenuto, dnes jsou však znovu rozpomenuta jako důležité memento. Kniha mimo jiné u každého z publikovaných jmen obsahuje stručný popis životních událostí a osudů, ve kterých se mísí osobní odvaha, soucit nebo ryzí lidská důstojnost. Příběhy o utrpení, strachu a útlaku uprostřed globálního konfliktu, v područí temného nepřítele. Čtenáři a studenti jistě ocení mnoho zapomenutého fotomateriálu, který tato kniha mimo jiné představí. Jako bonusový materiál navíc v knize naleznete otištěny poutavé osobní příběhy a vzpomínky kaplanů a duchovních různých národností na jejich službu na bojištích druhé světové války.

 

Background / Pozadí vzniku knihy

One of the reasons behind the creation of this book were the outrageous claims of some of the leftist members of the Czech Parliament regarding the alleged collaboration of the clergy with the Nazi regime during the Second World War in former Czechoslovakia. This disturbing and despicable lie motivated Miroslav Kalousek, also a member of the Parliament, with other colleagues, to initiate a historical research and name-gathering of the Roman - Catholic clergy victims persecuted, tortured or killed by the Nazi regime. The resulting collection was initially printed as a simple paperback only and sent to all clergymen in the Czech Republic. Now, the authors would like to take one step further and release a fully extended historical research, enriched by visual material with high-quality paper and book binding.

Projekt Naši pastýři před třemi lety odstartovaly ostudné výroky levicových poslanců, kteří tvrdili, že klérus za druhé světové války kolaboroval s nacismem. Lež byla natolik pobuřující, že poslanec Miroslav Kalousek se skupinou dobrovolníků inicioval shromažďování jmen katolických duchovních pronásledovaných, vězněných či zabitých nacistickým režimem. Takto vznikla první paperbacková verze Našich pastýřů 1938 - 1945. Její prostý výtisk byl následně zaslán všem farářům v ČR. Nyní by autoři rádi vydali rozšířené důstojnější vydání pro veřejnost – obohacené o hlubší a stále pokračující historický výzkum, velmi zajímavý obrazový materiál a v knize s odpovídajícím tiskem a solidní vazbou.

 

In search of evidence / Hledání důkazů 

The title presents highly important historical and personal evidence collected and catalogued in the Czech Republic. The book sheds light on some of the historical dogmas of the time, trying to clarify many lies, which disgraced the honour of the Roman-Catholic clergy in Czechoslovakia during the critical era of 1939 - 1945. The title carries another piece of the simple truth, with the humble effort to shed light on the historical injustice and also on certain prejudice. It includes several of the previously unknown or lost facts, along with valuable information for anyone interested in this often highly controversial subject.

Kniha prezentuje důležité osobní důkazy a výpovědi o smutných osudech odvážných duchovních. Osvětluje některá historická dogmata, ve snaze očistit historii od lží, které zostudily čest a jméno římskokatolické církve v Československu v letech 1939 – 1945. Kniha "Naši pastýři 1938 - 1945" přináší další kus pravdivého obrazu o věci, proti které stojí mnohé historické nespravedlnosti, které uváděla v život následná komunistická propaganda režimu, který byl krutý stejně jako ten předchozí. Kniha přináší další hodnotné důkazy a  dříve neznámá fakta, která přijdou vhod každému, kdo hledá informace o tomto kontroverzním tématu. 

Psalm 119:160 "The sum of your word is truth, and every one of your righteous rules endures  forever."

Žalm 119:160 "To hlavní v tvém slovu je pravda, každý soud tvé spravedlnosti je věčný."

 

Project funding / Přispění na projekt

Due to the fact that the book will present rare information and graphic content, it should be printed in a distinctive and appropriate manner, providing the reader and library with a piece made from generously selected materials - from paper quality, to hard cover binding, to letter print. The money collected will be used to cover all costs, including the book’s preparation: research costs, photo / graphic and print preparation, along with the full printing cost of 800 pieces.

Kniha obsahuje některé dosud nepříliš známé informace i raritní fotografie, a věnuje se tématu, který si zaslouží důstojnou prezentaci a odpovídající provedení, poskytující čtenáři či knihovně kvalitně zpracovaný titul – od obálky, po kvalitu papíru či tisk. Peníze, které budou na tento projekt vybrány, budou použity na pokrytí nákladů na celé plánované knižní vydání v počtu 800 ks. Do těchto nákladů jsou zahrnuty náklady na výzkum, sazba, příprava grafických podkladů a jejich zpracování, příprava tiskových podkladů a náklady na samotný tisk 800 ks knihy.  

Participating authors / Participující autoři:
Miroslav Kalousek, M.S.E.

Miroslav Kalousek co-founded the conservative political platform TOP 09. Together with the effort of many of his colleagues, the party achieved respectable election results in 2010, gaining a strong political influence in the upcoming era. During the years 2007 – 2009 and 2010 - 2013, Miroslav Kalousek became Minister of Finance of the Czech Republic. He was awarded with the prestigious title of the “Finance Minister of the Year for Central & Eastern Europe” during 2008 and 2010, by the prestigious Emerging Markets magazine.

Doc. Mgr. Jaroslav Šebek, Ph.D.

The head advisor of the project. A Czech historian, member of the Institute of History of the Czech Academy of Science in Prague, an expert on the history of the Czech country-regions in the 20th century, the history of political parties, the Czech - German relations and the history of the church.

University students with an interest in history.

Ing. Miroslav Kalousek

Spoluzakladatel politické strany TOP 09. Společně s úsilím mnoha jeho kolegů získala nová strana solidní volební podporu v roce 2010 a tím i výrazný politický vliv v nadcházejících obdobích. V letech 2007 – 2009 a následně 2010 – 2013 se stal Miroslav Kalousek ministrem financí ČR. Za svoje působení a činnost na ministerstvu obdržel prestižní cenu a titul „Ministr financí roku pro Střední Evropu a Východní Evropu v letech 2008 a 2010“, vyhlašovanou mezinárodním renomovaným časopisem „Emerging Markets“.


Doc. Mgr. Jaroslav Šebek, Ph.D.

Hlavní odborný poradce projektu. Český historik, pracovník Historického ústavu AV ČR Praha, zaměřující se na dějiny českých zemí 20. století, zejména dějiny politických stran, česko-německé vztahy a církevní dějiny.

Studenti vysokých škol se zájmem o historii.
story_txt: Content / Obsah: The book in preparation contains 471 listed names. Four hundred seventy-one of persecuted, imprisoned or killed brave men of the Roman - Catholic clergy, victims who risked or lost their lives in the era of 1938 – 1945, during the Nazi occupation of Czechoslovakia. Many of these names or stories completely lost for ages, now raised again in this book, testify as important evidence. It is their personal courage, empathy, or simple human dignity in the clash with a monstrous and evil enemy, in the middle of struggle, fear and oppression in a tragedy of the global mankind. Our Shepherds did not leave their flock. Readers will also find much of the rare photo material presented in this planned, fully extended issue. In addition, the title "Our Shepherds 1938 - 1945" also presents personal memories of Allied forces chaplains, during their service throughout the various battlefields of the Second World War.Tato pamětihodná kniha obsahuje 471 jmen. 471 pronásledovaných, uvězněných nebo zabitých odvážných mužů římsko-katolické církve; obětí, které riskovaly nebo ztratily svůj život v letech 1939 – 1945 v nacisty okupovaném Československu. Mnoho jmen zůstalo zapomenuto, dnes jsou však znovu rozpomenuta jako důležité memento. Kniha mimo jiné u každého z publikovaných jmen obsahuje stručný popis životních událostí a osudů, ve kterých se mísí osobní odvaha, soucit nebo ryzí lidská důstojnost. Příběhy o utrpení, strachu a útlaku uprostřed globálního konfliktu, v područí temného nepřítele. Čtenáři a studenti jistě ocení mnoho zapomenutého fotomateriálu, který tato kniha mimo jiné představí. Jako bonusový materiál navíc v knize naleznete otištěny poutavé osobní příběhy a vzpomínky kaplanů a duchovních různých národností na jejich službu na bojištích druhé světové války. Background / Pozadí vzniku knihyOne of the reasons behind the creation of this book were the outrageous claims of some of the leftist members of the Czech Parliament regarding the alleged collaboration of the clergy with the Nazi regime during the Second World War in former Czechoslovakia. This disturbing and despicable lie motivated Miroslav Kalousek, also a member of the Parliament, with other colleagues, to initiate a historical research and name-gathering of the Roman - Catholic clergy victims persecuted, tortured or killed by the Nazi regime. The resulting collection was initially printed as a simple paperback only and sent to all clergymen in the Czech Republic. Now, the authors would like to take one step further and release a fully extended historical research, enriched by visual material with high-quality paper and book binding.Projekt Naši pastýři před třemi lety odstartovaly ostudné výroky levicových poslanců, kteří tvrdili, že klérus za druhé světové války kolaboroval s nacismem. Lež byla natolik pobuřující, že poslanec Miroslav Kalousek se skupinou dobrovolníků inicioval shromažďování jmen katolických duchovních pronásledovaných, vězněných či zabitých nacistickým režimem. Takto vznikla první paperbacková verze Našich pastýřů 1938 - 1945. Její prostý výtisk byl následně zaslán všem farářům v ČR. Nyní by autoři rádi vydali rozšířené důstojnější vydání pro veřejnost – obohacené o hlubší a stále pokračující historický výzkum, velmi zajímavý obrazový materiál a v knize s odpovídajícím tiskem a solidní vazbou. In search of evidence / Hledání důkazů The title presents highly important historical and personal evidence collected and catalogued in the Czech Republic. The book sheds light on some of the historical dogmas of the time, trying to clarify many lies, which disgraced the honour of the Roman-Catholic clergy in Czechoslovakia during the critical era of 1939 - 1945. The title carries another piece of the simple truth, with the humble effort to shed light on the historical injustice and also on certain prejudice. It includes several of the previously unknown or lost facts, along with valuable information for anyone interested in this often highly controversial subject.Kniha prezentuje důležité osobní důkazy a výpovědi o smutných osudech odvážných duchovních. Osvětluje některá historická dogmata, ve snaze očistit historii od lží, které zostudily čest a jméno římskokatolické církve v Československu v letech 1939 – 1945. Kniha "Naši pastýři 1938 - 1945" přináší další kus pravdivého obrazu o věci, proti které stojí mnohé historické nespravedlnosti, které uváděla v život následná komunistická propaganda režimu, který byl krutý stejně jako ten předchozí. Kniha přináší další hodnotné důkazy a  dříve neznámá fakta, která přijdou vhod každému, kdo hledá informace o tomto kontroverzním tématu. Psalm 119:160 "The sum of your word is truth, and every one of your righteous rules endures  forever."Žalm 119:160 "To hlavní v tvém slovu je pravda, každý soud tvé spravedlnosti je věčný." Project funding / Přispění na projektDue to the fact that the book will present rare information and graphic content, it should be printed in a distinctive and appropriate manner, providing the reader and library with a piece made from generously selected materials - from paper quality, to hard cover binding, to letter print. The money collected will be used to cover all costs, including the book’s preparation: research costs, photo / graphic and print preparation, along with the full printing cost of 800 pieces.Kniha obsahuje některé dosud nepříliš známé informace i raritní fotografie, a věnuje se tématu, který si zaslouží důstojnou prezentaci a odpovídající provedení, poskytující čtenáři či knihovně kvalitně zpracovaný titul – od obálky, po kvalitu papíru či tisk. Peníze, které budou na tento projekt vybrány, budou použity na pokrytí nákladů na celé plánované knižní vydání v počtu 800 ks. Do těchto nákladů jsou zahrnuty náklady na výzkum, sazba, příprava grafických podkladů a jejich zpracování, příprava tiskových podkladů a náklady na samotný tisk 800 ks knihy.  Participating authors / Participující autoři:Miroslav Kalousek, M.S.E.Miroslav Kalousek co-founded the conservative political platform TOP 09. Together with the effort of many of his colleagues, the party achieved respectable election results in 2010, gaining a strong political influence in the upcoming era. During the years 2007 – 2009 and 2010 - 2013, Miroslav Kalousek became Minister of Finance of the Czech Republic. He was awarded with the prestigious title of the “Finance Minister of the Year for Central & Eastern Europe” during 2008 and 2010, by the prestigious Emerging Markets magazine.Doc. Mgr. Jaroslav Šebek, Ph.D.The head advisor of the project. A Czech historian, member of the Institute of History of the Czech Academy of Science in Prague, an expert on the history of the Czech country-regions in the 20th century, the history of political parties, the Czech - German relations and the history of the church.University students with an interest in history.Ing. Miroslav KalousekSpoluzakladatel politické strany TOP 09. Společně s úsilím mnoha jeho kolegů získala nová strana solidní volební podporu v roce 2010 a tím i výrazný politický vliv v nadcházejících obdobích. V letech 2007 – 2009 a následně 2010 – 2013 se stal Miroslav Kalousek ministrem financí ČR. Za svoje působení a činnost na ministerstvu obdržel prestižní cenu a titul „Ministr financí roku pro Střední Evropu a Východní Evropu v letech 2008 a 2010“, vyhlašovanou mezinárodním renomovaným časopisem „Emerging Markets“.Doc.
