story:
The Story of My Book

We’re not yet facing killer androids, mind-reading algorithms, or hyperintelligent cyborgs, but technology is growing at an exponential rate. And because rampant exploitation of technology can be detrimental to mankind itself, ethical consciousness—being sensible about what technology can and should be able to do--has become one of the most debated discourses of the 21st century.

My name is Zay and my book Codes and Kingdoms explores the theme of ethical consciousness behind the use of emerging technologies within the government ecosystem.

The mission of this book is to support the cause of ethical technology by encouraging academia and professionals in emerging technology fields to actively champion for social responsibility, justice and equity.

Through interviews, research, and storytelling, you will meet:

  • Iain Cruickshank, a data scientist with the U.S Army actively involved within the intersectionality of AI and society
  • Chris Piehota, an internationally recognized security leader who spent 24 years with the FBI
  • Emmanuel Goffi, a world-class AI Philosopher from France breaking ground in the area of culture and AI


I hope this book will provide a tool to help readers gain a better understanding of what ethical technology means and how they can advocate for more socially conscious technology.

You will love this book if you are passionate about responsible technology and curious about how modern technology can be optimized to be more inclusive, impartial, and equitable to our society.

The Book - Codes and Kingdoms

Codes and Kingdoms is a non-fiction book written in three parts.

Part 1 : Justice System

Part 1 examines the policing infrastructure in the US and the integration of emerging technologies like predictive policing and policing robotics in law enforcement operations. This part of the book also explores the court decision making process enabled by artificial intelligence and its sub-branches like NLP and machine learning as well as the ethical complexities of using digital evidence for prosecution purposes. And last but not least, this part will introduce the readers to the American correctional institutions and penitentiary system and to the technologies used to solve issues like recidivism, mass incarceration, and inhumane treatment of inmates.

Part 2 : War and Defense

In Part 2, we’ll delve into the deployment of autonomous systems for combatant missions, Internet of Military Things (IoMT) to enhance the soldier welfare and awareness in the battlefield, and the use of predictive analytics for mission success. This part will also focus on the use of machine learning and data science for veteran health monitoring and immersive media like AR and VR for PTSD treatment. We’ll evaluate government initiatives for veteran welfare, such as REACH Vet. Last but not least, this part assesses the cyberspace as the new domain for international warfare. Security risks, threats and vulnerabilities common within the cyberspace as well as the appropriate countermeasures are discussed.

Part 3 : Politics

Part 3 shines a light on modern electoral and data backed policymaking processes in the federal government system. In this part, we’ll examine the use of big data and blockchain technologies and assess their impacts on misinformation and voter fraud issues. Major incidents in the history of election that involve big data and artificial intelligence are dissected to explain how political advertising and campaigns can benefit from mass data collection.

What We Need & What You Get

Codes and Kingdoms will be published with New Degree Press. To help cover the costs for publishing my book, I’ve set up pre-order tiers. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor who’ll help me revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover designer who’ll replace this mock placeholder with a professional, custom cover design. 
  • The layout editor who’ll put together the interior of my book and create my ebook.
  • The copy editor and proof reader who’ll polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts when I publish this summer.

When I reach 120 campaign backers, I will publish my book in paperback and ebook formats. When 150 people back my campaign, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When my campaign reaches 200 backers, I will bring these stories to life in an audiobook.


As a campaign backer, you’re not buying a copy of a book. You're investing in an opportunity to ride shotgun on my path to publishing. Pre-order my book now to receive an exclusive VIP experience, including:

  • You’ll receive a signed copy of my book when I publish this summer.
  • You’ll see your name in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You’ll be invited to join my Author Community for early access to excerpts from my book.
  • You’ll have an opportunity to share your insight in the selection of my book cover. 
  • You'll get a rare glimpse behind the curtain of the publishing process to see what it takes to go from first draft to print.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Author Zay Ya Min Yin is passionate about all things emerging technologies. A student of information technology and management, Zay believes emerging technologies hold the potential to solve some of the most alarming societal problems of our time. In Codes and Kingdoms, he has developed a tool to raise ethical awareness and advocate for social equity and justice by leveraging responsible technology.

Currently serving as president of UB Management Information Systems Association, Zay aspires to work in a technology consulting field where he can leverage his interest in emerging technologies to help businesses achieve transformative outcomes.

A true global citizen, Zay grew up in Papua New Guinea and Myanmar before moving to Singapore and, eventually, the United States. He loves art, design, and everything outdoors. 

To learn more about this project, connect with Zay Ya Min Yin at zayyaminyin@gmail.com, and (@zay_y_m_y) on Instagram and as (Zay Ya) on LinkedIn.
 

International Preorders

For international pre-orders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers apprised of my anticipated publishing date. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people simply cannot contribute to my campaign. If you find yourself in that position, I hope you’ll show your support in other ways. At the top of this page, you’ll find the option to Share my Indiegogo pre-sale campaign. Please copy the link and share it widely. 

Share it with your friends, family, and network on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn. If you’ll use #codesandkingdoms and tag me (@zayyaminyin) as well as my publisher (@NewDegreePress), we’ll help amplify your efforts.

Share it with five friends, neighbors, colleagues, or classmates who might enjoy my book or the opportunity to join my publishing journey.

Share it via text message. Share it through direct messaging or email. Share it on social media. Share it and know that you’re making a difference.

Thanks for your support!

Stay well,
Zay Ya

story:
What is the project?

becoming-Botanical is a long-term antidisciplinary project aiming to investigate and re-imagine the human/plant relationship with a view towards a sustainable future. We believe that new experiences with and deeper understanding of nonhuman life garners an ecocentric and empathetic perspective crucial to living sustainably in a shifting climate.

Central to the first phase of becoming-Botanical is the curation and publication of an herbal encyclopaedia (liber herbalis) which asks contributors and readers to contemplate in what ways we interact and depend on plant-life in a post-modern era and what future interactions and dependencies may be. The book will comprise a selection of short provocative entries from practitioners of a myriad of scientific and artistic disciplines, accompanied by found, submitted and illustrated visual imagery to disrupt, contradict, or compliment the entries. It is imagined that this collection of disparate ideas can act as a catalyst for creative thinking and artistic practice in the widening field of sustainability and performance ecologies.

The book features 46 entries from over 50 international artists, researchers and practitioners spanning 6 continents--beautifully fusing academia, scientific and ecological research, art, and creative practice. 

The book is edited by:

Josh Armstrong
Artistic Director of Objet-a Creative Studio;
Lecturer in Contemporary Performance Practice at the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland

Alexandra Lakind
Ph.D. Candidate at the University of Wisconsin-Madison
Founder of Terra Incognita, presenting artistic responses to the Anthropocene

Forward written by:

Chessa Adsit-Morris is Assistant Director of the Center for Creative Ecologies at the University of California, Santa Cruz where she is a doctoral student in Visual Studies. She is the author of 'Feral Subjectivities Restorying Environmental Education: Figurations, Fictions' (Palgrave Macmillan, 2017). 

 

 

Timeline

Early May 2019 - Publications printed in the UK
30 May 2019 - Book Launch event in Glasgow
June 2019 - Publications/Perks posted
July 2019 - Sensorial Botanical Experience in Glasgow

 

Who is the publisher?

Objet-a Creative Studio is a Scottish Charitable Incorporated Organisation (SCIO) committed to producing high-quality interdisciplinary contemporary artworks which celebrate 'otherness' and reach diverse audiences. The work of Artistic Director, Josh Armstrong, has long been rooted in an implicit ecological imperative fostered by the 'deep ecology' movement and the participatory learning of the Natural Change process. This publication is a first for the organisation--a crucial moment in the trajectory of Objet-a to give voice and visibility to a range of diverse persons as they discuss matters which lie in the core of their being. This series "becoming-" aims to position the human as a permeable body in an ever-expanding ecology of material, thought and action. Josh Armstrong has internationally produced and presented interdisciplinary performance works at the intersection of music, theatre, and visual art spanning a ten-year career. Transferring these skills to the curation and design of a publication is an exciting foray to reach new audiences. 

This work has been supported by the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland, The University of Wisconsin-Madison, and The University of California Santa Cruz but the funds needed for the printing is outstanding.

 

What We Need

We began this project imagining we would publish a 28 page pamphlet of a few essays. After being overwhelmed with positive responses and contributions we realised that this project needs the attention, space, and resource to present a fully curated creative research publication. You can help our ambition become reality. 

With the help of your funding, we will be able to:

  • print 500 units of the book;

  • mail a free copy of the book to each of the contributors who have volunteered their work, labour, and time to their entries for the publication;

  • purchase a pack of 10 ISBNs, which are necessary to be able to have the publication internationally catalogued and sold. This also enables recognition for Objet-a Creative Studio as a publishing body, which is vital for the future plans of the organisation and the publication series.

It is important to note: A free digital version will be made available to view online in an effort to increase access to the work. 

We are not planning to make a profit from the sale of these publications. Our aim is to cover the costs associated with the printing and distribution of the books. Any and all profit will be invested into Objet-a Creative Studio towards the next publication anticipated in 2021.

Objet-a Creative Studio is a Scottish Charitable Incorporated Organisation.
Registered in Scotland SC048214.

 

What You Get

We greatly appreciate any amount of funding, but we have put together a few perks from the publication and project to say 'Thank You':

£8 - Pre-order 
Pre-order the Publication, saving 20% on the sale price (£10)

£10.00 - Pre-order Plus
Pre-order the Publication at the discounted rate and receive a handwritten 'Thank You' postcard featuring artwork from the book--perfect for framing, balancing on a bookshelf or brightening up your desk space.  

£24.00 - Pre-order More
Pre-order 3 books and save 20% - plus receive 3 blank becoming-Botanicals postcards to write a personal message to your book recipient. 

£20.00 - Pre-order & Pollinate
Alongside the pre-ordered publication and 'Thank You' postcard (above) you will receive a limited edition becoming-Botanicals bookmark--designed to fit perfectly into the book, but just as great for whatever you are currently digesting.

BEEcoming-Botanicals
As you are a project pollinator, we will also send you a small envelope of British wildflower seeds. Use this mixture to create a bold display of British wildflowers in the first summer after sowing. The envelope contains five British native wildflower species, including Corn Chamomile, Corn Cockle, Cornflower, Corn Marigold and Common Poppy. The seeds selected are approved by the Royal Horticulture Society as plants which are scientifically proven to prevent the decline in bees, butterflies and other pollinators. (Sows 1-2 sqm.)

Please note -- these native British wildflowers may not be suitable for all ecosystems. When choosing this perk you may decide whether you would like to receive the seeds in the post or if you would like the seeds to be sown in the Scottish landscape--taking into account your own local ecosystem, governing bodies and legislature.

£50 Pre-order, Print & Pollinate
In addition to everything in 'Pre-order and Pollinate', you will receive your choice of one limited printed artworks (unframed) from the becoming-Botanicals publication, 'Brain Leaf' by Nathalie Lavoie (CAN). All prints are A4 in size and printed on 100% recycled paper (250 gsm) saving over 70% water and energy of standard paper production. You will also have the option of being named as a sponsor in the publication. 

Choose from:
1 x A4 Brain Leaf var.1 by Nathalie Lavoie (CAN) - left
1 x A4 Brain Leaf var.2 by Nathalie Lavoie (CAN) - right
or let us choose for you

£100 - Pre-order, Print & Post
In addition to everything in 'Pre-order and Pollinate', you will receive 2 limited edition printed artworks (unframed) from the becoming-Botanicals publication, 'Brain Leaf' by Nathalie Lavoie (CAN). These pairings of prints work just as beautifully as diptychs as individual prints. All prints are A4 in size and printed on 100% recycled paper (250 gsm) saving over 70% water and energy of standard paper production. story_txt:
What is the project?
becoming-Botanical is a long-term antidisciplinary project aiming to investigate and re-imagine the human/plant relationship with a view towards a sustainable future. We believe that new experiences with and deeper understanding of nonhuman life garners an ecocentric and empathetic perspective crucial to living sustainably in a shifting climate.
Central to the first phase of becoming-Botanical is the curation and publication of an herbal encyclopaedia (liber herbalis) which asks contributors and readers to contemplate in what ways we interact and depend on plant-life in a post-modern era and what future interactions and dependencies may be. The book will comprise a selection of short provocative entries from practitioners of a myriad of scientific and artistic disciplines, accompanied by found, submitted and illustrated visual imagery to disrupt, contradict, or compliment the entries. It is imagined that this collection of disparate ideas can act as a catalyst for creative thinking and artistic practice in the widening field of sustainability and performance ecologies.
The book features 46 entries from over 50 international artists, researchers and practitioners spanning 6 continents--beautifully fusing academia, scientific and ecological research, art, and creative practice. 
The book is edited by:
Josh ArmstrongArtistic Director of Objet-a Creative Studio;Lecturer in Contemporary Performance Practice at the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland
Alexandra LakindPh.D. Candidate at the University of Wisconsin-MadisonFounder of Terra Incognita, presenting artistic responses to the Anthropocene
Forward written by:
Chessa Adsit-Morris is Assistant Director of the Center for Creative Ecologies at the University of California, Santa Cruz where she is a doctoral student in Visual Studies. She is the author of 'Feral Subjectivities Restorying Environmental Education: Figurations, Fictions' (Palgrave Macmillan, 2017). 
 

 
Timeline
Early May 2019 - Publications printed in the UK30 May 2019 - Book Launch event in GlasgowJune 2019 - Publications/Perks postedJuly 2019 - Sensorial Botanical Experience in Glasgow
 
Who is the publisher?
Objet-a Creative Studio is a Scottish Charitable Incorporated Organisation (SCIO) committed to producing high-quality interdisciplinary contemporary artworks which celebrate 'otherness' and reach diverse audiences. The work of Artistic Director, Josh Armstrong, has long been rooted in an implicit ecological imperative fostered by the 'deep ecology' movement and the participatory learning of the Natural Change process. This publication is a first for the organisation--a crucial moment in the trajectory of Objet-a to give voice and visibility to a range of diverse persons as they discuss matters which lie in the core of their being. This series "becoming-" aims to position the human as a permeable body in an ever-expanding ecology of material, thought and action. Josh Armstrong has internationally produced and presented interdisciplinary performance works at the intersection of music, theatre, and visual art spanning a ten-year career. Transferring these skills to the curation and design of a publication is an exciting foray to reach new audiences. 
This work has been supported by the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland, The University of Wisconsin-Madison, and The University of California Santa Cruz but the funds needed for the printing is outstanding.
 

What We Need
We began this project imagining we would publish a 28 page pamphlet of a few essays. After being overwhelmed with positive responses and contributions we realised that this project needs the attention, space, and resource to present a fully curated creative research publication. You can help our ambition become reality. 
With the help of your funding, we will be able to:

print 500 units of the book;
mail a free copy of the book to each of the contributors who have volunteered their work, labour, and time to their entries for the publication;
purchase a pack of 10 ISBNs, which are necessary to be able to have the publication internationally catalogued and sold. This also enables recognition for Objet-a Creative Studio as a publishing body, which is vital for the future plans of the organisation and the publication series.

It is important to note: A free digital version will be made available to view online in an effort to increase access to the work. 
We are not planning to make a profit from the sale of these publications. Our aim is to cover the costs associated with the printing and distribution of the books. Any and all profit will be invested into Objet-a Creative Studio towards the next publication anticipated in 2021.
Objet-a Creative Studio is a Scottish Charitable Incorporated Organisation.Registered in Scotland SC048214.
 


What You Get
We greatly appreciate any amount of funding, but we have put together a few perks from the publication and project to say 'Thank You':
£8 - Pre-order Pre-order the Publication, saving 20% on the sale price (£10)
£10.00 - Pre-order PlusPre-order the Publication at the discounted rate and receive a handwritten 'Thank You' postcard featuring artwork from the book--perfect for framing, balancing on a bookshelf or brightening up your desk space.  
£24.00 - Pre-order MorePre-order 3 books and save 20% - plus receive 3 blank becoming-Botanicals postcards to write a personal message to your book recipient. 
£20.00 - Pre-order & PollinateAlongside the pre-ordered publication and 'Thank You' postcard (above) you will receive a limited edition becoming-Botanicals bookmark--designed to fit perfectly into the book, but just as great for whatever you are currently digesting.
BEEcoming-BotanicalsAs you are a project pollinator, we will also send you a small envelope of British wildflower seeds. Use this mixture to create a bold display of British wildflowers in the first summer after sowing. The envelope contains five British native wildflower species, including Corn Chamomile, Corn Cockle, Cornflower, Corn Marigold and Common Poppy. The seeds selected are approved by the Royal Horticulture Society as plants which are scientifically proven to prevent the decline in bees, butterflies and other pollinators. (Sows 1-2 sqm.)
Please note -- these native British wildflowers may not be suitable for all ecosystems. When choosing this perk you may decide whether you would like to receive the seeds in the post or if you would like the seeds to be sown in the Scottish landscape--taking into account your own local ecosystem, governing bodies and legislature.

Story of My Book

UPDATE: I am DONATING 15% of my proceeds to Girls Inc. 

Q&A

- Why am I allocating 15% of my proceeds to Girls Inc.?

I have been volunteering and mentoring k-12 girls for the past 2 years through Girls Inc. I have learned so much from every single of my girls and they inspire me everyday. I want to support the mission of Girls Inc. encouraging girls to be “Strong, Smart, and Bold.” 

- Are you only allocating 15% of the proceeds during the presale campaign?

No, I will continue allocating 15% of the proceeds to Girls Inc. even post launch date on April 2021. 

 

Everyone who buys or contributes to my book will also be contributing to girls in Girls Inc. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My name is Zahra Mesrizadeh and I am the author of The God of the Gaps: Understanding Science through the Lens of Religion and Politics. I wrote this book because I want to unfold the history of religion & politics and delve into how it conflicts with the scientific world. Since our pre-wired brains are prone to filling in the gaps to make sense of the world, there's much to discuss. The ultimate goal of my book is to educate my audience about our differences and turn them into our superpower. 

The God of the Gaps: Understanding Science through the Lens of Religion and Politics: The goal of my book is to explore science in the multi-dimensional reality of society through the lens of history, politics, and religion, and to help us understand the reality of the world in the post-truth era by acknowledging our cognitive barriers. My book will touch on the above subjects by uncovering how historical events, religion, and politics have influenced the interpretation of science, and how we can learn from and overcome these barriers as a society.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how widespread uncertainties are and how we can utilize that to understand our world instead of filling the gaps with temporary answers. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with science communication and escape from the homogeneous theme of our lives.

FOR ALL: 
You will love this book if you are struggling with connecting different facets of identity, want to be surprised by common myths you might believe or are scared of conversation about science, religion, and politics in your circle.

The God of the Gaps: Understanding Science through the Lens of Religion and Politics speaks to young college students and anyone who want to find joy and hope in science and its relatability to our everyday life and feel comfortable to talk about our affiliations in religion and politics in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The God of the Gaps: Understanding Science through the Lens of religion and politics inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • What are my own cognitive biases and their reflection on my thoughts?
  • How can we improve our circle to engage with diverse thoughts?
  • How can we better navigate society especially in times like a global pandemic?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing science, religion, and politics will change us all for the better. 
 

The God of the Gaps: Understanding Science through the Lens of religion and politics

The book is written in [3] parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + 
        How we got here

        History of religion... how it was created to fill in gaps

        History of conflicts about religion and science

        Science of the human mind (why we tell stories to fill in gaps)

Why Now: 

With the gap between science and society growing larger by the day, it's important we face the issue head-on and examine its origin points. Religion fulfills our need to fill in the unknown and politics ignites a desire in us to twist reality in order to gain power. How can we mitigate and explore these sometimes ill-intentioned desires?

Part 2 contains 
Principles of Living with Gaps

        Creativity

        Openness

        Curiosity

        Self Awareness

        Being Non-Judgemental

        Humility

Part 3 contains 
How to Live with the Gaps

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Zahra Mesrizadeh is a Nanovaccine researcher at the University of California, San Diego, and is dedicated to educating and empowering others. Zahra is passionate about educating young women in underrepresented communities through Girls Inc. and other community outreach programs. 

Zahra wrote this book to share her personal journey, life experiences, and stories of how education has shaped her destiny. Zahra hopes to start a more constructive conversation around the role of science in society and open a dialogue with people of differing backgrounds. Storytelling is an important part of our society and Zahra wants to embrace that in her book. 

Zahra loves to cook and try different types of foods. She’s also a charcoal artist who’s been passionate about drawing since her childhood.

For more information, you can connect with Zahra Mesrizadeh at nanoscience.zahra@gmail.com and on Instagram: @nanoscience.zahra and Twitter: @nanoscience.zahra.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheGodoftheGaps and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Zahra Mesrizadeh

story:
Short Summary

Everest is on a quest to learn who he wants to be when he grows up. In The Adventures of Everest the Elephant we launch into space with him and Captain Seadu in the first bilingual book of the series. Read along with translations in Spanish, French, or German beside the English language in the same book!

Whether brushing up on your language skills or teaching your heritage to loved ones, take Everest with you on this journey of self discovery.

What are we raising funds for?

  • A bulk order of paperback books to sign
  • Paying the contributors: the illustrator, 3 translators, & author
  • Future books about Everest--there's a lot more stories about Everest waiting to be shared!
  • Spreading the word about Everest's Bilingual Books

 

What You Get & Your Impact

  • A Signed Paperback of your choice: English, Spanish & English, French & English, or German & English
  • You can choose to Donate a Book to local community centers (libraries, schools, ect.)
  • Schools/Libraries can order extra copies in bulk to get a discount! (You can also do this as an individual too.)

Together, we can learn and grow as a community one story at a time.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our next steps include...

  • Cover Design/Creation: We'll be designing the cover during the campaign.
  • Front Matter: Copyright & dedication pages will be created while this campaign is running too.
  • Formatting: Once we have the cover and front matter, we'll be able to finish formatting for print. Afterward, we'll also work on an eBook version for Kindle.
  • Spreading the Word

Easing the way...

  • Thankfully, Awkward Paws Publishing has handled publishing a picture book in February 2019, so we know what to expect during each of these stages and have a rough idea of how long it will take. We know how to format both print and eBooks including how much time it takes to get proofs to make sure they come out just the way we envisioned the book.
  • Accountability: You can expect updates from us on each of these areas as tasks are completed during the campaign.
  • Flexible Plan: We've designed our campaign to succeed even if we don't reach full funding status. Since we can order smaller quantities of books through Amazon, we'll be able to guarantee fulfillment of your perks.
  • Our biggest reason for launching the book this way is to be able to offer signed copies of the book that you wouldn't be able to get through Amazon and discounts on bulk orders that we really wanted to make sure were easily accessible to teachers/schools and libraries. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share & tag your friends!

  • Share & Retweet the campaign!
  • Tag people in your shares, comments, or retweets that you think would love this!

We want to thank you from the bottom of our hearts for reading through all this--and for contributing via getting a book, donating a book, and/or sharing this campaign! Each book has the potential to make a difference in someone's life. Thank you so much for your help in spreading the word about Everest, the elephant!

Formatting: Once we have the cover and front matter, we'll be able to finish formatting for print. Afterward, we'll also work on an eBook version for Kindle.
Spreading the Word

Easing the way...

Thankfully, Awkward Paws Publishing has handled publishing a picture book in February 2019, so we know what to expect during each of these stages and have a rough idea of how long it will take. We know how to format both print and eBooks including how much time it takes to get proofs to make sure they come out just the way we envisioned the book.
Accountability: You can expect updates from us on each of these areas as tasks are completed during the campaign.
Flexible Plan: We've designed our campaign to succeed even if we don't reach full funding status. Since we can order smaller quantities of books through Amazon, we'll be able to guarantee fulfillment of your perks.
Our biggest reason for launching the book this way is to be able to offer signed copies of the book that you wouldn't be able to get through Amazon and discounts on bulk orders that we really wanted to make sure were easily accessible to teachers/schools and libraries. 



Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, please share & tag your friends!


Share & Retweet the campaign!

Tag people in your shares, comments, or retweets that you think would love this!

We want to thank you from the bottom of our hearts for reading through all this--and for contributing via getting a book, donating a book, and/or sharing this campaign! Each book has the potential to make a difference in someone's life. Thank you so much for your help in spreading the word about Everest, the elephant!

story:
Celebrating women making visual poetry

We will publish Judith: Women Making Visual Poetry, a 250-page, full-colour book featuring visual poetry from 36 women in 21 countries, a foreword by Johanna Drucker, and essays on digital visual poetry and the future of visual poetry by Fiona Becket, on women in asemic writing by Natalie Ferris, and on feminist practice with Letraset, the ephemeral and fragility by Kate Siklosi. The book will also feature an excerpt from a roundtable interview of 13 women artists who work with language and craft. Finally, we will include a list of more than 1100 women currently making visual poetry. The anthology is edited by Amanda Earl.

The following creators contribute visual poetry to Judith:

Firyal Al-Adhamy
Rosaire Appel
Erica Baum
Jessica Bebenek
Mez Breeze
Kimberly Campanello
Iris Colomb
Susan Connolly
Judith Copithorne
Kate Daudy
Paula Damm
Lenora de Barros
Johanna Drucker
Amanda Earl
CC Elian
Cinzia Farina
Mara Patricia Hernandez
Tasneem F. Inam
Effie Jessop
Satu Kaikkonen
Dona Mayoora
Kerri Pullo
Viviane Rombaldi Seppey
Astra Papachristodoulu
Mado Reznik
Karenjit Sandhu
Petra Schulze-Wollgast
Ines Seidel
Kate Siklosi
Lina Stern
Stephanie Strickland
Hiromi Suzuki
Ankie van Dijk
Seet van Hout
Terri Witek
Ruth Wolf-Rehfeldt
Audra Wolowiec

The term ‘visual poetry’ within the book is a global term used for all work that integrates elements of language with another medium or engages with the graphical elements of text and mark making.

Front cover of Judith: Women Making Visual Poetry

We invited 12 women to contribute their work to the book and to provide the names of other women artists and visual poets who have inspired their work, acted as mentors, collaborators, and influences. We then invited the women named by the initial 12 to contribute work to the book and name women who have inspired or influenced their own work. In this way, the book acts as a continuum, connecting present creators of visual poetry to those of the past and inspiring women now and in the future to make visual poems.

For example, asemic writer Rosaire Appel named Viviane Rombaldi Seppey as an inspiration. I hadn’t heard of Viviane before, an artist who works with maps, phonebooks, books, photographs, and collected objects as source materials used to describe the elusive meanings of places and her relation to them. She cuts, glues, folds, knits, paints, and weaves in order to intertwine physical, cultural and personal territories.

Viviane Rombaldi Seppey, The World Isn't Flat

Viviane in turn talked about the work of Rosalie Gascoigne, a New Zealand/Australian artist whose artworks ‘hold part of words, characters from road panels, the material is cut, assembled and organized in grids pattern where visual poetry merges with the materiality of a place.’

Contributor Kimberly Campanello illustrates the vital and affirming connections made by women in her statement in the book:

‘In the summer of 2019, something remarkable happened in Leeds: Poetry by Design. There, I met two London-based poets, Iris Colomb and Sascha Akhtar. Colomb gave a paper on her work which is at-once highly performative and inherently textual. She finds incredible ways to ‘deliver’ textuality – on ping pong balls, on strips of plastic in a bathtub. If she reads from a book, it is with her body suspended from the ceiling in shibari bondage.

In the evening, Akhtar gave a powerful and genuinely witchy reading from her tarot card poems that demonstrated so clearly how the physical interaction of a reader with language can transform it, and vice versa.

Seeing these two varied approaches to visual poetics in the ‘flesh’ made a significant impact on my retrospective understanding of my work’s aims and context. I think it is vital that poets encounter diverse practices and have conversations about such differences, which exactly is what the Leeds symposium engendered and what this essential book will do. The fact that in my view the most exciting (visual) poets working today are largely women points to the end (I hope) of any need for special pleading. We are running the show.’

Statements such as these, the visual poetry and the inclusion of influences, discoveries and inspirations will help to make the book serve as a field guide to visual poetry for current and future women.

Getting to know the editor

I’m Amanda Earl, a Canadian writer, editor, publisher and visual poet. I’m working with Joakim Norling of Timglaset Editions to publish Judith: Women Making Visual Poetry. I’ve been the managing editor of Bywords.ca, a literary site and magazine since 2003, and the fallen angel of AngelHousePress since 2007, publishing chapbooks and two online magazines. In this capacity, I’ve published writing and visual poetry by creators from all over the world. I made a map of women and gender nonconforming visual poets and I have crowdsourced lists of visual poetry publishers, editors and curators. My practice for several years has been to try to support the work of women, 2SLGBTQ, BIPOC and D/deaf and disabled writers and artists by learning as much as I can about their work and amplifying their voices. Community-building is essential to me. It is a never-ending labour of love.

I’ve been making visual poetry since the mid aughts. My life’s work is to translate every verse, chapter and book of the Bible into visual poetry. My visual poetry has been published in 15 chapbooks, several anthologies and numerous sites. In 2018, Timglaset Editions published, The Vispo Bible: Revelation, a full-colour 28-page work.

Amanda Earl, The Vispo Bible: Revelation

Addressing gender imbalance

I’ve been told more than once by male publishers that few women make visual poetry, yet I see a lot of women visual poets on social media, sharing their work, and in the art world, there are many women artists working with language elements. There is clearly a gap between formal publication and sharing informally on social media, as well as a gap between anthologized visual poetry and the work that is exhibited on gallery walls.

The low representation of women in canonical 20th century concrete and visual poetry anthologies is well-known, but what is perhaps less known is that anthologies that have published visual poetry in this century also suffer from gender imbalance.

There is a domino effect when women are erased from canons. Scholars who have access to research only about men will write articles and books on their work alone. This helps create the impression that the only important and interesting work is done by men.

Connecting the past, present and future

The book is named after Judith Copithorne, a Canadian visual poet who has been active since the 1960s and deserves greater recognition and acknowledgement. My own work has been influenced and inspired by Judith’s visual poetry.

Judith Copithorne, 9.11.6--surd-14

In early 2019, I asked Joakim Norling of Timglaset Editions whether he would be interested in publishing an anthology of women making visual poetry, a dream of mine for several years. Timglaset Editions has earned a reputation for its exquisite design and its focus on visual poetry, including work by women. I knew it was a good choice for the book.

We made a list of all the women making visual poetry that we knew of through our own publication of them and that of others. The initial list amounted to about 100 women. From that list, we chose 12 that represented different styles of work from asemic writing to collage to digital vispo and typewriter poems. We also tried to select from as wide range of geographical and ethnicities as we could.

One of the things I wanted to do was to prove that there were in fact, a lot of women making visual poetry. My inspiration was Mirella Bentivoglio, an Italian concrete poet, artist and performer, who when confronted with the lack of female representation promoted and exhibited the works of women in 27 exhibits throughout the world, and created a network of women artists and visual poets, ensuring that women’s work would be taken seriously in the Italian art world and beyond.

Amanda Earl, Io: Homage to Mirella Bentivoglio, 2021.

We contacted editors, publishers, curators, and fellow visual poets who gave us additional names. This has truly been the work of a community over two years. We looked at a lot of work online and in anthologies. It became clear that in addition to what was typically considered to be visual poetry, there was also art that used language and elements of text as primary material. Not being part of the art world, I hadn’t heard of most of the artists that were named by our sources. In addition, Karl Kempton, an American visual poet and editor, was expanding my idea of visual poetry with the names he suggested but also with his book, A History of Visual Text Art, which contains over 500 pages and goes from ancient cave paintings to modern work, including Arabic calligraphy. It was frustrating to see work that hasn’t been anthologized in Western visual poetry books. We thought it was important to include it. We ended up with a list of over 1100 women making visual poetry.

Firyal al-Adhami

On schedule

Our plan is to finish design and layout of the book by the end of April, to send out advance copies to writers for back of the book descriptions or ‘blurbs’ and to have the book printed by the end of May. We have engaged the help of a proofreader who is going through the work and ensuring consistency. We will then give the proofs to our contributors and make any changes.

The book will be 252 pages, full colour print, 190 x 230 mm, softcover with 100 mm flaps, sewn. We plan to publish a first edition of 300 copies. For this fundraising campaign we need 4500 Euros to make the project come through.

A passion project

I believe in solidarity and I believe there is strength in numbers.

I wanted this book to include as many women currently making visual poetry as possible to show all women that their work has value and to show them they are not alone.

I believe this book is more needed than ever. I don’t believe the book will stop the erasure of women in a patriarchal world, but I do believe it will help to support and promote women making visual poetry and to create spaces in which they can thrive.

Glowing Reviews

‘Judith: Women Making Visual Poetry is a stunningly edited anthology by Amanda Earl: if you have no idea of what visual poetry is at the outset you will by the time you close this book, with its dynamic selection of twenty three poets' works, each of which speaks to an exuberance and delight in language, as a tactile and material practice. I loved every page of it, rippling with energy and a sense of a contemporary moment and movement. This is a book that will touch your heart and make you wonder where it has been all along.’ 
Bronac Ferran

‘Judith: Women Making Visual Poetry finally gathers female visual poets from all corners of the world in a beautiful anthology dedicated to highlighting the excellence and abundance of visual poetry made by women. Judith: Women Making Visual Poetry is the anthology I wish I had growing up.’
Silje Ree, Creative Director, Mellom Press

'JUDITH is an incredibly important – and long overdue - addition to our understanding of Concrete Poetry. Essays, reflections, and statements join samples of exceptional work of concrete poetry by women from around the world. This volume is indispensable. Every page exposes a new vocabulary, a new perspective, and a new history. You gotta have this book. You gotta learn.'
Derek Beaulieu

‘Judith is a fantastic and welcome insight into visual poetry from women around the globe. Its varied pages are a delight to behold, and the work revels in the materiality of language. Dynamic visuals are interspersed with critical essays, thoughtful reflections, and insightful statements. With each re-reading you will find something new.’ 
Rachel Smith

'From bold, chunky Letrasets, to delicate 3D poems literally hanging by a thread, everything is represented in this gorgeous full-colour anthology. JUDITH is a truly stunning and exciting celebration of the full breadth and depth of visual poetry created by women.' 
Clara Daneri, Penteract Press

'Judith is a woman and a book. As a woman, Judith appears when she might have been invisible or ignored, and with her, she brings many women, as text-images, image-texts, weaving in and across and through time, the warp and the weft of language configurations that occur under various names. As a book, Judith may be read as a text and as an image, or as a text-image, appearing as a history and a possibility, however partial. It is a generous location, inclusive and extensive, necessary and inviting.' 
Sharon Kivland

'We really need to thank Amanda Earl for compiling a spectacular anthology about women and visual poetry. Judith: Woman Making Visual Poetry is a must have book. Beautifully written and visually represented, it expands our understanding and knowledge of visual poetry and the important, yet commonly overlooked role, women have played, and are still playing, in creating visual work. It is fascinating from so many aspects: historically, visually, as a record, and also for recognising women's innovation.'
Trini Decombe and Nikki Dudley, streetcake magazine.

'Judith: Women Making Visual Poetry is a necessary intervention into and resource against the monopositional cultural baggage which has collected around 'visual poetry'. Beautifully featuring a wide variety of visual writing techniques and traditions in which women are working, Judith not only shows us what visual poetry actually is, but gives us hope for what it could be.'
Ava Hofmann,  SPORAZINE
 

‘Judith is a collective masterwork of WOMEN WHO MAKE the most exciting visual poetry in our contemporary. It is an international, polyphonic love letter to the diverse and vibrant materiality of poetry, and a call to action with enough electricity to power our touch-starved digital lives.

Judith is a call to action with enough electricity to power a Hitachi. Witness this vibrant involution of poetry as material, as code, as sculpture, as dream, as cinema, as dissent... A who's who of women who are sculpting poetics as we know it. A must read/watch/see!’

Chloё Proctor, The Babel Tower Notice Board

story:
Short Summary

The latest entry in the Zagaboo children's book series, Zagaboo Saves Christmas, tells the story of how a bad case of the Elf Flu (Elfuenza, if you want to be scientific) threatens to ruin the best day of the year. With the help of a little troll magic, Zagaboo (king of the trolls) works with Santa to keep everything on schedule.  It’s a fun and heartwarming story about the true meaning of Christmas and helping others.

Tug your ear and say the magic words, “Zagaboo, Zagaboo where are you,” to enter Zagaboo’s Kingdom. This is a place where children encounter funny, friendly trolls who teach them to become better people by acting more like trolls. The Zagaboo stories, intended for children ages 3 to 9, revolves around the trolls and their many teaching adventures.

While I am beyond excited to introduce my newest book, I encourage you to read whichever book first catches your eye.  All the stories will make sense even if you haven’t read them in order. The first book, The Legend of Zagaboo, tells of the trolls’ origins.  In the second book, Maddie Swims Troll-Style, a little girl learns how to swim; in the third book, Charlie Digs Dinosaurs, a little boy explores his passion for paleontology despite worrying that he will accidentally break some fossils.

I studied cultural anthropology at George Mason and Longwood Universities. I live in the U.S.A. in the Washington DC area, where I write analytical papers for a contracting firm.  I am married to an amazing 2nd grade school teacher and am the proud father of two: one adult daughter in graduate school and one 12-year-old tennis star in-the-making.

As an anthropologist and a father, I understand the importance of teaching the values of love, friendship, empathy, and generosity at a young age.  Children who learn these values young are more likely to carry them forward into adulthood.  The trolls in my Zagaboo Stories embody these values and are eager to share them with your children.

Zagaboo Saves Christmas is story with non-stop tinseled thrills and a great moral.  I'd love for your children to have a copy.  But I'll need your help. 

What I Need & What You Get

I need to pre-sell copies of Zagaboo Saves Christmas in order to cover the costs of publishing, marketing, and distribution. My goal is to raise $3,000.  If I exceed that amount, I will set aside the remainder to fast-track the next entries in the Zagaboo series, sending out updates to all contributors whenever a new book goes live.

In addition to first-run copies of Zagaboo Saves Christmas, I am offering some exclusive rewards, including book-related merchandise (such as plush dolls and other items) and autographed copies of all books you purchase.

Participate now to help save Christmas!

The Impact

Zagaboo Saves Christmas and my other Zagaboo Stories are not only great fun, they also share important messages of love, friendship, empathy, and generosity.  I want as many children as possible to read them!  I am truly humbled by the amazing responses I've gotten so far to my books.  Every year, schools, libraries, and daycares invite me to read my Zagaboo Stories.  After every show, children chant the magic words, "Zagaboo, Zagaboo, where are you?" and recite their favorite parts of the book.  Parents who purchase the books tell me how their children insist on reading a Zagaboo Story before bedtime.  I love it!

Risks & Challenges

I've already published three books prior to Zagaboo Saves Christmas, so I don't foresee much difficulty in publishing this book in terms of the technical aspects.  The biggest challenge will be completing the coloring of the book in time to have copies printed, autographed, and at your door before Christmas day this year.  My illustrator and I have a plan to achieve this goal, but there is a small chance your books could arrive after Christmas if we miss our deadline.

A secondary challenge will be manufacturing the Zagaboo Christmas Dolls in time for them to be delivered (to those who order them) before Christmas.  My manufacturer assures me the dolls will be finished by late November, which should provide sufficient time for me to ship them to your homes before Christmas.  If, however, manufacturing is delayed, there is a slight chance you could receive your dolls after Christmas.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't claim anything from this campaign, you can help me by sharing my campaign with others.  It's easy.  Just use the Indiegogo share tools on this site!
story_txt:
Short Summary
The latest entry in the Zagaboo children's book series, Zagaboo Saves Christmas, tells the story of how a bad case of the Elf Flu (Elfuenza, if you want to be scientific) threatens to ruin the best day of the year. With the help of a little troll magic, Zagaboo (king of the trolls) works with Santa to keep everything on schedule.  It’s a fun and heartwarming story about the true meaning of Christmas and helping others.
Tug your ear and say the magic words, “Zagaboo, Zagaboo where are you,” to enter Zagaboo’s Kingdom. This is a place where children encounter funny, friendly trolls who teach them to become better people by acting more like trolls. The Zagaboo stories, intended for children ages 3 to 9, revolves around the trolls and their many teaching adventures.
While I am beyond excited to introduce my newest book, I encourage you to read whichever book first catches your eye.  All the stories will make sense even if you haven’t read them in order. The first book, The Legend of Zagaboo, tells of the trolls’ origins.  In the second book, Maddie Swims Troll-Style, a little girl learns how to swim; in the third book, Charlie Digs Dinosaurs, a little boy explores his passion for paleontology despite worrying that he will accidentally break some fossils.
I studied cultural anthropology at George Mason and Longwood Universities. I live in the U.S.A. in the Washington DC area, where I write analytical papers for a contracting firm.  I am married to an amazing 2nd grade school teacher and am the proud father of two: one adult daughter in graduate school and one 12-year-old tennis star in-the-making.
As an anthropologist and a father, I understand the importance of teaching the values of love, friendship, empathy, and generosity at a young age.  Children who learn these values young are more likely to carry them forward into adulthood.  The trolls in my Zagaboo Stories embody these values and are eager to share them with your children.
Zagaboo Saves Christmas is story with non-stop tinseled thrills and a great moral.  I'd love for your children to have a copy.  But I'll need your help. 

What I Need & What You Get
I need to pre-sell copies of Zagaboo Saves Christmas in order to cover the costs of publishing, marketing, and distribution. My goal is to raise $3,000.  If I exceed that amount, I will set aside the remainder to fast-track the next entries in the Zagaboo series, sending out updates to all contributors whenever a new book goes live.
In addition to first-run copies of Zagaboo Saves Christmas, I am offering some exclusive rewards, including book-related merchandise (such as plush dolls and other items) and autographed copies of all books you purchase.
Participate now to help save Christmas!

The Impact
Zagaboo Saves Christmas and my other Zagaboo Stories are not only great fun, they also share important messages of love, friendship, empathy, and generosity.  I want as many children as possible to read them!  I am truly humbled by the amazing responses I've gotten so far to my books.  Every year, schools, libraries, and daycares invite me to read my Zagaboo Stories.  After every show, children chant the magic words, "Zagaboo, Zagaboo, where are you?" and recite their favorite parts of the book.  Parents who purchase the books tell me how their children insist on reading a Zagaboo Story before bedtime.  I love it!



Risks & Challenges
I've already published three books prior to Zagaboo Saves Christmas, so I don't foresee much difficulty in publishing this book in terms of the technical aspects.  The biggest challenge will be completing the coloring of the book in time to have copies printed, autographed, and at your door before Christmas day this year.  My illustrator and I have a plan to achieve this goal, but there is a small chance your books could arrive after Christmas if we miss our deadline.
A secondary challenge will be manufacturing the Zagaboo Christmas Dolls in time for them to be delivered (to those who order them) before Christmas.  My manufacturer assures me the dolls will be finished by late November, which should provide sufficient time for me to ship them to your homes before Christmas.  If, however, manufacturing is delayed, there is a slight chance you could receive your dolls after Christmas.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you don't claim anything from this campaign, you can help me by sharing my campaign with others.  It's easy.  Just use the Indiegogo share tools on this site!

story:
The reason for the Superkid Tour

I grew up in Cambridge (Hespeler!), Ontario Canada. There were few black families in Cambridge and I loved to read. I read everything from Judy Blume to Beverly Cleary to E. B. White. What was missing in the stories was a little black girl. A mischievous, playful young girl who just wanted to have fun.
 
I am the writer of the novel Introducing Sophia Firecracker. It is the story of a nine-year-old girl who thinks she's a superhero. When Principal Corncob hints that teacher Mrs. Greenbean may also be a superhero, Sophia sets out on a mission to discover the teacher's superpowers.
 
I wrote Introducing Sophia Firecracker so that a generation of young girls and boys will have a positive image of themselves. Sophia is a character that makes kids laugh and hopefully, instills a sense of pride and self-esteem.
 
 
To this day, there is a lack of diversity in children's books; hence the need for the Superkid Tour. Sophia Firecracker is my implement for change and I want to introduce her to as many children as possible.

 

What We Need  

The Superkid Tour needs $5000 to buy as many books as possible and put gas in the car. The goal is to giveaway 3000 books across the United States and Canada.

 

From UNO to Yoko...

All the perks are on the right. The Five-Oh-Oh-Horsechack! buys books for an entire classroom of kids, the Triple-Play helps two kids and the Century Club helps ten.

Whatever you can do helps.

If you have a special request, I will do my best to accommodate. Please feel free to ask!

I understand that not everyone is able to contribute. Thanks for reading down this far anyway! You can also help to spread the word by linking out the campaign to your social media network and friends.  

                                                                                                    With thanks;
                                       A. A. Riley (hey, you can call me Angie, we're friends now!)

NOTE: I'm on the flexible plan on Indiegogo so all funds go to support the tour.

 

Nominate a SUPERKID

Do you know a Superkid who would benefit from the campaign? You do? Excellent! Please email at superkid@sophiafirecracker.com

 

RAVES for Introducing Sophia Firecracker!!!

...(I) read the intro on your website and thought it was written brilliantly - the sprouts girl made me laugh!
best wishes for both you and your book,
                                                                            -Cheryl -from email

A. A. Sophia firecracker is the book of the week in our house! All of a sudden it was plucked from the book case and that was it! So funny!                                                   -from facebook

I really love your book.  My favourite part is when Sophia tries to use her superpowers and they don’t work.
                                                                                -Emma Age 9

I recently had the opportunity to have A. A. Riley a new children’s author at our library. She read for us and the children were in total awe. The parents were also in attendance and were just as caught up in her story telling, so much so they all purchased the books and had Angie autograph the books.

I have asked her to come back this fall and go to the schools and she has agreed, Angie loved the interaction with an audience and they loved her.-

                                              - Stephanie Boltz, Director Midway Public Library

Dear A. A.,
We have been having so much fun with your book... which we’ve been reading each night at bedtime!  Z loves it and has his favourites parts that he asks me to read over and over again (esp. pp. 12-13 when he continues to laugh out loud at the mention of John Paul being a “malbec!)... he’s also reading them (his fave sections) aloud, over and over again, now too!
The other day I overheard Z announcing to his friend, as they climbed on the play structure in our backyard, that he has a funny book where a girl named Sophia calls a boy a “malbec” and then his teacher asks why he’s “calling John Paul a grape!!”. J
Thank you for the fun story times!                                                -T from email

 

New to Indiegogo?

You can buy a Superkid a book in three easy steps:

Step 1: Read through the perks  on the right.

Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page. 

Step 3: Enter your pledge amount - and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds!

You've done it! Thanks from me and especially the SUPERKIDS!

story:
Story of My Book

Painted Blocks Vitek returns home from four years abroad in Germany hoping to find the sense of community he felt so lacking there. Upon returning home he must grapple with the inevitability of change and how the home he left behind has been changing without him.

My name is Jakub Kocztorz and I am the author of Painted Blocks. I wrote this book because I grew tired of repetitive stories of extraordinary people marked out at birth and wanted to write about how incredible the ordinary really was.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the everyday in a setting your not familiar with. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with life as it really is and the struggles that accompany it. To see how everyday actions not merely the ones that change the world make all the difference.

You will love this book if you are looking for a change of pace. If you want to get to know characters like you would a friend. If you’re tired of tropes and arcs and just want to feel life through someone else’s eyes.

Painted speaks to the Restless and Disenchanted who want to grapple with change and meaning in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Painted Blocks inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

What happens after you go on your great adventure but still haven’t found what you’re looking for?

What is the nature of home and our connection to it?

Does the ‘change the world’ narrative so prevalent today set reasonable or useful expectations for living a happy and meaningful life?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing home, change, disappointment, and perspective will change us all for the better.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in [December, 2020]

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

I'm working with Brian Bies, Head of Publishing, and the whole team at New Degree Press, a innovative publishing company pursuing an author-centric publishing model, to put together a really exceptional book.
I never thought I would be in this position as an artist of sorts but slowly I came to realize there was a story I wanted to tell. It was important to me for this story to be true to life not as we would like it to be but as it is. In a way, to show the nobility in the everyday lives of normal people and their struggles to cope with the curve balls life throws at all of us.
I was terrified of taking the plunge and actually writing the book. The question kept coming up in my head who am I an average beer drinking suburban Polak to write a book for strangers to read. When I heard about the Creator Institute’s program, it felt like the sign I needed.
For more information you can connect with Brian at publishing@newdegreepress.com and me on various social media platforms, @jakubkocztorz.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #paintedblocks2020 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jakub Kocztorz

story:
Introduction

My name is Joyce Giboom Park and I am the author of Yellow Fantasy: Deconstructing the Legacy of Asian Fetishization. I wrote this book because of how overlooked the topic of Asian fetishization—and sexual racism—is in society, and how its history and implications are often unknown to many Asian individuals.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will come to understand how the modern phenomenon of “Yellow Fever” is rooted in insidious aspects of history and how individuals are consciously and unconsciously perpetuating its characteristics within modern relationships. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of awareness within you in becoming more conscious of sexual racism in your own life, and the need to persist against its prevalence that has already bled into multiple aspects of society. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you become an activist of your own, using it as a way to start conversations regarding the topic and to educate those around you that who might be unconsciously perpetuating sexual racism.


In this book, you'll learn about:

How and why Asian women came to be perceived as hyper-sexual, mysterious or submissive and docile beings.

How Asian fetishization and the derogatory “Yellow Fever” plays into larger themes of pornography, trafficking, and dating platforms.

How Asian fetishization relates to the oppression of women’s rights and BIPOC communities.

You will love this book if you are passionate about learning more about BIPOC rights, Womxn’s rights, and about empowering Asian-American and Asian communities.

 

The book is written in [3] Parts...


Part [1] contains the introduction and Chapters 1-3. These chapters go over how history came to portray Asian women in a sexually-illuminating light, as well as how that came with the simultaneous rejection and emasculation of Asian men. They explore the past of how “Yellow Fever” and its modern implications came to be.

Part [2] contains Chapters 4-6. These chapters explore the modern implications of Asian fetishization in media & pornography, sex tourism and trafficking, mail-order brides, as well as its prevalence in Alt. Right and Incel communities.

Part [3] contains Chapters 7-8 and the Conclusion of the book. It refers to the future of “Yellow Fever,” and the positive changes that are occurring and that can potentially occur. It refers to the changes that we, as readers of the book and as individuals in this society, can do in order to fight against sexual racism ourselves.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter 2020.

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.
 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

Joyce Giboom Park is an author, editor, and content creator, passionate about Asian-American and BIPOC politics & representation. She is passionate about advocating for Asian-American immigrant communities, whether through using her writing as a leading voice, or through working with grassroots organizations to participate in community organizing. Aside from her passion for writing and advocacy, Park can often be found watercolor painting and taking intermittent naps with her cat. For more information you can connect with Joyce at giboompark@gmail.com and @notyouryellowfantasy on Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #[BookHashtag] and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Joyce Giboom Park

story:
Hiya Everyone! I am Leon, a very curious possum from Australia. That’s me on the tree stump and it’s very nice to meet you. I am very excited to be here, as I need your help.

You see...I have always dreamt of going on a Big Adventure to all the places my Grandma Nanunci has told me about in her stories.

And I know I am small and young and should not be going out on my own, especially on a Big Adventure. Well, guess what? I am not on my own, I have my CREATURMAL FRIENDS!

Would you like to meet some of my CREATURMAL FRIENDS?  Great! I am happy you said YES!!! Here is our first Book 1: Leons BIG Adventure, where you can learn more about me and just some of  my Creaturmals friends!

Can you guess which Creaturmal is Grumpy, which one is Beautiful, which one is Very Smart, and which one is Wise?  To find out if your answers are correct, you will need to come along on our Big Adventures and join Leon and his friends with the Creaturmals Big Adventure Motto: “Friends, Together  For Ever!”

Leon and his Creaturmal Friends love having fun, being happy, learning something new each day, and all the things each Big Adventure story has to offer.

But to do this, Leon needs your help along the way…

And the Creaturmals Adventure Series will make a donation from every book sold to the good people at the “Make-a-Wish Foundation” who really are up to some good things making less fortunate people happier all over the world too!

The Creaturmals will reward all your kind support, with lots of fun, laughter, and warm fuzzy feelings, as you join us to learn and grow, from the places we visit and from each other.

The more friends that believe in us, means we can continue our Big Adventures and maybe eventually one day, we will be able to move around walking and talking, all because of YOU!!!!!

Could you please donate some of your money to our “Creaturmal Adventure Series?” Please? do not think I am rude, I am a very polite little possum. My Nanunci taught me to ask, she would say: “If you do not ask Leon, then how will you ever know the answer?”

Join us and be a part of the Creaturmals “Friends, Together For Ever” Big Adventure Crew. Donations would help the development and completion of Book 2: Willfee: The Magic Talking Carpet and Book 3: London! Up, Up and Away! 

And your donation would be Spucktacular; all donations will receive a Big Adventure CHEER!!!!

I must go now, it is almost snug time and my Grandma Nanunci always reads me new stories before Snug time. I just love my Grandma Nanunci and her stories.

Byeeeee!!! See you on the next adventure!!!!
