story:
¿Qué?

Testamento de un impostor es la historia de un viejo y descreído jesuita que, tras hacer sus particulares Américas, regresa al terruño de donde partió con el propósito de dar ejemplo al prójimo con su sacrificio y disciplina... ideal, en su caso, más encaminado a una búsqueda/huida de sí mismo que a paliar los males espirituales del prójimo.

Qué ocurre cuando después de toda esa vida vuelves a casa después de haber reconocido que has vivido desde el principio en una gran mentira, que todo lo que has hecho ha sido a sabiendas de que no creías en el objetivo último de tu cometido y menos aún en el credo que lo inspiraba. Qué ocurre cuando llega el momento de sincerarte, ante la muerte o acaso sólo ante la posibilidad de ésta, y tras toda una vida al servicio de los demás, representando el papel que te había sido encomendado por una institución de la que reniegas y en nombre de un Dios en el que no crees, y te tienes que enfrentar a aquellos que ven en ti un modelo a seguir, un ejemplo de lo que ellos les hubiera gustado ser y no se atrevieron, un héroe de su pequeño mundo que al contrario que ellos quiso y pudo traspasar las pequeñas fronteras de éste para conocer otros y darle sentido a una vida más allá de la simple subsistencia. Qué ocurre cuando acuden a ti para que los asesores en sus pequeños proyectos personales confiando en la autoridad que te infiere toda una vida supuestamente dedicada al prójimo y al estudio. Qué sucede cuando sabes que ya es demasiado tarde para desandar el camino que tomaste en su momento, para arreglar lo que no tuvo arreglo por tu cobardía y/o comodidad, y ya no te queda tiempo.

Pues ocurre que acudes buscando consuelo, y puede que también descargo, a los textos de aquellos que juzgas compañeros de espíritu. Como el famoso cura Jean Meslier que después de toda una vida dedicada al sacerdocio legó a la posteridad unos escritos en los que, no sólo renegaba de todo lo vivido, sino que además asentaba las bases del futuro ateísmo.

De modo que para contestar a todas esas preguntas invito a leer esta novela que titulo TESTAMENTO DE UN IMPOSTOR (Ad maiorem gloria Dei).  Una novela en la que se cuenta la historia de este misionero enfermo y descreído de regreso a casa después de toda una vida de misionero y profesor en Venezuela. Una novela en la destaca la ironía, y hasta el sarcasmo, con la que el autor relata su peripecia vital y describe a los numerosos personajes que se cruzaron a lo largo de su vida. Una novela donde se habla, no sólo de los interiores de su protagonista, sino también de su juventud durante la larga noche del franquismo cuando era seminarista, de la Venezuela de antes y después del chavismo y los trágicos episodios en los que se vio inmerso, de esa España, y más concreto del País Vasco, al que regresa ya de viejo, y sobre todo de ese otro mundo pequeño, íntimo, tan entrañable como también terrible, de la familia y los amigos a modo de último refugio después de la tempestad.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy os presentamos a Txema Arinas.

Novelista y ensayista, licenciado en Geografía e Historia por la Universidad del País Vasco, ha combinado la escritura con diversos trabajos en importación-exportación, la docencia y los viajes. Tiene publicado las novelas Los Años Infames (2007) Gaitajolea (2007), Anochecer en Lisboa (2008), Euskara Galdatan (2008), Maldan Behera Doa Aguro Nire Bihotz Biluzia (2009), Zoko Berri (2009), El Sitio (2009), Azoka (2011), Borreroak baditu hamaika aurpegi (2011), Muerte entre las viñas (2012), Como los Asnos Bajo la Carga (2013) y En el País de los Listos (2015).

Asimismo, también ha publicado los ensayos Sabino Arana o la Identidad Pervertida (2008) y El Imposible Perdido (2012). Se le puede seguir a diario en su blog: http://quejicakexontzia.blogspot.com/. Colabora como articulista en el periódico BERRIA, la revista Grand Place y la revista digital SOLO NOVELA NEGRA.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Testamento de un impostor que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Txema Arinas vea publicada esta obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Story of My Book

Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA is a series of stories about my personal journey as a refugee, and about the experiences of many other refugees and immigrants around the world.

My name is Jenaro “Shufto” Olwak Aken and I am the author of Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA. I wrote this book because I wanted to shine a light on my experience as a refugee from Sudan, and on the refugee experiences of many others around the world. We may not have all gone through the same challenges, but we all have gone through difficult circumstances nonetheless. This is just one version of that refugee experience, and it is one you haven’t heard before now.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the world is smaller than most people think. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for life and the human experience. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the refugee experience.

In this book, you'll learn about life in Sudan, Egypt, the US, and perseverance. You'll hear stories such as...
  • My family and my upbringing in Khartoum, Sudan.
  • The difficult decision families make to seek refugee in foreign lands and the challenges they face.
  • The importance of education, opportunity, and community.
You will love this book if you like to learn about different cultures, travel, and believe in possibilities.

Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA is a nonfiction book that speaks to parents and students who want to look at immigration and refugees in a new way.
 

The Book - Shufto - My Unique Journey From Sudan, Egypt, To The USA


The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. The first five chapters focus on my family and my childhood in Sudan. I write about my family dynamics and about my struggle dealing with the name “Shufto.” I was a curious child and often got into trouble for being so curious, but my love for education helped me through that difficult time and early stages in my life.

Part 2 contains chapters 6-12. These chapters deal with the early stages of my education, my relationship with my parents, and my family's decision to leave Sudan for Egypt, and life in Cairo. Living in Egypt was a difficult experience for all of us, but particularly for my mother especially after a serious accident. At only ten years old, I tried my very best to support her and the family.

Part 3 contains chapters 13-19. This last part of the book covers our transition from Africa to America. The culture shock, a new language, snow, and the four seasons of Western, New York. I write about the ups and downs of growing up in Buffalo, NY and about the community as well as about the opportunity my family and I were granted to start a new life and make the best of our second chance as a refugee family in the USA.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author


Jenaro Aken is a community activist, entrepreneur, storyteller, and author of the new book Shufto – My Unique Journey from Sudan, Egypt, to the U.S.A.

He wrote the book in order to shine a light on the refugee experience many Sudanese families have gone through over the past two decades. Jenaro is passionate about working within his community with youth and young adults in particular. His goal is to inspire the next generation to take full advantage of opportunities available to them, in hopes of making a positive impact in the world. Jenaro is curious about finding ways to use his life story and experience as a refugee to connect with people interested in helping those of us most in need.

Reading, writing, dancing, and music have been important pillars in Jenaro’s life from a young age. He credits the arts for helping shape the person he has become. Sports, soccer "Futball" in particular is a favorite hobby and has been for a long time. Most friends would describe Jenaro as talkative and a “know it” all, but a humble and gentle soul deep down.

For more information, you can connect with Jenaro Olwak Aken at Olwakjenaro@gmail.com and on Instagram @Olwak_Jenaro.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Shuftomyjourney and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jenaro Olwak Aken

story:
Story of My Book

No Two Are Alike is about the founding of Sophia Academy, which was a private school for children with learning differences. I write about my experiences with this school, my family, and my life as a whole.

My name is Caroline O’Neal, and I am the author of No Two Are Alike. I wrote this memoir because God laid it on my heart to write and to tell this story. I also wrote it to teach people who God is.

In my memoir, you'll learn about:

  • God
  • My family and faith
  • Sophia Academy and how it changed peoples’ lives.

You will love my story if you want to see who God is, want to grow your faith, have a child or children with learning differences, or know someone with learning differences.

No Two Are Alike is a non-fiction book for people with a child with learning differences who is going to school for the first time. My book is also for people looking to learn more about God.

The book is written in four Parts.

  • Part 1 contains the Introduction and Chapters 1 - 3. In these chapters, the reader will learn about my family, faith, and my experience with education before Sophia Academy.
  • Part 2 contains Chapters 4 - 6. The reader will learn how Sophia Academy was founded and why it was created. The reader will also learn about my experience as a student at this school.
  • Part 3 contains Chapters 7 - 8. The reader will learn what happened in my life after I left Sophia Academy as a student. The reader will also learn who they are in God.
  • Part 4 contains Chapters 9 - 12. The reader will learn about my life as an employee at Sophia Academy, and about the connection with God and Sophia Academy. The reader will also learn how Sophia Academy was different in many ways as a school, as well as when my mom decided to retire.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Caroline O’Neal is an author and nanny. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her family, traveling, and writing. She lives in Atlanta, Georgia with her husband.

Caroline wrote No Two Are Alike because she wanted to tell the story of how Sophia Academy was created. In addition, she wanted to make the connection with God and Sophia Academy.

For more information, you can connect with Caroline O’Neal at carolineconeal@gmail.com.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #NoTwoAreAlike and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!
Caroline O’Neal

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Amnoni Myers and I am the author of You Are the Prize! This memoir will take you on a personal journey into my life as a child who struggled to understand my identity and experiences as an adult. My parents abandoned me at birth, and I struggled to understand my worth and value in this world. With the odds stacked against me, I went through life navigating the uniqueness of who I am. At the age of twelve, with tears in my eyes, I walked into my foster mother’s bedroom and asked, “Why did God create me?!”. At the time, I was unable to see the beauty in my experiences. Despite negative statistics, I was always determined to create a different story than the one that was written about me.

You Are the Prize explores the complexities, the struggles, and the journey of bringing together the different identities of who I am in a world full of intricacies. As a young person who experienced early childhood trauma coupled with separation and loss from my biological family, I’ve been on a journey to understand who I am in spite of the challenges I’ve faced along the way. You Are the Prize is a personal motto and a reminder that we all deserve to know and understand what our worth regardless of what we’ve faced or experienced. I am writing this book because as a Black, queer, young person who grew up in the foster care system, I want everyone (especially young people of color) to know that their lives are valuable, and their experiences have meaning.

Mark Twain once said, “There are two important days in a person’s life: the day you were born and the day you find out why.” This statement is powerful beyond words but unfortunately many young people who grow up in foster care don’t always get to relish in that experience which makes the concept foreign for so many to achieve. In 2014, I stood in front of members of Congress and the White House Domestic Policy Council to present them with policy recommendations and it was then that I finally began to see the importance of my experiences. The report was inspired by my own experiences of growing up in foster care. Shortly after, I was personally invited by the Obama Administration to apply to be an intern. Never in my life did I imagine having an experience like that!

As I reflected on my life, I thought about the fact that the very experiences I faced are the same experiences that helped me get where I am today. Furthermore, I could not have done it alone. Without the support of a high school teacher, principal, and a host of others I’ve met on this journey, I would still be asking myself, “Why did God create me?”. My goal is that this book will help other young people understand the purpose of their individual journeys, starting with the belief that they are the prize.

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of how our experiences shape our identity by confronting adversity through opportunity and the power of connection in the midst of grief and loss through narratives like:

Black Girl in the Mirror: A story around the multiple complexities I faced as a young, black girl and the journey of understanding my inner beauty.

The Pact: A journey into the world of siblinghood, connection, rivalry and how love formed an unbreakable bond through unexpected loss.

Writings on the Wall: The story of how getting caught drawing graffiti on the walls led to unforeseen opportunities.

Meeting inspirational people like Deesha Dyer, Social Secretary for the Obama Administration who inspired me to tap into my black girl magic as a White House Intern along with Introducing Former First Lady Michelle Obama on national t.v in an effort to raise awareness about young people in foster care.

A conversation from my life with my late sister about the importance of remembering that I am the prize during a pivotal moment in my life.

You will love this book if you are interested in learning about the foster care system, helping young people build social capital, navigate difficult transitions and if you are looking for ways to get involved!

You Are the Prize speaks to young people who are currently in the system and Thought Leaders who want to grapple with transforming the child welfare system and help foster children find their voice.

Ultimately, I hope that You Are the Prize inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

 

  1. How have your own experiences contributed to the person you are today?
  2. How can we be supportive of young people who are currently in the system or those who were formerly in the system?
  3. How do we ensure that every young person in foster care knows without a doubt that they are the prize?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing the importance of providing young people with opportunities as they work through their trauma is valuable. Hopefully, having conversations like this will change us all for the better.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor and I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020

  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this in winter 2020.

Milestones:

  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish.
  • When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.
  • When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


++ I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Amnoni Myers is a dynamic child welfare advocate, a public speaker and consultant. A native of Boston, Massachusetts, Amnoni now resides in California where she is working as a Resource Family Approval Trainer Specialist for Stanford Sierra Youth and Families. She supports families as they navigate the approval process to become licensed families for young
people in foster care.

In 2017, Amnoni received her Master of Public Administration degree from the National Urban Fellows Program in Manhattan, New York. In this prestigious program, Amnoni was placed at the California Endowment located in Oakland, California where she worked on the My Brother’s Keeper Initiative for young boys and men of color. As a consultant, Amnoni lends a unique perspective to the work as her experience ranges from aging out of the foster care system and returning to the system as a professional to leading efforts that envision a better system for all children.

Amnoni previously worked with the U.S. Children’s Bureau as a child welfare policy consultant as well as interning on both Capitol Hill and The White House Domestic Policy Council helping to influence policy. She graduated from Gordon College with a double major in Social Work and Sociology. Amnoni also completed a Social Work and Peace and Conflict Studies Practicum in San Francisco, CA. She also traveled to South Africa to study race, class, and gender.

Amnoni became a ward of the state at birth and through her experiences in foster care, she became committed to helping others understand the importance of their voice and experiences so that others can break the cycle of poverty. She has received numerous awards for her contributions to child welfare nationwide. Amnoni is a compassionate and driven individual dedicated to reshaping policies affecting divested populations.

For more information you can connect with Amnoni at Amnoni Motivates Website connect with amnoni at unbecoming88@gmail.com and follow my journey on Facebook Instagram and LinkedIn 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #YOUARETHEPRIZE and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support; I am excited for you all to join me on this amazing journey; continue to remember that YOU ARE THE PRIZE!

Thanks again,
Amnoni L Myers #YOUARETHEPRIZE

story:
Story of My Book

Bridge Makers: Becoming a Citizen Futurist is a call-to-action book that encourages everyone to look at, think about, and act on the future. With a focus on science and technology innovation, we take a look at major advancements over the past century, what’s happening today and what is coming, including the attributes and tools that can help us become active participants in the future.

My name is April Reagan and I am the author of Bridge Makers: Becoming a Citizen Futurist. I wrote this book because I want more people to become involved in our collective future.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the empowering acts of looking for trends, thinking about what’s possible and engaging to influence the future. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for innovation. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you develop confidence in foresight and engaging stakeholders who influence our collective future.

In this book, you'll learn about futurism and foresight. You'll read stories such as:
  • The pivots that took Cecily Sommers from from dancer to futurist.
  • The way MIT student Gene Becker actually stumbled into a life-long love of cutting-edge innovation.
  • Jane McGonigal’s realization that gaming empowers people to change the world and how it launched her on a path that set a world record for the most foresight insights generated in a day.
You will love this book if you are interested in the future, if you want to engage in conversations about the decisions innovators are making, or want to influence potential outcomes of advancements in science and technology,

Bridge Makers is a nonfiction book that speaks to life-long learners and optimists who want to look at innovation and activism in a new way.
 

The Book - Bridge Makers: Becoming a Citizen Futurist

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. In this section, the history of futurism, fly-over views of key advancements in science and technology, as well as discussions about the need for future literacy and values-based - not ideological - dialogue.

Part 2 contains chapters 6-7. These two chapters are core to the book, describing the unique attributes of futurists and the foresight skills they use.

Part 3 contains chapters 8-11. Here, four stakeholder groups (citizens, students and educators, policy makers and organization leaders) each have a chapter dedicated to a discussion about what the Look, Think, Act cycle looks like, and for policy makers and organizations, the importance of engaging a broader audience on major decisions.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

There are also a variety of add-ons including custom journals, a poster, t-shirt and a visit with the author.

About the Author

April Reagan is a writer and researcher with over twenty years of program and product management experience in high tech, working for Microsoft, Samsung and Fjord Design and Innovation. She is a part-time lecturer at the University of Washington, Bothell and does independent consulting through her company Palm Trees and Robots.

April has been a tech geek and entrepreneur since elementary school. A veteran attendee of the Consumer Electronics Show , many look forward to reading her summaries each year. She has worked with several new product development teams and delivered innovation workshops to Fortune 500 companies.

April lives in her adopted hometown of Seattle, has an incredible husband and two wonderful children. Having grown up in Colorado Springs, home of NORAD and the Air Force Academy, science and technology were early attractions. After attending five different schools across three states, in pursuit of her bachelor’s degree, learning also became a natural part of her life. She earned her MBA in 2009 and is currently a doctoral candidate with matriculation targeted in 2022. A hack golfer, ice hockey fanatic and aspiring screenwriter, April always has something going on!

For more information, you can connect with April Reagan at aprilr_author@outlook.com, on Facebook @aprilreaganauthor and Twitter @authorreagan.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier (destinations outside of the U.S. may have an additional charge).

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BridgeMakers and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
April Reagan

The pivots that took Cecily Sommers from from dancer to futurist.
The way MIT student Gene Becker actually stumbled into a life-long love of cutting-edge innovation.
Jane McGonigal’s realization that gaming empowers people to change the world and how it launched her on a path that set a world record for the most foresight insights generated in a day.

story:
Our Mission Statement

We are a small, independent publishing house devoted to offering indie authors paid writing opportunities and releasing high-quality works in both horror and dark fantasy.

From the moment we opened our doors we have prided ourselves with knowing that we have made it our practice to make sure that we pay our authors, because we wholeheartedly believe that indie authors, like all artists, should be paid for their work.

What does that mean? It means that, outside of drabbles, each and every word published in our books and on our website has been paid for. As a new publishing house this is a huge commitment, but a necessary one.

 

 

Founded in late 2019, Eerie quickly gained a following of eager authors and readers on our numerous social media platforms. In 2020 we released a successful trio of horror anthologies, the "It Calls From..." series, which is now known as our house's flagship series. Every single one of these anthologies hit the number one spot on Amazon's new release charts, and they have consistently seen great reviews from readers.


Our next release ("It Calls from the Sea") along with our newest collection of dark fantasy novelettes will be releasing in early 2021.

 

 

This Campaign

As an indie publishing house we feel it is crucial that we pay our indie authors as much as we can - this is why this campaign is all about our authors! 100% of the funds raised in this campaign will go directly towards paying our authors. Yes, 100%.

2021 is gearing up to be our most ambitious year yet! We have multiple anthologies in both horror and dark fantasy releasing, as well as open calls for anthologies, audiobooks, single-authored novels and novellas coming out.

We are putting everything we have behind these projects, and want to make sure we are supporting our indie authors in the best way possible.

 

What We Need 

As you can imagine 2020 has been a hard year for the indie publishing world. In this uncertain, tumultuous time all of us have seen the brunt of the pandemic in sales and revenue. However, paying our authors a decent amount has been our number one priority (even when that meant not paying ourselves.)

Our only goal for this campaign is to help pay for the authors that contribute to our anthologies. If we are able to reach our initial goal our plan is to pay all of our authors a minimum of one cent per word for each story selected for our anthologies, which is an industry standard. 

With this added income going directly to our authors it will enable us to continue to grow, expand and invest other resources into marketing, covers, and editing in 2021.

 

 

The Impact

Every single pledge will go directly towards paying our authors. 

We are hoping to raise $3,000.00 for the three anthologies planned for the year. Should we exceed this total the additional funds will go towards adding an extra anthology call for the year, or else it will be put aside for next year's author payments to secure another year of paid writing opportunities.

In the event we don't make our target know that all funds that are collected will still be put towards our author payments. None of the funds will be directed outside this scope!

 

The Rewards

Each reward is uniquely designed to give you the max amount of value and all of the Eerie River Publishing experience we can. From current books to pre-ordered packages of upcoming releases you will have a plethora of options to choose from while you support our indie pub.!

 

Risks & Challenges

As with every small business there are inherent risks, and family emergencies or illness in one of our key team members can push a timeline further than we anticipate. However, we are committed to completing the line up of anthologies planned within the 2021 timeline and don't foresee any issues.

 

What to expect in 2021

 

OUR PLANNED ANTHOLOGIES AND OPEN CALLS FOR 2021

Horror - "It Calls From the Doors": Short stories of portals, rips in dimensions.  Open to the public March 2021.

Dark Fantasy - "Of Fire and Stars" featuring LGBTQ+ characters in a fae inspired world. Open to the public June 2021.

The Horror Novel and Novella submission window opens June 16 - July 16.

Horror - "It Calls From the Veil": Short stories of possessions, supernatural, ghosts, demons and summonings that have gone wrong (or right).  Open to the public in September 2021.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you are not able to contribute to our campaign financially, and there are lots of different ways to help our indie company grow.

  • Please spread the word about our campaign, even if you just suggest it to a friend.
  • Take advantage of the Indiegogo share options and share, share, share!
  • Did you read one of our books? Then remember to leave a review, even if it is just a few lines saying you enjoyed it.
  • You can also follow us on Facebook and like and comment on our posts, or join us on Twitter and Youtube and comment or like when you can.

 

Every little interaction helps, and we want you to be a part of our family. And that's all there is to it.

 

 

Check back regularly for added pledges, updates,

and featured opportunities.

story:
I am selling first editions of my book, The Dark and the Light 

Thanks for checking out my crowdsourcing campaign. I am Matthew John Schultz and I wrote a memoir about my childhood, life traumas, addiction, and recovery. Yet, there is so much more! There are also essays on different healing techniques, stories about my rock and roll days, my shamanic practices, and my time working as a facilitator at Ayahuasca centers in Peru and Brazil. This book is also a cautionary warning for those seeking out sacred medicine practices. It offers advice for those seeking that path. 

Now, I need your help with presales to pay for the bulk printing and the distribution costs for online booksellers like Amazon, Apple Books, etc. I have already found a great printer and the sample copies of the hardbacks and paperbacks look wonderful! I also have a PDF version that is laid out the same as the printed books and can be used with most book readers, reader apps and on ALL computers.

Since I am printing these myself and sending them out directly to you... I can sign your copy if you wish. Just let me know. The printed copies should be available to mail out by mid October. 

Thanks for your time! I appreciate your support and helping to make this project come to life. 
Please share this on social media and help me spread the word. This campaign ends Sept 27th, so act fast!

Here are some early reviews....

“This is like no other book I’ve ever read. Brutal and intense but also warm and wickedly funny. There’s a lot to take in with this work, but those who follow Matthew’s journey to its conclusion will be rewarded with an experience uncommon of most memoirs – especially those written by others mostly known to the general pubic for their musical history alone. Matthew’s work transcends that – this is something else entirely. It’s not an easy ride, but it’s worth every turn of the page. Reaching this book’s finale is well worth the time invested.”

~ Joel Gausten - Author of: The 3 Am Girls

 

“Schultz has traveled around the world and seen both the good and bad sides of the Ayahuasca movement and the shaman industry which has grown around it. Therefore, in addition to being an entertaining read, The Dark and the Light marks an important step in the process of opening dialogue on how something that has the potential to  transform people’s lives can be supported, and how safeguards can be put in place to protect peoples mental and physical health - and pocketbooks - from creeps, charlatans and predators.”

            ~ Brian Mier - Co-Editor of Brasil Wire

 

“Matt’s brilliant and sober artistic vision presents an interesting counter-narrative to the siren song intoxicating thousands of gringos in search of “shamanic” journeys in Central and South America.   Full of gritty colorful characters, and a surrealistic style that reflects its own internal compulsions, addictions, and trauma, “The Dark and the Light” strikes me like Warhol and Lou Reed’s response to the Summer of Love in their 1967 release of “The Velvet Underground and Nico”.  Let the flower children spend a night in “The Factory” if they dare.  Highly recommended.”

  ~ Michael Kokal - End of the Road Podcast

 

For more information please visit http://www.thedarkandthelight.com/index.html

SIDEBAR: Shipping on all tiers is free via USPS. With that said, I am not responsible for the delivery. All tiers can be sent via UPS and are guaranteed with tracking numbers but you must contact me at matthew@thedarkandthelight.com and submit and extra $13 shipping fee. Thanks!

story:
Overview

I have reached my $8,000 goal!

Thank you to each and every one of you for supporting me throughout this journey. I feel overwhelmed with gratitude and cannot even begin to express how much your contributions mean to me. Being able to share my words with you all has been a blessing in so many ways. 

Because we have reached this goal, I will now be able to publish a paperback, ebook, audiobook, and a hardcover.

Thank you a million times over. I cannot even believe that this is real!

 

Story of My Book

The Language of Loss is a collection of stories about the overwhelming heartache of grief and the ways in which we grow through our pain. 

My name is Natalie Sanchez and I am the author of The Language of Loss. I wrote this book because my experience with grief has transformed my life in every way. As death always does, the loss completely derailed my life. It has challenged my values, my faith, my relationships, and my happiness. But it also has inspired tremendous growth. In the time that I have lived without my dad, I have become an entirely new human being. There is something devastatingly beautiful about the way we metamorphose through pain.

After my dad’s death, I wanted to honor him and all the lessons he left behind. His absence propelled me into periods of deep reflection, where I began to question my purpose, life’s purpose, and what it really means to lose someone. I experienced an inexplicable compulsion to tell my story, not just for me, but for all other people struggling with loss. I couldn’t help but notice that alongside the overpowering grief, tragedy allowed me to form deeper and stronger connections with people than I ever had before. 

I hope that in reading this book, those struggling to navigate life with loss can rediscover a sense of passion and purpose. By sharing my story, I want to help others realize they can give, they can heal, and they can grow. I hope that the stories of others will inspire you as much as they inspire me. I hope that you come to know how seamlessly grief and joy can coexist with one another. And I hope that this book can become a source of comfort, a reminder that healing without ever moving on, maybe: is... possible.

In this book, you'll hear stories from my life, but also from others who have experienced loss. You will hear stories of heartbreak and hope, grief and gratitude, anecdotes of ordinary people and the tragedies that shaped them. These stories include losses of all forms - parents, grandparents, children, friends, siblings - because although grief never manifests itself in the same way, it is universally transformative.

If you have ever lost someone you love, or even if you know someone who is grieving, you will love this book. Things like death and tragedy are inevitable, but within loss lies an endless potential for goodness. My intention is to share my experience and supplement it with the stories and insight I have learned along the way.

The Language of Loss is a memoir that speaks to the power of hope and purpose in the face of profound heartache.

 

The Book - The Language of Loss

The book is broken up into three parts, each characterized by the different stages of my experience and the lessons I have learned from others throughout my journey.

Part 1, Falling: The Journey We Didn’t Choose, contains the introduction and additional chapters. This part of the book details the shock we feel after loss, the way we must embark on a new, completely foreign chapter. Stories in this part describe the unwilling transition and the paralyzing heartache that we experience as we try to carry on. 

Part 2, Rising: Navigation and Rediscovery, is comprised of stories that represent the exploratory stages of grief. As we move about our journeys in deviating, non-linear ways, tiny pockets of beauty unexpectedly surface through the pain. These are stories of learning to rise and embrace what is good amid the heartache.

Part 3, Forward: Infinite Directions, culminates with the stories of growth. Finding our footing on this journey is an endless process that inspires new relationships, perspectives, and values. With the right mindset, we have the potential to cultivate purpose and passion from our deepest pain.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020
  • The Cover Design - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the book’s interior (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Natalie Sanchez is an undergraduate student studying Digital Media and Spanish at Marquette University. After losing her father in March of 2018, she became interested in the ways that loss inspires growth. Through kindness cards, soccer tournaments, and original songwriting, honoring her father has become an integral part of grieving. Her passion for writing and desire to help others navigate their journey has driven her to share her story of love, loss, and hope. 

Outside of writing, she is passionate about travel, music, soccer, and videography. She loves discovering new songs, stories, and people, and is always down for a pickup soccer game. You can find her studying at the local coffee shops, tasting Milwaukee’s best tacos, curling up to watch an engaging documentary, and roaming around the city with her family, friends, and Golden Retriever, Leo. 

For more information you can connect with Natalie at nataliesanchez@wi.rr.com and Instagram: @natalieksanchez, and Facebook: @nataliesanchezauthor

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, here are some other ways you can help:

  • Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Use #languageofloss and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. You can do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media!

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

OverviewI have reached my $8,000 goal!Thank you to each and every one of you for supporting me throughout this journey. I feel overwhelmed with gratitude and cannot even begin to express how much your contributions mean to me. Being able to share my words with you all has been a blessing in so many ways. Because we have reached this goal, I will now be able to publish a paperback, ebook, audiobook, and a hardcover.Thank you a million times over. I cannot even believe that this is real! Story of My BookThe Language of Loss is a collection of stories about the overwhelming heartache of grief and the ways in which we grow through our pain. My name is Natalie Sanchez and I am the author of The Language of Loss. I wrote this book because my experience with grief has transformed my life in every way. As death always does, the loss completely derailed my life. It has challenged my values, my faith, my relationships, and my happiness. But it also has inspired tremendous growth. In the time that I have lived without my dad, I have become an entirely new human being. There is something devastatingly beautiful about the way we metamorphose through pain.After my dad’s death, I wanted to honor him and all the lessons he left behind. His absence propelled me into periods of deep reflection, where I began to question my purpose, life’s purpose, and what it really means to lose someone. I experienced an inexplicable compulsion to tell my story, not just for me, but for all other people struggling with loss. I couldn’t help but notice that alongside the overpowering grief, tragedy allowed me to form deeper and stronger connections with people than I ever had before. I hope that in reading this book, those struggling to navigate life with loss can rediscover a sense of passion and purpose. By sharing my story, I want to help others realize they can give, they can heal, and they can grow. I hope that the stories of others will inspire you as much as they inspire me. I hope that you come to know how seamlessly grief and joy can coexist with one another. And I hope that this book can become a source of comfort, a reminder that healing without ever moving on, maybe: is... possible.In this book, you'll hear stories from my life, but also from others who have experienced loss. You will hear stories of heartbreak and hope, grief and gratitude, anecdotes of ordinary people and the tragedies that shaped them. These stories include losses of all forms - parents, grandparents, children, friends, siblings - because although grief never manifests itself in the same way, it is universally transformative.If you have ever lost someone you love, or even if you know someone who is grieving, you will love this book. Things like death and tragedy are inevitable, but within loss lies an endless potential for goodness. My intention is to share my experience and supplement it with the stories and insight I have learned along the way.The Language of Loss is a memoir that speaks to the power of hope and purpose in the face of profound heartache. The Book - The Language of LossThe book is broken up into three parts, each characterized by the different stages of my experience and the lessons I have learned from others throughout my journey.Part 1, Falling: The Journey We Didn’t Choose, contains the introduction and additional chapters. This part of the book details the shock we feel after loss, the way we must embark on a new, completely foreign chapter. Stories in this part describe the unwilling transition and the paralyzing heartache that we experience as we try to carry on. Part 2, Rising: Navigation and Rediscovery, is comprised of stories that represent the exploratory stages of grief. As we move about our journeys in deviating, non-linear ways, tiny pockets of beauty unexpectedly surface through the pain. These are stories of learning to rise and embrace what is good amid the heartache.Part 3, Forward: Infinite Directions, culminates with the stories of growth. Finding our footing on this journey is an endless process that inspires new relationships, perspectives, and values. With the right mindset, we have the potential to cultivate purpose and passion from our deepest pain. What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

story:
On Saturday May 17th, 2014 my brother Steven C. Wilson passed away unexpectedly at the age of 33 at his job in Phoenix Arizona.  He was found on the bathroom floor, but when the paramedics arrived there was nothing they could for him.  Unfortunately an autopsy could not be performed as it's a cost that we cannot afford. 

Steven was a loving bother that cared about others and was willing help anyone at a moments noticed.  Despite his trying life with heart problems and running the risk of getting colon cancer due to gene carried by our family, to which our father passed away from colon cancer, he was always positive and saw the good in people.

My family and I are asking for any help possible to be able to provide Steven with a proper burial next my grandmother at Holy Cross Cemetery in Culver City.  The total cost of the services is estimated at $6500; which includes transportation from Phoenix to Los Angeles, casket, services, and administration fees.  Any amount will help and would be greatly appreciated.  Thank you in advance and God Bless.

story:
“In The Canoe, Michelle Baker’s words compel us to feel the fragility and impermanence of life. She exposes our vulnerability and juxtaposes it with a vivid appreciation for the sweetness and sensuality of our human experience.  Thus, creative tension flows.”

–Michael J. Gelb, author, How to Think Like Leonardo Da Vinci and Creativity On Demand: How to Ignite and Sustain the Fire of Genius


Help Launch The Canoe Book Tour: Let's Get It Into The Hands of Readers and Reviewers.


The Story

On my son’s seventh birthday, I had a biopsy done on my thyroid. Seven days later, I found out I had cancer. The news blindsided me.  It acted as a cold bucket of water, and made me stop and figure out, “Now what?” In the midst of being a single mother and traveling monthly to take care of my 91 year old grandmother, I had surgery, started treatments, and began writing a book.

I have always wanted to write a book based on my grandfather’s life. He was one of the first licensed morticians in the state of Maryland. Well after his death, one question I wished I could have asked him was how the news of the sinking of the Titanic impacted his community and family. The Canoe is my fictional answer.

It took me one year to write The Canoe, and has taken eight months to prepare for publication. I plan to take The Canoe as far as possible, and have it land in the hands of James Cameron. Think big. Be bold. Why not?

What Your Support Will Make Possible

The book is ready to print. I thought this was the finale, but it turns out it’s only the beginning! 

There is pre-launch work to accomplish before the November 1st publication date, which includes but is not limited to submitting the book for reviews and press exposure, interviews in print and radio, and working with publicists to schedule the book blog tour in addition to book talks in various cities around the country. 


Here is a brief list:

  • Printing costs
  • Pre-publication tasks such as author and book pages (Amazon, Barnes & Noble, etc.), reviews, press, researching and scheduling the blog book tour and the in-person book talk tour
  • Creating a media kit to send out to prospective venues for book talks, performances and writing workshops 
  • The development of content and programming for the book talks and tours
  • Production of promotional and instruction videos for marketing
  • Post-publication marketing and publicity to include additional blog and live book tours, book fairs & awards, reviews, and radio/print interviews
  • With whatever is left, I will pay off the accumulated expenses that got the book this far: book and cover design, web site design and development, hiring of book marketing strategists, postage, and the printing of pre-publication galleys.


    • Perks for You

    We have perks for any size contribution. They include posters, signed books, one-on-one writing workshops, meet the author events, and acknowledgements on my website.


    The Impact

    Art is how I share my experiences in the world. I believe it is the safest way to express our most difficult and challenging emotions. It invites and allows us to see into the darkness, offering a chance to imagine, to choose, and to live differently. This is why I write and paint, and why I love sharing and facilitating the creative process with others.

    With your contribution, you will know you have supported an artist dedicated to the healing aspects of creativity. Years ago as a teacher, I aimed to cultivate the creative drive of children. Later in my 30s, I attended the Tamalpa Institute to study expressive arts therapy to serve a deeper commitment to my own creative process. It was there that I realized each of us has the tools and the content to pull together and create, not just a meaningful work of art, but a fulfilling and unique life, even in the face of obstacles and hardship.

    This is what has fueled the writing of The Canoe, and my work as a teacher and an artist. Your support will allow the book and my passion for expression in the arts to take root with others in new and imaginative ways.

    About Me

    Ms. Baker is an author, playwright, and visual artist. She conducts creative writing and memoir-writing workshops working with groups and individuals. With the launch of The Canoe, she offers writing workshops in conjunction with book talks and book club “Meet the Author” events. Ms. Baker is Editor in Chief for Millionaire Girls' Movement, an online platform educating women on how to generate, sustain and protect their wealth, and is a contributor for Huffington Post.

    Track Record

    I’m no newbie to the arts. I have shown my visual art for 25 years. My paintings are currently represented by Gallery Minerva in Asheville, NC. In 2008, my play, Sole Survivors, went to New York City. It returned for a second run supported by a successful crowd-funded campaign through the non-profit, Fractured Atlas. My show received fantastic reviews, and went on to return to New York for a third time. It is exciting to come forward again with another project that has just as much support, interest and enthusiasm behind it. I know what it takes to launch something big and am ready to do whatever it takes to bring out The Canoe.


    The book’s official launch date is November 1, and I already have book talks scheduled in Asheville, NC on November 1st (at Gallery Minerva) and in Annapolis, MD on November 7th (at the Annapolis Bookstore.) Additional talks are in the works.


    I’m also delighted to report that The Canoe will be represented at the 66th Frankfurt Book Fair— the most important book event in the world, expected to draw 7,500 publishers from 110 countries eager to purchase rights, arrange co-publishing deals and expand their distribution lists.


    I’ve done my due diligence: all pre-publication review copies have been submitted to library publications and my media kit is in the works. The launch date of November 1st is just around the corner, and with your support my entire team is ready to go.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Community is essential. I understand not everyone can make a financial contribution. In this event, please consider:

      • Recommending The Canoe for your or a friend's book club

      • Sharing this campaign with friends and family over the phone and through social media, the Indiegogo share tools, and by sharing the link to The Canoe's website (www.thecanoebymichellebaker.com)

      • Purchasing the ebook (click here to go to Amazon page) and writing an Amazon review

      • Ordering a copy of the printed book (Available November 1st online)

      • Working with me to consult on the publication of your own work or to facilitate your own writing project...the list is endless.


      Thank you!

      For me, writing is a solitary practice that is dependent upon the support of a greater community. Your interest and support make this entire journey worthwhile, and I am deeply appreciative. 
      Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
      - Michelle

      Praise for The Canoe

      "Michelle Baker has created a memorable gem of a story in The Canoe. Her sparse, evocative use of language engages the senses and the interplay of themes of love, loss, fate and faith engages the mind. This little book is worth reading and reading again."

      –Anne Hillerman, author, Spider Woman's Daughter


      “Poetic and mysterious, Michelle Baker’s first novel evokes the simplicity of centuries past — and through that simplicity, the reader is brought deeply into the thoughts and emotions of the characters.”

      –Katherine Mayfield, author, The Box of Daughter, and Bullied


      “In The Canoe, Michelle Baker’s mesmerizing prose places readers in peril in exhilarating ways that are rare in contemporary literature. In this book’s converging stories of wild love and unimaginable loss, the author has conjured the human tribe at the moment of wonder when we open our arms to life and at the moment of awe when we open them to the embrace of death.”

      –Kevin McIlvoy, author, The Complete History of New Mexico & other stories, Hyssop, Little Peg, and The Fifth Station


      “Pure poetry in motion. A swift-moving, heartfelt tale of love and loss, two stories intersecting—and connecting—by magic. Michelle Baker is a born poet, and a born writer. The Canoe is just the start of what I hope to be a long idyllic journey through the love and soul of the human heart.”

          –Trent Zelazny, author, People Person and To Sleep Gently

       

      “This is a dazzling, deft collision of the human experience, history with an audible pulse, and truly literary expression. Baker navigates The Canoe’s ambitious themes boldly and leaves the reader richer for it.”

      – Candace Walsh, author, Licking the Spoon: a Memoir of Food, Family, and Identity


      “In her book The Canoe, Michelle Baker mesmerizes the reader gently into powerful contemplation. Engaging characters with compelling plot textured integrated points of view flow naturally. Baker soulfully invites us into authentic specificity through the organic language of character, which unpretentiously unearths the universal.

      The Canoe uniquely transfixes me into a contemplative state naturally from a thoughtful writer and her soulful characters.”

      – Doug Vincent, Founder, Boulder Storyhealers; Playwright, A Day For Grace


      “Michelle Baker has penned a lyrical and poignant tale in the year 1912 from two different points of view– a boy named Bernie and a young widow named Katherine…. The journey takes us back and forth from boy to woman, from land to sea, weaving a story of love and loss, of power and weakness…offering us, in Michelle’s words, ‘a pen transcribing our history in a distinct and invisible line.’”

      – Cheryl King, creator and producing director of Stage Left Studio, NYC

story:
En México, 50% de la población es menor de 26 años. Se dice que tenemos 8 millones de jóvenes que no estudian ni trabajan de manera regular. Aunque, visto de otra manera, eso significa que hay alrededor de 22 millones de jóvenes que están participando de una u otra forma en nuestro país. ¿Qué hacen esos jóvenes? ¿Estudian, trabajan… opinan? ¿Qué les interesa? ¿Qué los mueve? ¿En qué cosas participan?

 En Ollin tenemos muchas preguntas sobre los jóvenes en México. Somos una organización de jóvenes que trabaja con otros jóvenes para buscar y mejorar los espacios de participación juvenil en nuestro país. La pregunta que queremos responder este año es ésta: ¿Qué tanto los jóvenes estamos tomando en nuestras manos este país? Y para contestarla, nos surgieron otras cuantas, como por ejemplo: ¿Los jóvenes somos parte de las instituciones gubernamentales, de las educativas, de los emprendedores, de la sociedad civil organizada? La aventura comenzó cuando decidimos darles respuesta.

El Índice Nacional de Participación Juvenil (INPJ) es una investigación científica y formal, realizada por Ollin, Jóvenes en Movimiento. El INPJ medirá el grado de participación de las personas de 15 a 29 años de edad en 5 espacios de incidencia (gobierno federal, universidades, partidos políticos, empresas y organizaciones no gubernamentales), en relación con 7 temas clave de la agenda: sustentabilidad ambiental; educación; equidad de género; derechos sexuales y reproductivos; promoción y defensa de los derechos humanos; empleo, emprendedurismo y autoempleo; y gobernabilidad y participación ciudadana.

¿Por qué nos parece relevante? Sencillo. Somos jóvenes y queremos participar. Nuestro sueño: hacer que otros jóvenes en México puedan potenciar sus esfuerzos para mejorar al país, en todos los sentidos.

¿Cómo le vamos a hacer? Les pedimos a representantes del gobierno a nivel federal, de las instituciones de educación superior, de las organizaciones de la sociedad civil, los partidos políticos y las micro, pequeñas y medianas empresas que nos compartan información sobre cuántos jóvenes están haciendo cosas en cada uno de ellos. Les preguntamos qué tipo de cosas hacen los jóvenes en los diferentes ámbitos. Con esta información, vamos a sacar conclusiones sobre qué tanto los jóvenes estamos apropiándonos de los espacios de incidencia en la agenda pública. En otras palabras, vamos a poder medir qué tanto los jóvenes estamos participando en la toma y operación de decisiones importantes en este país.

 ¿Y luego? Teniendo esa información, vamos a hacer propuestas de líneas de acción a todos los espacios de incidencia, para potenciar la participación de los jóvenes en México.  

 ¿Qué vamos a hacer con el Índice? Lo vamos a poner en línea para que todos lo puedan ver. ¿Quiénes son “todos”? “Todos” incluye a los jóvenes, a los adultos, a los maestros, a las instituciones de educación, a las organizaciones de la sociedad civil, a los grupos y colectivos, a los líderes de opinión, periodistas, bloggeros, a los padres de familia, a los legisladores, a los operadores y diseñadores de políticas públicas, al gobierno en su totalidad, a nuestros amigos y aliados.

 Entonces, ¿todos lo van a poder usar? Sí. El INPJ será un instrumento de libre acceso. Mientras más lo usen, mejor. El Índice se construye a partir de información que nos pertenece a todos. Queremos que todos puedan beneficiarse de los resultados.

 Para lograrlo, necesitamos de tu ayuda. En Ollin, tenemos millones de motivos para realizar este proyecto de investigación, pero queremos que compartas los tuyos con nosotros. Estamos valuando cada motivo en 13 pesos mexicanos (ó 1 dólar) y necesitamos alrededor de 100,000 buenos motivos para que el Índice llegue de nuestras mentes a las pantallas y manos de todos nosotros. ¡Échanos un empujoncito!

In Mexico, 50% of the population is under 26 years of age. There are around 30 million young people in our country. Statistics show that there are 8 million youngsters who do not have jobs or attend school regularly. People in Mexico are concerned about this. Nevertheless, simple math tells us there should therefore be at least 22 million youngsters who are getting involved in important stuff in our beloved country. We want to know about these people. Where are they? What are they doing to improve Mexico? What are their areas of interest? What moves them? Are they working, studying… making decisions on behalf of our nation? What are they involved in?

Ollin is a Mexican NGO. Founded and run by young people, we have been working throughout 2012 to answer a pretty basic question: What is the level of involvement that young people have in Mexico? It turns out that, in order to get this answer, one must first address some other questions, such as: Are young people participating in the government, within schools, are they starting businesses or working at / founding NGOs? Ollin’s quest began several months ago, when we decided we wanted to get the answers for all these queries.

Ergo, we created the National Youth Involvement Index Mexico (NYIIMx). This research project is designed to create ways of measuring the level of youth involvement in 5 areas of incidence (the Federal Government, universities, political parties, NGOs and small enterprises), with relation to 7 key agenda items: the environment, education, gender equality, the promotion and protection of human rights, employment and entrepreneurship, sexual and reproductive health and good governance.

Why is this relevant to us? Simple. We are young and want to participate. Our aim: to propell young people’s efforts throughout Mexico, in order to improve our nation.

How are we to achieve such goal? We are currently in the process of gathering information from the federal government, universities, local NGOs, parties and small businesses. We are asking them about young people within their organizations and the kind of actions they are orchestrating from these scenarios. With this information, we will build conclusions on how much youth are taking control of key spaces of incidence in Mexico.

OK, then what? Once we have this information, we are going to use it to create public policy proposals in order to foster youth involvement. Simple as that.

The NYIIMx will be available online so everyone can have access to it. By “everyone” we mean youth, grown-ups, teachers, universities, NGOs, civil society, journalists, opinion leaders, bloggers, parents, lawmakers, public policy designers and operators, the Federal and local branches of government, our friends and allies.

Let me get this straight. You’re saying every single person will be able to consult it? That’s right! The NYIIMx will be a public document. It will be built using public information, so it belongs to everyone. We want everyone to be able to profit from our findings.

For this to become true, we need your help. We already have a million motives to go all the way and have the Index made. But we want you to share your motives with us. We are valuing each of your motives in approximately 1 USD. This means we need around 100,000 motives to make our project real. We need your help to squeeze the NYIIMx from our brains and turn it into a readable document. Give us a little push forward!

story:
Short Summary

The campaign is for the donation of copies of the picture book REACHING FOR RAINBOWS to libraries in the United States. Neither myself or the illustrator will be making any royalties on this campaign as our main focus is to get the book into the hands of children.

Book Description:
Join Amelia, who is blind, as she shows her friend Betsy how she experiences all the colors of the rainbow. In return, Betsy helps Amelia experience a rainbow. The color-concept book teaches children a different way to experience colors. Ages 2-4.

What We Need & What You Get

ESTIMATED COST TO DONATE A BOOK TO A LIBRARY
Printing cost of book: $4.10
Shipping materials: $0.45
Postage: $1.70
Indiegogo/PayPal fees: $0.85
TOTAL COST FOR ONE BOOK: $7
 
We're seeking $1,000, which should get at least 142 book into libraries.

Please help us get this book into the hands of children. If you would like to preview the first few pages of the book before you make your decision, please go to http://utales.com/books/reaching-for-rainbows.
 
After you donate, I'll send an email asking for the names and cities of the libraries, as well as how you would like your name to appear on the book's donation label.

The Impact

By donating to this campaign, you'll be helping America's libraries by enriching their collections and helping them get the book into the hands of a child.
 
By getting this book in the hands of a child, you'll be helping them learn to see and experience the world in a different way.
 
By making this book available in libraries, you'll be helping not just one child, but many.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please spread the word. The more people who donate, the more books we'll be able to send to libraries. After all, people can't donate to the campaign, if they don't know about it.
 
PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS CAMPAIGN IS LIMITED TO UNITED STATES LIBRARIES BECAUSE OF COPYRIGHT, SHIPPING COSTS, ETC.
 
If you would like to donate to a library in another country, please use the contact form at HTTP://NESSAMORRIS.COM to let me know. We can discuss the best way to get the book into libraries in your country.
 
If you would like to purchase the book so that you may donate it in person at your library, or if you would like your own personal copy, please use my contact form to let me know and I can mail a copy to your US address for $7. You can also purchase off Amazon or my CreateSpace eStore, but both of those options are more expensive. (I can give a 50% off coupon code through CreateSpace, but even then you'd be paying $8.59 when you include shipping.)

Thank you so much for your support!

For each donation, a label will put inside inside the book to let the library know that you donated it. If you prefer not to select a library, I can select one for you. I will take a photo of the donation label with your name placed inside the book and email it to you.

story:
What is the Portland, Cascadia Zine and Resource Guide?

If you've seen a copy of the zine, consider helping get the next issue printed.

If you haven't seen it, please visit cascadia-pdx.org/zine to see last quarter's issue.

This is a new project by the Cascadia Branch, a group of bioregional advocates including students and community members working out of PSU.

By supporting this project you are helping others get ahold of the information and resources being offered in this zine and resource guide. Without funding, our circulation will stay very limited, if not solely online. 

Help us get this information into the hands of Portlanders who need this information most. If you loved it, please consider at least a $5 donation to get 2 more copies out there!

What does your donation cover?

Your generous donation covers the following:

$5 will allow us to print 2 copies

$10 will allow us to print 4 copies

$25 will allow us to print 10 copies

$50 will allow us to print 20 copies

All printing is done at the Independent Publisher's Resource Center and all paper is bought through small-scale paper stores in Portland, Cascadia. We will be sourcing as much 100% recycled paper is as possible. 

In order for dual power to succeed...

People need to know about alternatives. This zine and resource guide get them plugged in. Imagine if all Portlanders were connected through a network, all doing their part to create a resiliant Portland for the times ahead.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Share the online copy at cascadia-pdx.org/zine

If your friends tell you they really liked it, ask them to donate a few dollars to get more hard copies out into the world. 

Thank you!
