Short Summary

After the great depression, mafia, corruption, lawless-ness controlled governance in the US. The bulging middle class (aka "aam aadmi"s) frustrated with such a situation supported the rise of a visionary leader in JFK that set the stage for a massive transformation of politics and governance in the US - dreaming big ("put a man on the moon", "US has to be a super power") enabling US to become what it is today.

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is redefining politics in India. AAP has shown "aam aadmis" that wish to change the governance & politics can indeed transform India back to what our forefathers & freedom fighters envisioned.

Dr. Sudha Kiran, grandson of The Father of Economic Reforms in India Shri P. V. Narasimha Rao, is an educated, principled, doctor that spent most of his professional career working for non-profits like the American Red Cross, NTR Blood Bank for the improvement of lives of many common people. Inspired by the Anna Hazare movement, and later by the principles & vision of the Aam Aadmi Party, he has spent the last few years as a volunteer ... and has been nominated by the Aam Aadmi Party to be the MP Candidate from the Malkajgiri constituency in Telangana state.

Please support his candidature against the "old guard". Please donate any amount to help his campaign realize this vision of the true Swaraj for India!

Please "Like" our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/AAPkaSudhaKiran and please "Share" this link with your network.

By donating, I declare that I am an Indian citizen, above 18 years of age and am making this contribution voluntarily from legally earned personal funds. I also permit Aam Aadmi Party to communicate with me using my phone and/or email specified above. The particulars and statements made above are correct to the best of my knowledge and nothing has been concealed or withheld.

story:
Short Summary

We are in the process of developing an LGBT news and entertainment magazine for the Boise Area. We plan to include stories about local organizations and individuals who are pushing to make the Treasure Valley a safer and friendlier environment for the LGBT community,


What We Need & What You Get

OutBoise plans to be a magazine dedicated to educating, entertaining, and informing the local LGBT community. It will serve as a guiding influence to help promote a more positive lifestyle. It will also include a calendar of events, and feature LGBT entrepreneurs, political activists, and highlight community leaders striving to make the community a better place to live. We will offer this in print format, as well as digital. And we also hope to supplement it with a mobile application to keep people informed on the go.

Our current goal is to have our first issue of the magazine sent to print by November 20th, with a January 2nd release date. We hope that by releasing the publication at the turn of the new year will signify a positive change in the community, and will help to start a revolution.

We plan at the end of December, to hold a release party that will also serve as a community fundraiser and awards ceremony to highlight some of the community's hard working individuals who are striving to make a difference.

The first issue of the magazine will cost about $3,000 for 1,500 copies. 

We will offer advertising to local businesses and will highlight those who are LGBT friendly, as well.


Our current monthly costs are about $200 for web site & mobile app maintenance. We are hoping to expand further out, including monthly events in the community to help raise brand awareness. We also want to develop our marketing strategy to increase our public visibility.


    The Impact

    We hope, through both of these projects, to help the community become a more positive place to live in. These two projects work in tandem to show a better community, raise people up and breathe life back into a community that has fallen far behind others in our nation. So many people have lost faith in the LGBT community here in Boise, and we seek to challenge this and show we are far better people than we see ourselves, and the way others see us.

      Risks & Challenges

      Our greatest challenge so far has been gaining funding for printing our first issue and continuing maintenance of our online services. 

      This project has currently been put together on a volunteer basis, but we would like to be able to push to make sure those involved can start generating income. 

      With a lack of funding, currently, we risk not meeting our current deadlines, and our fundraiser set for December for TCC - The Community Center may not be able to be held. 


        Other Ways You Can Help

        You can donate to help fund us, spread the word to potential advertisers, or share our page on Facebook to help spread awareness for this exciting project.

story:
BLEED THROUGH, by Ayin Weaver, (published October, 2013) is less than a year old, but already getting rave reviews by members of the LGBT, women's, metaphysical/spiritual, educational and therapeutic communities. And people are asking for more! So I have begun a sequel, while still in the process of getting Bleed Through out as an ebook and audio book. That is where you, dear Indiegogo campaign supporter come in. I need your help to see my first novel, Bleed Through become available to a wider audience and help me get the second novel (a sequel to be named soon) off the ground.

Your highly appreciated contributions will go to design costs, the nuts and bolts costs of creating an ebook and audio edition of Bleed Through. In addition, I will utilize the resources to promote the book in its various formats through, social media, a professional website and advertising in literary venues.

The funds will also be applied to working with an editor on the second novel. One of the most valuable resources I had in the success of the Bleed Through was the expertise of my editors. My editor and friend, the late Annie O'Flaherty made all the difference in the world. She approached the work with her keen eye for specificity, her perceptive attention to detail. I feel her influence as readers describe their vivid connection to the characters. Kemari Howell, a thorough developmental editor and Cris Wanzer, line editor, gave me new eyes and improved my craft, as well. As I begin this next book, I look forward to having the resources to adequately pay the talented editors I need.

I hope if you haven't yet read Bleed Through, or know a friend for whom this book may make the perfect gift, you take this opportunity to contribute to my campaign and get a copy as a perk.No contribution is too small.

About my first novel:

BLEED THROUGH, is a story of our connected humanity. An affirmation of love and courage, it holds a mirror up to the face of our collective consciousness, with an opportunity to reflect on the absurdity of prejudice.

When eccentric artist, Rita Kerner, can no longer tolerate strange night voices, she is determined to find the answer to her haunting situation. The solution is not what she expects. No sooner does she seek help, than she finds herself in a fight for her freedom. Will a coincidental meeting unlock Rita's unique artistic gift, the esoteric key to her sanity and survival.

Bleed Through paints a picture of four diverse families winding their way through 200 years of history. From the outset of this intriguing novel, the clues connecting Rita to the other compelling characters foreshadow surprising events and thought-provoking twists of fate. What unfolds is pure magic.

Lesbian, gay and heterosexual characters from ethnically diverse backgrounds are the stars of this entertaining, poignant and romantic tale. Available on Amazon.com and at local independent book stores.

About The Sequel-(yet to be named)

The sequel finds the main character, Rita Kerner and her partner embarking on a trip across the country to live on the West Coast.  But before she goes, there is a matter she must clear up. There seems to be someone with her name and her face-- a look alike turning up just before her, wherever she goes. Like the first book there are many characters of diverse multi-ethnic and cultural backgrounds living in places across continents and during times encompassing other centuries--their  lives overlapping in mysterious and surprising ways. Prepare to be thrilled and delighted--you will laugh and cry again with this upcoming, novel of magical realism. Publication date anticipated for 2015.

And finally....Thank you so much for your contribution. I hope if you cannot contribute you will help me get the word out about my campaign and about the book, Bleed Through, a book that I wrote to bring more love and light into the world. After all isn't that what art does--what we artists do--every time we sing a song that moves the heart, write a book that makes us feel and think, paint a picture that opens eyes --we bring more light into our world. Thank you again.

story:
Short Summary

I am a poet and the author of me and Nina, a 2010 Kinereth Gensler manuscript award that published in January. At 58, me and Nina is my debut poetry collection, a milestone I have been working towards for a very long time.  In March, I ran an Indie Go Go campaign to attend the Association of Writers and Writing Programs (AWP) conference in Chicago. Copies of “me and Nina” sold out at the conference and I made numerous contacts.

I now have another amazing opportunity for me and Nina: a reading at the Keats Festival and performance with the award-winning flautist, Keith Waithe whose musical style is a fusion of jazz, classical, African, Caribbean, Asian and Western influences. During the festival, I will also give a short talk about poetry.

The festival is held at the Keats House in Hampstead, north London, where the poet John Keats (1795-1821) lived from 1818 to 1820, and is the setting that inspired some of his most memorable poetry, including Ode to a Nightingale.

The Keats Festival, held this year from May 28 - June 10,  is a free public event and although one of the organizers has offered me a place to stay, they cannot pay my airfare or provide per diem. I will be paid a small honorarium that will not cover my travel expenses and is not paid until several weeks after the event.  They will also sell "me and Nina," at the festival and include my participation in press materials promoting the festival.

What We Need & What You Get

My campaign goal is $2700. If I reach my goal, I can expect to receive an estimated $2511. This would cover airfare and baggage fees from New York to London, food, ground transportation and incidental expenses. Any funds I am unable to raise, I will attempt to borrow. I am also seeking other reading and network opportunities while I am in London. 

What you get:  writing services (see perks), my extreme gratitude, and the opportunity to help give voice to a collection of poems that speaks to  "what happens to a dream deferred" and  the resilency of the human spirit to survive in the face of adversity.

Go to "Made by Hand" facebook page to view my hand made books.

The Impact

During the Keats Festival, the opportunity exists for me and Nina to be heard by thousands.  With this call I also have the chance to reach out and give back to fellow writers and readers of poetry and expand the awareness of African American poetry in Great Britain. Participating at the Keats Festival could lead to additional engagements and creative collaborations.

Writing for "The Library Journal," Karla Huston states that the collection, "...gives readers poems in concert and communion with soul great Nina Simone--like "two souls in a duet." While Simone's songs are a fusion of gospel, pop, and classical music, Hand's poems are a fusion of free verse, blues, torch songs, and songs of the tortured, many with formal elements and many cases using her own original forms...These poems deal with hard times, poverty, violence, the abuse of power, and abused dreams."   

In his blog, Alan King quotes the poet Elizabeth Alexander, “These poems are unsentimental, blood red, and positively true, note for note, like the singing of Nina Simone herself.”  He writes poets Terrance Hayes and Tyehimba Jess also agree. “She [Monica Hand] shifts dynamically through voices and forms homemade, received and re-imagined to conjure the music (and Muses) of art and experience,” writes Hayes.

After reading me and Nina, I felt that Jess best summed up this collection. “Monica A. Hand sings us a crushed velvet requiem of Nina Simone.” Whoa! That’s the best way to put it. “She plumbs Nina’s mysterious blues line while recounting the scars of her own overcoming,” Jess continued. “Hand joins the chorus of shouters like Patricia Smith and Wanda Coleman in this searchlight of a book, bearing her voice like a torch for all we’ve gained and lost in the heat of good song.”

Read King’s entire blog post at http://alanwking.com/2012/02/19/monica-hands-me...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand some people just can’t contribute. I also appreciate your positive thoughts in manifesting safe travels and success for "me and Nina."

Please help me spread the word and share this campaign with your friends.

story:
Allow me to introduce myself.

My name is Angela García-Sermeño, and I am traveling to Greece in July with the Southwestern College Concert Choir to perform at the Festival of the Aegean. I have been singing with the SWC Concert Choir since fall 2011, coincidentally the same semester that I began to pursue creative writing as more than a hobby.

When the opportunity to travel with the choir arose, immediately I knew I’d be documenting the trip with as much writing and photography as possible. However, when considering the means in which this documentation would be shared, I was struck with the reality of not owning a working camera or computer. Sure, I can return to the nostalgia of letter-writing, carry along my sketch pad, or invest in a carrier pigeon, but blogging seems much more effective for both writer and audience these days.

With your contributions, I’m hoping to purchase a tablet and camera before leaving for Greece so that I can run a respectable blog while there. The more contributions I receive, the richer my blog will be, as I’ll be able to spend the few dollars I’ve saved to enjoy the culture outside the hotel. (If not, I shall be confined to surviving on food stashed from the continental breakfast buffet.)

Everybody wins.

I’m requesting $500 because it’s the minimum amount required on this website, but really $500 will be just enough for a decent tablet and camera. As if the promises of my blog were not enough – hello, you’re going to be viewing gorgeous photos of Greece and reading about my adventures in another country – I’m offering perks* that are worth every penny of your donation: BAKED GOODS. For those who know me, you know what kind of treats to expect. For those who have not had the pleasure, take a gander at the “perks” collage. I craft gourmet cupcakes and other goodies, usually based on a simple recipe and embellished by my experience and good taste. ;-)

  • $10 -- For a ten-dollar donation, you can choose from the following:
    • Half dozen brownies or blondies (plain or specialty upon request)
    • Half dozen 3-inch cookies (chocolate chip, peanut butter, or snickerdoodle)
  • $25 -- For a twenty-five dollar donation, you can choose from the following:
    • One dozen gourmet cupcakes
      • Apple spice cupcakes with cream cheese frosting and candied ginger
      • S’more cupcakes (chocolate or vanilla cake with marshmallow frosting, chocolate ganache, and graham cracker topping)
    • A gourmet confection of equal value as the gourmet cupcakes. (Be creative, and I’ll do my best to honor your requests.)
  • $50 -- For a fifty-dollar donation, I’ll make you a birthday or holiday cake (9x13, double-layer 8-inch round, or bundt) or two dozen gourmet cupcakes.
  • $100 -- For a hundred-dollar donation, I’ll create something spectacular for you. Here are some possibilities based on the cakes that I’ve made for my family, whom I credit with inspiring such delectable masterpieces.
    • Tres leches cake with caramel, whipped cream filling, and chocolate ganache exterior
    • Tiramisu cake (vanilla cake steeped in coffee liqueur and filled/frosted with mascarpone cream)
    • Banana cake with peanut butter filling/frosting, sliced bananas, milk chocolate glaze, and salted peanuts
    • Strawberry cake with macerated berry filling, cream cheese frosting, and fresh berry glaze
    • Chocolate stout cake with Irish cream frosting and whiskey ganache

Because I will be abroad in July, I can deliver your requests beginning August 1st. Please send me an additional email message with the specifics of your order, and we can arrange the details together. angela.garciasermeno@gmail.com

*Perks are limited to San Diego residents due to the delicate quality and freshness of the cupcakes. However, I have successfully sent homemade cookies cross-country, so if you live outside San Diego or wish to send them as a gift, we can discuss cookies via email and set up a special order (no extra shipping charges). :-)

“Experience, travel – these are as education in themselves.” -Euripides

The primary reason I decided to go on this trip is because traveling teaches me more than I ever anticipate. Until this past academic year, I’d never planned to travel to another country with a choir, had such a keen interest in writing about my travels, or been seriously considering graduate school. Already I’m learning more about myself, and I can’t wait to see what lies ahead!

Back in 2005, I earned my bachelors degree in English and Spanish from the University of San Diego and have since enjoyed working as a writing tutor at Southwestern College. After eight years of reading student papers and interactively exploring the many routes to refining a draft, I confess that my commitment to helping others with their writing has transformed into a personal love for writing my own creations.

Now, I’m experimenting with a variety of writing projects that will enhance my portfolio as I prepare for grad school and understand my writing style, and while I do post on Tumblr from time to time, I have never attempted a robust, ongoing blog. In short, this travel blog is an academic and social endeavor that could profoundly shape my future in writing. And just think: I’d have you to thank for it!

Tell your friends.

I can’t stand when I want to donate to a good cause but don’t have the funds, and maybe you feel the same way. First of all, no amount is too small. Secondly, if you want to gain one of the bigger perks, might I suggest pooling the money together among a few friends? Finally, if you are unable to contribute at this time, please spread the word to anyone who may be interested in the perks and/or the blog. Indiegogo has these neat tools (just below the “perks” collage) that make sharing -- forgive the cliché -- a piece of cake. ;-)

story:
My Story

I’m a fantasy author living just outside Toronto, Canada. In 2010 and 2011, my short stories placed back to back in the Writers’ Journal annual Fiction Contest, and were published in the magazine. Encouraged by my success, I decided to forgo the crazy/frustrating/tedious process of submitting to traditional publishers, and enter the world of self-publishing. (Which is a whole other crazy process, but I don’t regret it for a minute!)

In addition to my stand-alone short stories, I’ve also created The World of Lasniniar Series. It’s a combination of epic fantasy novels and short story adventures, with elves, dwarves, dragons, magic, and even the occasional vampire. They have a Lord of the Rings feel, but they’re much faster paced, and more action oriented, with lots of battles and snarky/sarcastic dialogue.

If you want to check out some of the series titles, Legacy Hunter (A Tale of Lasniniar) is currently available for free, and Soul Seeker (A Novel of Lasniniar) will be on sale through July at Smashwords for 100% off.


Smashwords coupon code: SSWIN

(Sale lasts from 12:01 am July 1st to 11:59 pm July 31st Pacific Time)

 

The series is gaining ground, and I want to keep the momentum going by releasing Storm Rider. I try to keep costs down by doing as much of the publishing side of things myself as possible. I’ve already done the cover design and book trailer for Storm Rider, and I do all of my own book formatting as well.

Of course, there are things I really can’t/shouldn’t do myself, like professional proofreading. Plus, there are other fun little administrative things, like ordering inventory, copyright registration, setting up extended paperback distribution, etc. It all adds up. This is where I’m hoping you can help me out…

 

About Storm Rider

Storm Rider is the latest novel in the Lasniniar series. It's going to tie all the previous books together. The first draft has just been completed, and it’s currently 113,000 words. If you’re into book trailers, you can check out the one for Storm Rider here.


And here’s the book blurb for those who aren’t book trailer fans:

The elves think the years of terror and darkness are finally over.

They believe they have already witnessed the worst evil the world has ever known.

When Iarion senses a growing malice in the uncharted south, his people think him a fool for seeking it out.

They couldn’t be more wrong.

 

Storm Rider will be released in both ebook and paperback format. If everything goes according to plan, I should be able to put it out in September.

 

What’s the deal with Indiegogo?

Indiegogo is a crowd funding site. Independent authors and other creative types offer perks in exchange for your contribution. Indiegogo offers two different campaign options: Fixed or Flexible.

I’ve decided to go with a Flexible campaign. This means I will receive all of the funds raised by my deadline, even if I don’t hit my goal. One of the main reasons I went this way was to enable the option to contribute directly with a credit card, instead of being limited to Paypal. I wanted to make as many different payment choices available as possible.

The perks will be delivered to you after the campaign is over, and when I have all of the materials ready to send out. This will likely end up being late August/early September for the electronic materials, and September/October (depending on how fast the post office is, and how far away you live) for anything physical that needs to be mailed. You will receive updates from me along the way.

This is my first campaign, so I’ve tried to set a modest goal. If we do manage to go over, the extra funds will go toward forthcoming books in the Lasniniar series.

Every little bit helps. Even if you can share a link to this campaign to help get the word out, I would really appreciate it! (There are some handy tools for this right under the video above.) If there is anything you would like to see added to the perk list, let me know. I’m open to suggestions. :)

 

Thanks so much for your support!

Storm Rider will be released in both ebook and paperback format. If everything goes according to plan, I should be able to put it out in September.
 
What’s the deal with Indiegogo?
Indiegogo is a crowd funding site. Independent authors and other creative types offer perks in exchange for your contribution. Indiegogo offers two different campaign options: Fixed or Flexible.
I’ve decided to go with a Flexible campaign. This means I will receive all of the funds raised by my deadline, even if I don’t hit my goal. One of the main reasons I went this way was to enable the option to contribute directly with a credit card, instead of being limited to Paypal. I wanted to make as many different payment choices available as possible.
The perks will be delivered to you after the campaign is over, and when I have all of the materials ready to send out. This will likely end up being late August/early September for the electronic materials, and September/October (depending on how fast the post office is, and how far away you live) for anything physical that needs to be mailed. You will receive updates from me along the way.
This is my first campaign, so I’ve tried to set a modest goal. If we do manage to go over, the extra funds will go toward forthcoming books in the Lasniniar series.
Every little bit helps. Even if you can share a link to this campaign to help get the word out, I would really appreciate it! (There are some handy tools for this right under the video above.) If there is anything you would like to see added to the perk list, let me know. I’m open to suggestions. :)
 
Thanks so much for your support!

story:
Dear Friends

If you were to travel the world, you would quickly come to realize that the vast majority of humanity has the same list of wants and needs: food, shelter, water, education, justice and safety, to name a few. Our joys and sorrows, hopes and desperations are also very similar in many ways.

Even though it sometimes justifies our personal paradigm to believe differently, WE ARE ALL FUNDAMENTALLY THE SAME. If at the core we all seem to be the same, why then is it that we are collectively having such a hard time? Essentially, this last question is what inspired my desire to write this book. The purpose of the book is threefold: to bring about an awareness of the current situation on the planet so that people can start to question their current paradigm and see how they feed into the problems rather than help solve them; to encourage a new level of personal responsibility that is necessary in times of change; and provide information and tools to help in the transformational process by empowering people.

The content of the book comes from decades of observations and experiences gained by living and working in more than nine different countries, visiting over sixty countries spread on five continents, and having a love, a passion and ultimately, a belief that humanity has the power to choose to create a better life for all.

This need for a better life for all has never been as apparent as it is now. Our collective denial of the reality of suffering is being confronted. We are starting to realize that there is no choice but to deal with it: problems are not going away but rather, they seem to be multiplying exponentially. Perhaps we live in times where it has become luxurious thinking to believe that someone else will fix the environment, the economy, social injustices, international conflicts, human trafficking, or poverty.

It is time for greatness on a mass level to be expressed. This book is meant to appeal to your heart more than your mind, thus 'Revolution of the heart'. The expression ‘analyzing something to death’ couldn’t be more appropriate than now. Will we die as a species because of our mind’s obsession for analysis or will our hearts see through the smoke, put out the fires so that at some point, hopefully sooner than later, the mind will be able to see clearly through its confusion.

Ultimately, the question is how will we individually and collectively deal with the problems currently facing humanity?

There are countless ways one can contribute to the betterment of the world. It always starts with people taking one small step to make a difference. It starts with YOU! Never underestimate the power that one person has to change the world. I invite you to join me in the publication of this work. Ideally, I see the realization of this project as a collaborative effort, to be infused with the energies of many. So how can I help you ask? 

Here’s how you can help!

Here are ways in which you can help in this project! Remember that the overarching project is to create a better world, in which this book project is meant to play a small, yet important part!

  • If you can’t contribute financially, please use the indiegogo share tools to ‘like’ this project through your various social network affiliations. The more ‘likes’ the project gets, the more chances the project has to be showcased as one of indiegogo’s specially chosen projects, giving it more exposure. Every little bit adds to become a lot in the end!
  • Contribute through adding a positive and uplifting comment to the comment section. Share your belief and passion in humanity’s ability to effectively deal with the issues we are all currently facing! A kind word is often just what people need to hear!
  • Contribute financially according to your ability to do so. Alongside are options you can choose from.
  • You have a great idea that you feel the need to share, send me an email! This book is certainly not the last project aligned with doing my part on making the world a better place. Great ideas shared can sometimes become very powerful tools for change. From these great ideas, we can create global communities that can be a voice for change. Remember that everything started with an idea!
  • Ultimately, more than anything, YOU BE THE CHANGE through your kindness, compassion and understanding towards yourself and others.

The purpose of raising these funds is to cover the following:

  • Editorial costs
  • Graphic design costs
  • Software costs
  • Formatting costs (for eBook version and paperback version)
  • Legal costs (copyrighting, ISBN and book in print registration)
  • Primary print copies
  • Compensation to contributors (including shipping costs as needed)
  • Marketing costs
  • Administration fees to indiegogo

Should the amount raised exceed the goal, all funds will be used purely for creating more projects that are aligned with making the world a better place. For example:

  • Create an audio version of the book to cater to visually impaired people
  • Translation of the book in other languages
  • Creation of vignettes to help empower people further
  • Creation of a documentary enlisting students throughout the world to comment on ‘The role of youth in a changing world’.
  • And so much more!

The bottom line is that the more money there is, the more can be done! Although I feel that some of the rewards may not be as exciting as what is offered in other projects, keep in mind that the true reward for any type of contribution is the fact that you have contributed in making the world a better place!

The YouTube links on this project are examples of how one preson can change the world! Make sure to watch them and get inspired!

story:
Summary

We want to feature the creative power of the author. To see what ideas and tales can be found in the span of 100 words. We publish all forms of science fiction, all moods, and varieties from a diverse group of writers, offering .10 a word for payment. We will publish and feature both new and established authors once a week starting out, but hope with the help of this campaign to be more frequent than that. We want to show off the power of the form while celebrating both genre and author.

Our year begins in August and we intend on publishing each week. After our first year, we will collect the stories published in the year prior and put out an anthology which will be available in ebook, audiobook, and print. 

What do we need funding for?

We would like to raise funds to help us get through the first year and double the frequency of our publishing schedule, allowing us to open another submission window. If you enjoy science fiction, micro-fiction, or just want to help out, please help support our magazine's goals of paying the authors professional rates.  Additionally, the more we raise will allow us to purchase more than one story a week. If we surpass our goal, we will be able to publish two or more stories per week,

Risks and Challenges

There are minimal risks. We will publish the magazine regardless of the support we receive. However, we hoped to gain support from the community to help alleviate the financial burden of starting out a magazine. With your support, we can get things off the ground.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute, but still want to help out, please spread the word. Word of mouth is powerful, and we want people passionate about the form in our corner. Please share our magazine and its goals with your social circles.
